He started this business to cater to his family's increasing demands. He desires to educate his children and construct a house for his family. However, weather vagaries, especially the prolonged dry season, pose a challenge to his business.

Patrick is seeking a loan to plow and weed his garden this season.

loans.use: to plow and weed his garden.

loans.name: Bernardete

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Província de Gaza tem 38 anos de idade vive maritalmente mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 1 menor de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pelo seu empregado que vive em sua casa.
É Operaria Agrícola a mais de 9 anos onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na sua obra.  Solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade como: arroz, feijão, amendoim, peixe e mais. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura para transportar os alunos e contrair matrimónio.
texts.en:
Bernardete comes from the province of Gaza. She's 38 years old and in a common law marriage. She has five children, one of whom is underage. All her children are in school. She's responsible for her employee who lives with her.
She has been a farm worker for over nine years and uses her earnings to pay for household expenses and for the costs of her construction work. She's requesting a loan so she can increase turnover in her business. She sells products that are household staples such as rice, beans, fish, etc. This is her third loan with Hluvuku.
In the future she intends to acquire a vehicle for transporting schoolchildren. She also intends to get married.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, peanuts, fish, etc.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 37 years old and married to Omache. She supports four family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last nine years, and the business earns her an income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase farm tools and implements for farming so as to increase her agricultural produce and to meet client and family needs.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to expand her agricultural sector. Her hope is to be financially stable and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm tools and implements for farming so as to increase her agricultural produce

loans.name: Freymen

texts.es: Freymen,  tiene la edad  de 25 años, está soltero,  vive con sus hermanos y sus padres, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unas plantas de almácigo de café y de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra, además pagar mano de obra en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del cultivo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Freymen is 25 years old, is single, and lives with his siblings and parents, who are his greatest priority. With his loan he intends to purchase coffee plants, fertilizer, and other products to cultivate the land, and to pay for the labor required to put down the products and attend to the plantation, ensuring the job is done well. He plans to take advantage of the region's good climate and soil, and also put into practice his many years of experience cultivating coffee. 

Additionally, buying better quality products for his plantation will bring him good health and development, as well as a sufficient harvest in the short term. He hopes to invest the income from the harvest in his family's education and well-being, some family goals, and in future cultivation. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR, nor has he received other loans from state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the most ease and lowest interest rates.

loans.use: to sow and attend to coffee.

loans.name: Geza Group

texts.en:
Muye, who is in his mid 30's, is married with two sons.  One of his sons is at school and the other one is still small.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years now.  He works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Muye’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase his genge stock, which is now serving more people.  He has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, for loan repayment, and for covering household expenses.  

He will use this loan to restock the items in his genge business.  He dreams of being an international businessman.

Muye will share this loan with his loan group, Geza, which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the genge business and meet his customers's demand.

loans.name: Alone

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Zambézia tem 53 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 5 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É proprietário de uma escolinha onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com intuito expandir seu negócio, solícita um empréstimo para adquirir uma electrobomba para o uso no seu sistema de abastecimento de água. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende expandir mais no seu trabalho de educador da infância, desenvolver o seu projecto sustentável para o desenvolvimento das crianças e erguer estrutura de abastecimento de água.
texts.en:
Alone comes from the province of Zambézia. He's 53 years old and in a common law marriage. He has five underage children who are all in school. He's not responsible for anyone else.
He owns a daycare center and he uses his earnings to pay for household expenses. In the hopes of expanding his business, he's requesting a loan so that he can purchase an electric pump to use in his water supply system. This is his third loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to further expand his work as a kindergarten teacher, develop his sustainable project for the children's development and set up a water supply system.

loans.use: to purchase an electric pump.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Bano is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years with her husband. Bano is motivated to provide her family with a better standard of living. 

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. 

She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Yesenia Carolina

texts.es:
Yesenia, es una madre que tiene que cuidar de un hijo de un año de edad, solo vive con su hijo, manifiesta no tener familiares en el extranjero, para poder costear los gastos de su hijo y los personales ella se dedica a trabajar en su negocio que es la venta de pupusas y ropa, tiene 3 años de desarrollar está actividad y el negocio se lo enseño su madre.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar una plancha nueva y con mayor capacidad para aumentar la producción de pupusas, adquirirá un mejor equipo para atender con mayor rapidez a sus clientes, de esta manera las posibilidades de tener nuevos ingresos es mayor.
Yesenia desea tener la experiencia suficiente con créditos para aumentar sus ganancias y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a mother who has to take care of her one-year-old son. She lives only with her son, and says she doesn't have any family abroad. To be able to pay for her child's expenses and her own personal ones, she works in her business of selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) and clothes. She has been doing this for the past 3 years, and her mother taught her the trade.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a new griddle with a larger capacity so she can increase the production of pupusas; with this better equipment she would be able to serve her customers more quickly, and the possibilities of having a higher income would be greater.

Yesenia wishes to have the sufficient experience with loans so she can increase her earnings and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy a new griddle with a larger capacity so she can increase the production of pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas); with this better equipment she would be able to serve her customers more quickly.

loans.name: Dinis

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacase Província de Gaza tem 65 anos de idade é casado oficialmente é pai de 3 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus cunhados que estão em Xai-Xai enviando lhe dinheiro mensalmente. 
É agricultor a mais de 10 anos, explora uma área de 5 hectares. Solicita o empréstimo para aumentar volume da sua produção na machamba adquirindo adubos e viveiros de repolho. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende iniciar a criação de frangos e suínos para a venda. O seu maior desafio é conquistar novo mercado para a venda dos seus produtos da machamba.
texts.en:
Dinis comes from Manjacase, province of Gaza. He's 65 years old and officially married. He has three adult children. He takes responsibility for his brothers-in-law who live in Xai-Xai by sending them money on a monthly basis.
He has been a farmer for over 10 years and he works on a 5-hectare area. He's requesting the loan so that he can increase production levels on his farm by purchasing compost and cabbage greenhouses. This is his 5th loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to start raising chickens and pigs for selling. His biggest challenge is conquering new markets to sell his farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase compost and cabbage greenhouses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase four cartons of raw fish for her fish business

loans.name: Femi Turner Group

texts.en:
Dankay is a 46-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of Femi Turner solidarity group. Femi Turner solidarity group has four members who are all women. Dankay sells foodstuff like beans, rice, onions, and other items.

Dankay has been in this foodstuff business for the past four years. She opens her business six days in a week from 9 am to 6 pm. 

Dankay established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profit she gets from her business. Dankay is the one with the white t-shirt in the picture.

Dankay and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) of which Dankay is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy bags of beans, onions, rice and other items for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Dankay is married and has four children with the ages of 15, 13, 9 and 6 years who are all school-going children.

In the future, Dankay plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education and to expand her business. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Dankay and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of beans, onions, rice and other items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow as well as dairy feeds and hay for her dairy cows

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 49 and is married with four children, all attend school. He owns a retail shop, but raises extra income through poultry and coffee farming. He started this business to generate income for his family. Bad weather and poultry diseases like chicken pox are a hindrance to his business yet he dreams of expanding his poultry farm to achieve big returns. 

Simon will use the loan to buy more chicks for his poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy chicks for his poultry farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a fridge to use to better his business.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 23-year-old single man who started four years ago working in a company to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man and hard worker who is trying hard to improve his living conditions.

Today, Omar is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open his own computer shop business. This loan is very important to Omar for it will help him work independently and improve his living conditions. He hopes to manage his shop well and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to open his own computer shop business

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su hijo y su esposa, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas para hacer la reparación de su vehículo de trabajo, el cual es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Luis Antonio, who is 21 years old, cohabits with his son and wife, who are his priority. With this loan, he intends to purchase spare parts to repair his work vehicle, which is of great importance to move materials used in farm work. With this purchase, he hopes to be able to repair his vehicle and have the materials on time, so the crops will be attended to in the required time. It is the first loan he receives from FUDECOSUR. He hadn’t received any loans before from national banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him a loan with easier terms and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to repair a work vehicle.

loans.name: Jorame

texts.en:
Jorame is a 36-year-old male. He is married with three children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy materials for making ladies' and men's suits, and he managed to reap good profits.

Jorame offers tailoring services to the community. He maintains his dream of buying a business vehicle to help him in marketing his products to the people around his area. However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital to buy enough material for his customers. 

Jorame intends to use the loan to buy material for making uniforms, targeting the available market as the term begins.

loans.use: to buy material for making uniforms, targeting the available market as the term begins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening at the farm.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis used the previous loan to buy materials for making men's and ladies’ suits for selling. 

Francis is 33 years old and married with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Francis offers tailoring services by making men’s and ladies’ suits, plus school uniforms. 

Francis has a dream of buying land for building a residential house and farming. However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital to buy clothing material on time. Francis is seeking credit to buy more materials for making men’s and ladies’ suits for selling.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making men's and ladies' suits for selling.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old lady who is married with seven children. She is living in Kasese, Uganda. Jane operates a retail shop of general merchandise. She has been in that business for four years.  

She began the business in order to look after her family. She gets additional income from selling second-hand clothes. She has a dream of educating her children and becoming rich, despite being faced with challenges of limited capital and price fluctuations.

Jane requests a loan to buy more soap, sugar, maize flour, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, maize flour, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana de  46 años de edad vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace muchos años, y junto a ella habitan sus 3 hijos dos mayores de edad de 19 y 21 años y un menor de 16 años de edad, a los que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Ana se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir para adultos y niños, desde hace 25 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y amabilidad cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus servicios a diario. Ana se encuentra preocupada, ya que junto a su vivienda se encuentra un talud de tierra que ella teme ceda en el próximo invierno, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención que le permite proteger su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mayor seguridad a sus hijos que son lo más importante para ella.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old and has owned her own home for many years.  She lives with her 3 children, 2 adults who are 19 and 21 and one minor who is 16.  She has been able to improve their lives as a single mother.  Ana has made a living making clothing for adults and children for 25 years.  Thanks to her experience and friendly attitude, she has many clients who request her services daily.  

Ana is anxious because there is a slope next to her home, and she is afraid that it will collapse during the next winter.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a retaining wall that will allow her to protect her home and therefore provide more security to her children, who are the most important thing in her life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a retaining wall to protect her home

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
Madrine is 42 years old. She has four children. She operates a bar and lodges, a business she began to sustain her family and to educate her children. 

She will use the loan to buy a new music system for the bar; this she hopes will attract many customers to her business. Her dream is to grow her business to a better standard. Her challenge is price fluctuations and clients who take drinks on credit. 

She is hardworking and sees herself expanding to out-compete other similar businesses.

loans.use: To buy a music system to boost the bar business

loans.name: Yama's Group

texts.fr: Yama qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, assis sur la chaise, est membre d’un groupe de 16 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mamissa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Yama, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 20 à 45 ans.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Yama à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Yama cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Yama entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Yama effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Yama cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Yama planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter du matériel agricole telle qu’une charrue avant de commencer le semis. Enfin Yama espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Yama, sitting in a chair in the middle of the photo,  is a member of a group of 16 farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Mamissa, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 60 years old and the mother of seven children, aged 20 to 45. 

Yama is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she has been encouraged to do this work for 40 years. She grows peanuts and rice on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain, farm equipment, and quality fertilizers.

Yama is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up with the view of increasing her yields through the services offered by myAgro. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her 0.0625-hectare parcel of land. 

Yama has been growing peanuts for ten years for their value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a sauce base in cooking. Peanuts also have commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market.

With greater yields and higher income, Yama is planning on buying farm equipment, such as a plow, before the start of sowing. Ultimately, Yama hopes also to ensure the family’s self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to procure a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts and to benefit from myAgro farm training and techniques

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire to repair her kitchen and her home

loans.name: Martha Concepcion

texts.es: Martha de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, comercializa los cerdos en todo el año en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de un lote de 8 cerdos para continuar con la crianza y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband.  She has made a living raising pigs for 2 years.  She sells the pigs throughout the year in the surrounding towns.  She already has a base of loyal customers.

She is requesting a loan to buy 8 pigs to continue with her pig raising business and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to buy 8 pigs

loans.name: Latifu

texts.en: Latifu lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man who loves having a stable source of income; hence he started up a hotel business. In order to supplement his business he ventured into motorcycle riding for transport. He is seeking a credit facility to buy more raw food like rice and posho to cook.

loans.use: to buy more raw food like rice and posho to cook.

loans.name: Moutou's Group

texts.fr: Moutou qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, la deuxieme personne de la gauche vers la droite , est membre d’un groupe de 26 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Oure au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Moutou, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 25 à 38 ans.  L'agriculture qui lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ainsi que son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Moutou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Moutou cultive l'arachide, le mais, l'haricot sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles. Moutou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Moutou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 3 ans que Moutou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Moutou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d’acheter des bœufs et une charrue.
texts.en:
Moutou, who is the second person from left to right in the first row of the photo, is a member of a group of 26 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Oure, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

60-year-old Moutou is the mother of three children from 25 to 38 years of age. Crop farming to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency, and being married to a farmer, both prompted Moutou to practice this activity for over 20 years.

Moutou cultivates groundnuts, maize, and  beans on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of agricultural equipment.

Moutou is entering her first year with myAgro, and applied because of the prospect of increasing her crop yields through services offered by myAgro, and the myAgro agents' belief in the benefits of the myAgro method.

This year Moutou is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the crop yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot (0.15 acres).

For the past three years Moutou has been cultivating groundnuts for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet, but also for its commercial value, since she sells groundnuts at the market.

With increasing crop yields and income, Moutou intends to buy oxen and a plow.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 68 years of age and married with 10 children. He is a dealer in the cocoa business who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He earns extra income from pension earnings since he reached  retirement age. He started the business fifteen years ago. He has requested a loan to buy cocoa beans to sell and clear his gardens. His future plans are educating his children to higher institutions of learning although just like other cocoa dealers he meets a difficulty of the business being seasonal.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans to sell and clear his gardens.

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr: Fanta qui se trouve sur la photo étant juste devant dans la chaise avec un sourire, est membre d’un groupe de 6 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mamissa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Fanta, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 20 à 45 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. Elle a exprimé, "c'est la pauvreté qui m'a fait productrice et le regard des autres travailleuses." Fanta à exercer l'agriculture depuis maintenant 50 ans. Fanta cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Fanta entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison des semences de qualité et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Fanta effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Fanta cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Fanta planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu d'avoir la productivité, parce que, "nous serons contente ainsi que la famille." Enfin Fanta espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Fanta, the person sitting in the front and wearing a smile, is a member of a group of six crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Mamissa, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

60-year-old Fanta is the mother of five children from 20 to 45 years of age, one of whom currently attends school. She says "Poverty and the looks given by other workers made me become a producer". Fanta has been crop farming now for over 50 years.

Fanta cultivates groundnuts and rice on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment and quality fertilizers.

Fanta is entering her first year with myAgro, and enrolled because of the quality of seeds and fertilizers, and the myAgro agents' belief in the benefits of the myAgro method.

This year Fanta is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the crop yield on her 0.5 hectare plot (1.24 acres).

For the past 50 years Fanta has been cultivating groundnuts for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet, but also for its commercial value, since she sells groundnuts at the market.

With increasing crop yields and income, Fanta plans to increase her production to "make sure her family and she are content". Finally, Fanta hopes to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, and benefit from training in agricultural techniques offered through myAgro

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

Ruth is a cocoa farmer, growing her cocoa to sell. She started her business in 2000 with the aim of taking care of her family needs. She is requesting a loan to buy cocoa beans and rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell. 

Her family dream is to educate her children to university level, and her business dream is to expand her cocoa business into new markets.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans and rent cocoa gardens to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Miria

texts.en:
Miria is a hardworking married woman with 8 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

Her business is cocoa farming, and she also has a business selling brooms for supplementary income. She is in need of a loan to buy more brooms to sell, and more cocoa to supplement her harvests. She complains of the difficulty of unpredictable weather changes and limited capital.

She has a great desire to accumulate more capital and to become a prominent cocoa dealer in her area. She also wants to complete her residential house.

loans.use: To buy brooms and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two bulls to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Zimri Ariel

texts.es:
Zimri, se dedica a comprar y a vender ganado, tiene 3 años de estar en éste negocio, su madre le enseño a administrarlo, no cuenta con horario fijo para realizar su actividades; es un joven casado, vive con s u esposa de 25 años de edad, solo ella es dependiente.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar dos vacas lecheras, mejorara su negocio ya que podrá elaborar lácteos para tener una mejor alimentación y además generar ingresos extras, espera prosperar con su negocio y ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Zimri sueña con aprender a administrar el crédito y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Zimri has been making a living buying and selling cattle for three years. His mother taught him to manage the business. Zimri has no fixed timetable for his work. Zimri lives with his wife, 25 years old; she is the only one who depends on Zimri.

Zimri will use this loan to buy two milking cows and improve his business by making more dairy products. Zimri can then have a better diet and earn an additional income. Zimri hopes to prosper with his business and to make his loan repayments on time.

Zimri dreams of learning to manage his loan and of continuing to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy two milking cows and improve his business by making more dairy products.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio, de 36 años de edad, trabaja en su comunidad como agricultor, vive con su familia formada por su esposa y sus dos hijos, que se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad.- Anastacio, creció con sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y la ganadería como principal fuente de ingresos.

Anastacio, tiene 20 años de experiencia en la realización de actividades de la agricultura y la crianza de cerdos, todo lo aprendió de sus padres y su esposa le ayuda y también realiza los oficios domésticos de su casa.

Anastacio, necesita el dinero para comprar semilla y comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar, ya que nos encontramos en la temporada agrícola y necesita adquirir todo tipo de fertilizante, para tener una mejor cosecha y de esta manera un mejor ingreso para el sustento de su familia.  

Los sueños de Anastacio son, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, cancelar el crédito y adquirir uno nuevo para mejorar las instalaciones donde cuida y cría los cerdos.- Además, desea mejorar instalar una granja de gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Anastacio is 36 years old and works as a farmer in his community. Anastacio lives with his family, which comprises his wife and two children who both attend the local school. Anastacio was raised by his parents, who both earned their main income in farming and cattle-raising.

Anastacio has 20 years’ experience working in farming and raising pigs. He learned everything from his parents and wife who helps him and looks after the household chores.

Anastacio needs this loan in order to buy seeds and farming supplies for sowing crops. The farming season is beginning and Anastacio needs to buy all sorts of fertilisers in order to have a better harvest and, consequently, a higher income to support his family.

Anastacio dreams to supporting his children in their education, paying off his loan, and then taking out another loan in order to improve the facilities where he looks after and raises his pigs. Anastacio would also like to open a farm with laying hens.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies for sowing crops.

loans.name: Mahzuna

texts.ru:
Махзуна молодая и жизнерадостная женщина 28 лет. Она разведена. У неё есть двое детей, которые живут с ней. Махзуна после развода переехала жить в дом родителей. Махзуна по профессии швея. Она шьет национальные платья. Она очень опытная в своей профессии.  У неё есть несколько учениц. Также Махзуна  в свободное от работы время помогает родителям в выращивании сельхозкультур.
У Махзуны есть мечта. Она хочет открыть своё ателье по пошиву одежды. Но для этого нужны большие средства.  В данное время Махзуна хочет купить дополнительную швейную машинку. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahzuna is a young and cheerful woman. She is 28 years old and divorced. She has two children who live with her. Mahzuna relocated to live in her parents' home after divorcing. 

Mahzuna works as a seamstress. She sews national dresses. She is very experienced in this job. She has a few apprentices. When she has time, Mahzuna also helps her parents cultivate crops. 

Mahzuna has a dream. She wants to open her own clothing atelier. However, she needs more funds in order to do this. Currently, Mahzuna wants to buy more sewing machines. However, she does not have enough funds. She has applied to Arvand for a loan. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Раъно добродушная женщина 46 лет. Она замужем и имеет 6 детей. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Раъно занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении нескольких лет она занимается купля продажей фруктов и овощей.
Её муж работает в школе учителем. 
В своем хозяйстве Раъно имеет несколько крупно- рогатых скотов и кобылу с жеребцом. Раъно хочет приобрести лошадь, чтобы в будущем разможить её, а также получить кумыс. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Она подала заявку на кредит в Арванд. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Rano is a good-natured woman. She is 46 years old, married, and has six children. Rano runs her own business in order to generate income for daily life. She has been engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables for a few years. Her husband is a schoolteacher. 

On her farm, Rano has a few large cattle, a mare, and a stallion. Rano wants to obtain a horse so that she can breed it in the future, and also to make kumis from its milk. However, she does not have enough funds. She has applied for a loan with Arvand. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support, and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr: Oumou qui se trouve sur la photo étant à droite en vert, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mamissa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Oumou, âgée de 32 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 1 à 15 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Oumou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Oumou cultive l'arachide, le riz, l'haricot sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et de semences de qualité. Oumou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Oumou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Oumou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Oumou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu d'avoir des intrants à temps. Enfin Oumou espère aussi pouvoir acheter de charrue à bœuf.
texts.en:
Oumou, who is on the right of the photo dressed in green, is a member of a group of seven crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Mamissa, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

32-year-old Oumou is the mother of seven children from one to 15 years of age, of whom three currently attend school. Family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, which prompted Oumou to practice this activity for over 30 years.

Oumou cultivates groundnuts, rice, and beans on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of agricultural equipment, quality seeds and fertilizer.

Oumou is entering her first year with myAgro, and applied because of the prospect of increasing her crop yields through services offered by myAgro.

This year Oumou is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the crop yield on her 0.5 hectare plot (1.24 acres).

For the past 20 years Oumou has been cultivating groundnuts for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet, but also for its commercial value, since she sells groundnuts at the market.

With increasing crop yields and income, Oumou is planning on a timely purchase of agricultural inputs, and buying an ox-pulled plow..

loans.use: buy a bag of fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork rinds, corn, beans, and cheese, among other ingredients

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Мукадас женщина 50 лет, замужем, мать троих детей. Она родилась и выросла в деревне, с детства работала на поле, ухаживала за домашним скотом. После окончания школы, Мукадас вышла замуж. В университет поступить она не смогла, так как не было денег. Сейчас у Мукадас трое детей. Мукадас на протяжение двадцати лет занимается животноводством. У неё в стаде 10 баранов. Она откармливает молоденьких баранов и когда они вырастают и набирают вес, продает их. Мукадас любит свое дело, несмотря на свой возраст, она каждый день с 5 утра выходит на поле и ухаживает за своим стадом. Сейчас Мукадас хочет купить корм для скота, но у нее нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Она надеется,что МДО Арванда протянет свою руку помощи и выделит необходимую сумму. Благодарит за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Mukadas is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. She was born and raised in a village, and from childhood she has worked in the fields and tended to livestock. After graduating from school, Mukadas got married. She could not go to university since there was no money for it. 

Now Mukadas has three children. Mukadas has been engaged in animal husbandry for twenty years. In her herd, she has ten sheep. She fattens up the very young sheep, and when they grow up and put on weight, she sells them. Mukadas loves her job, and in spite of her age, every day from 5am she goes out to the fields and tends to her herd. 

Now Mukadas wants to buy feed for her livestock, but she does not have the whole sum of money. Thus she has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. She hopes that MDO Arvand will extend a helping hand and provide the needed sum. She is thankful for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es: Carlos de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 12 años, tiene muchos clientes por localidad con que realiza su trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene es como ha podido salir adelante el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de las herramientas que utiliza en su trabajo como: palas, cucharas, piochas, baldes para agua entre otras cosas y si poder tener todo nuevo para dar un mejor trabajo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Carlos is 48 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter.  He has made a living as a bricklayer for 12 years.  He has a lot of clients in the area where he works, and he has used his earnings to get ahead in life.  

He is requesting a loan to buy tools that he uses in his work such as shovels, trowels, pickaxes, and buckets for water, among other things.  If he can get all new tools, his work will improve as well as his income.

loans.use: to buy shovels, trowels, pickaxes, and buckets for water, among other things

loans.name: Ulguzi

texts.ru: 38 летняя женщина Улгузи. Она из района Шахритуз. Улгузи сильная и трудолюбивая жена и мать. Она в школе работает учительницей. Улгузи очень любить детей. После смерти мужа она начала заниматься животноводством, чтобы прокормить детей. И ее школьная зарплата не хватает на покрытия расходов. Уже 5 лет она выращивает скота. Ей нравиться ухаживать о домашних животных. Улгузи покупает скота и откармливает несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Детям 17, 14, 10 и 7 лет. Они учатся в средней школе. После школе они помогает маме в работе. Ее дети воспитанные и заботливые. Улгузи обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить несколько скота для увеличения их численность и расширения бизнеса. Она надеется с расширением бизнеса увеличиться доход, и она может улучшить условия жизни детей.
texts.en:
Ulguzi is 38 years old. She is from the Shahrituz district. Ulguzi is a strong and hardworking wife and mother. She works as a schoolteacher. Ulguzi loves children very much. 

After her husband's death, she started to work in animal husbandry in order to support her children. Her pay as a teacher is not sufficient to cover the cost of expenses. She has been raising cattle for five years. She likes tending to her livestock. Ulguzi buys cattle and fattens them up for a few months, then resells them at the cattle market. 

Her children are 17, 14, 10 and 7 years old. They are studying in middle school. After school, they help their mother with her work. Her children are well brought up and considerate. 

Ulguzi has applied for a loan to buy some livestock in order to increase their number and expand her business. She hopes that her income will increase with the expansion of the business, and that she will be able to improve her childrens' living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her stock-raising business and buy livestock.

loans.name: Sarvar

texts.ru: Сарвар женщина 50 лет, замужем, мать двоих детей. Её мечтой было поступить в университет и выучиться на дизайнера, но у её семьи не было средств, чтобы оплатить учебу. Поэтому после окончания школы Сарвар вышла замуж. Её муж работает электриков, сама же она работае в салоне портнихой. Сарвар шьет красивые национальные платья, также занимается переделкой вещей. Сарвар хочет иметь возможность дать своим детям самое лучшее образование, чтобы они могли получить хорошо оплачиваемую работу. Сарвар хочет купить швейные принадлежности: нитки, иголки, материалы. Но у нее нет денег на данный момент. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Она надеется, что МДО Арванд выделит ей нужную сумму. Она благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Sarvar is 50 years old, married, and has two children. Her dream was to enter university and learn to be a designer, but her family did not have money to pay the fees. Thus, after graduating, Sarvar got married. Her husband is an electrician, and she works in a tailoring salon. Sarvar sews beautiful national dresses, and also does alterations. 

Sarvar wants to be able to give her children the best education, so that they will be able to get good well-paying jobs. Sarvar wants to buy sewing supplies: thread, needles, and materials. However she currently does not have the money. Thus she has applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. She hotes that MDO Arvand will give her the needed sum. She is thankful for the support and faith.

loans.use: to buy some sewing accessories.

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Veracruz las actividades económicas más importantes son la ganadería, la producción de caña de azúcar y la industria manufacturera de vidrio. Aunque también es conocida por sus productos tradicionales como el queso artesanal. 
   Dentro de dicha comunidad se integró el grupo Las Pagadoras, el nombre lo eligieron ya que todas las integrantes tienen un gran sentido de la responsabilidad; ellas son: Juana quien vende antojitos típicos; María, comida; Claudia, calzado; Eva, ropa; María y Sarai, ropa y zapatos; Reina, ropa y cosméticos y Rebeca e Irene quienes manejan una tienda de abarrotes. 
   Para Doña Irene lo más valioso es la familia y por ello trabaja día a día para brindar una mejor calidad de vida; su familia está integrada por Gabriel, su cónyuge, y cuatro niños, todos menores de edad. 
   Ella tiene más de veinticinco años de experiencia como comerciante. Al inicio ayudaba a su esposo en la venta de frutas y verduras de manera ambulante, sin embargo el hecho de estar fuera de su hogar todo el tiempo la llevó a iniciar con un negocio de dulces dentro de su domicilio. Posteriormente, con las ganancias, invirtió en la compra de productos variados y así lo que antes era un negocio modesto ahora es una surtida tienda de abarrotes que tiene gran éxito en su comunidad. 
   Esta vez invertirá el préstamo en la compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, queso, detergente, papel higiénico y fruta de temporada. Irene siempre busca brindar la mejor variedad de productos en un horario amplio desde las 7:00 am y hasta las 8:00 pm los 365 días del año. Doña Irene se siente contenta y comparte “soy feliz por el apoyo que recibo de mi familia, porque mis hijos están aprendiendo el valor del trabajo honrado pues gracias al trabajo en equipo hemos formado este patrimonio”. 

*En la fotografía doña Irene está detrás de doña Claudia quien viste blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
In the community of Veracruz, the most important economic activities are ranching, sugar care production, and the industrial manufacture of glass.  However, it is also known for traditional products such as artisenal cheese.  

The Las Pagadoras group, who chose the name "the Payers" because each member of the group feels a great sense of responsibility, are part of this community.  The members of Las Pagadoras are Juana, who sells local appetizers, Maria, a chef, Claudia, who sells hosiery, Eva, a clothing salesman, Maria and Saria, shoes and clothing salesmen, Reina, a clothing and cosmetics salesman, and Rebeca and Irene, who run a grocery store.  

For Irene (behind Claudia who is wearing a blue shirt), the most important thing to her is her family and they are the reason that she works every day to provide them with a better quality of life.  Her family is made up of Gabriel, her partner, and 4 children, 2 of whom are minors.  She has more than 25 years of experience in business.  At the beginning, she helped her husband sell fruits and vegetables on foot.  However, the fact that she had to be away from her home all the time led her to eventually start a business selling candy from her home.  Afterwards, she used the profits to buy a wider variety of products and now she has turned a modest business into a well-stocked grocery store that has been very successful in the community.  

This time, she will use her loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, cheese, detergent, toilet paper, and seasonal fruit.  Irene is always seeking to provide a greater variety of products and to keep her store hours long, from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., 365 days a year.  She feels happy and notes that she is grateful for the support that she has received from her family, because her children are learning the value of honorable work since they have created their legacy through teamwork.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, cheese, detergent, toilet paper, and fruit

loans.name: Seydou's Group

texts.fr: Seydou qui se trouve sur la photo juste devant dans la chaise, est membre d’un groupe de 6 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Oure au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Seydou, âgé de 67 ans, est le père de 9 enfants âgés de 17 à 40 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer ont incité Seydou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Il explique que, "quand les ventres sont pleins, on est à l'aise." Seydou cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil, le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Seydou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Seydou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Seydou cultive le mais pour sa valeur vivrière, ainsi que pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Seydou espère pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille si il obtient de meilleurs rendements cette année.
texts.en:
Seydou, who is sitting in a chair in the front of the photo, is a member of a group of six crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Oure, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

67-year-old Seydou is the father of nine children from 17 to 40 years of age, of whom three currently attend school. Family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, which prompted Seydou to practice this activity for over 50 years. He explains that "one is content on a full stomach".

Seydou cultivates groundnuts, maize, millet and sorghum on his parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment and quality fertilizer.

Seydou  is entering his first year with myAgro, and applied because of the prospect of increasing his crop yields through services offered by myAgro.

This year Seydou is making payments to buy a bag of myAgro fertilizer to cultivate maize and increase the crop yield on his 0.0625 hectare plot (0.15 acres).

For the past 20 years Seydou has been cultivating maize for its food value, as well as its production and commercial values.

Seydou is hoping to build a family home and ensure the family's food self-sufficiency, if he gets better crop yields this year.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize

loans.name: Nery Alexander

texts.es:
Nery, de 34 años de edad, está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos, vive junto a su pareja y sus pequeños hijos.

Nery, tiene varios años de tener tienda y hasta el día de hoy le ha funcionado muy bien, a tal punto que cada día sus clientes le piden más y más productos.

Él necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su pequeña tienda y ofrecer nuevos productos como cereales, leche, sopas, verduras y otros productos.

Los sueños de Nery, son seguir expandiendo más su tienda, hasta llegar a tener un mini súper en su cantón.
texts.en:
Nery is 34 years old and in a relationship.  He lives with his partner and their 3 small children.  

Nery has owned a store for several years and everything has been going smoothly.  Presently, he is at the point where his customers are asking for more and more products.  

He needs a loan to buy more products for his small store and offer new ones such as cereal, milk, soup, and vegetables.  

Nery's dream is to continue to expand his small store until he is able to have a mini-supermarket in his neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy more products for his small store are offer new products such as cereal, milk, soup, and vegetables

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 42 year old married man with 7 children living in Fort Portal Uganda.  He has a business of dairy farming and at the same time sells second hand clothes that add him more income. He is faced with hardships of weather changes and diseases. Besides that, he has a vision of have crossed breed cattle. He has asked for a loan to  buy an improved breed of bull for cross breeding.

loans.use: to buy an improved breed of bull for cross breeding, so as to improve his herd

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with two children  whom all attend school .She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.Her  greatest monthly expenses are food,clothing and school fees.

She is taking the Kiva loan of Kshs 20,000 to invest in her farming business. With the loan, Pauline plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to invest in her farming business.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married  woman and has been blessed with two school going children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven  years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her livestock and cow feeds

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is married, and has three kids who all attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a  poultry farming business which earns her a source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation and outbreak of diseases.

With the Ksh 30,000 she wants to  purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to  purchase chicks and chicken feed,to boost her chicken production business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour, to boost her business

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is 62 years old. She lives in Ambrolauri district with her daughter, son and daughter-in-law.  Makvala and her daughter are teachers at a local school and they have monthly income. 

Makvala wants to open a bakery and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2300 GEL. With the received credit she will purchase stock of flour, cheese and so on and will open a bakery. 

Makvala will bake Georgian "Khachapuri" and will sell at a good price. The Start Up program will increase her income and Makvala will be able to expand the bakery in future.

loans.use: to open a bakery to produce local specialities like 'Khachapuri"for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 62 years old, married and is blessed with 5 children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for more than 20 years now. He will be using the loan to buy dairy feeds,nappier grass and hay for his dairy cows and hopes this will enable him to get more milk for sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his dairy farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds, nappier grass and hay for his dairy cows and hopes this will enable him to get more milk for sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Beatrice operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Phidlora

texts.en:
Phidlora is married woman and has three kids who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a poultry farming business which earns her a source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her  major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 40,000 she wants to add on her savings and  to purchase chicken feeds and chicks for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and chicks for her business, ti improve production and thus her profits

loans.name: Evagance

texts.en:
Evagance is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that  has electricity  but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Evagance operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale, to boost her business

loans.name: Esperanza Dinora

texts.es:
Esperanza, tiene un chalet en una escuela, ofrece a sus clientes diversidad de productos como: dulces, boquitas, bebidas, pupusas, hot dogs, etc., mantiene un horario de trabajo de siete de la mañana cinco de la tarde, su negocio nació hace cinco años, su dificultad más grande es al terminar el año escolar, ella se queda sin trabajar una pequeña temporada; comparte la vivienda con su esposo y su hijo, no tiene familiares en el extranjero.
Desea mejorar el inventario del chalet y tomo a bien solicitar un crédito para realizarlo de manera inmediata, comprara jugos, gaseosas, agua, azúcar, bolsas, boquitas, galletas, etc., con estos productos podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y lo hace esperando un aumento en sus ventas.
Esperanza tiene el sueño de comprar una casa propio y en buenas condiciones para que su familia viva en un mejor entorno.
texts.en:
Esperanza has a cottage in a school. She provides her customers with a wide variety of products such as sweets, snacks, drinks, pupusas, hot dogs, etc. She works from 7 AM to 5 PM. Her business began five years ago and her greatest difficulty is that at the end of each school year, she is left without work for a short period of time.  

She shares her home with her husband and her son. She has no family outside of the country. 

She would like to improve her inventory and is requesting a loan in order to accomplish this as soon as possible. She will buy juice, carbonated drinks, sugar, bags, snacks, cookies, etc. With these products she will be able  to serve her customers much better and is expecting an increase in sales. Esperanza has a dream of buying her own house that is in good condition so her family can live in a better environment.

loans.use: to buy juice, carbonated drinks, water, sugar, bags, snacks, cookies, etc. With these products she will be able to serve her customers much better.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married  woman with two children whom all attend school.She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water .Her greatest monthly expenses is food.
She has operated a brick selling business for the past five years selling to the community.She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation.
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase materials for her brick selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her brick selling business, to be able to pay for food for her family

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo, es un joven soltero, vive con su madre; para costear sus propios gastos y ayudar a solventar las necesidades familiares opto por dedicarse a tomar fotografías, lo  hace por encargo de sus vecinos, el ofició lo aprendió de un amigo y ya cuenta con sus propios clientes que lo contratan para que haga filmaciones de eventos sociales.
Comprará una cámara con tecnología moderna, papel fotográfico y cartuchos de tintas para impresión, mejorará la calidad de su trabajo, tendrá un negocio más competitivo y espera que las demandas de sus servicios sean mayores. 
Su sueño es lograr tener una foto estudio en un buen equipado para ofrecer mejores servicios de video y fotografía.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is a single young man who lives with his mother.  In order to cover his own costs and help with household expenses he decided to become a photographer and take pictures of his neighbors.  He learned the trade from a friend and has his own clientele who hire him to take videos of social events.

He plans to buy a new camera with modern technology, photo printing paper and ink cartridges for the printer.  This will improve the quality of his work and make his business more competitive.  He hopes the demand for his services will increase.

His dream is to have a well-equipped photo studio to offer better video and photographic services.

loans.use: To buy a new camera with modern technology, photo printing paper and ink cartridges.

loans.name: Bakary's Group

texts.fr: Bakary qui se trouve sur la photo asseyant au milieu, est membre d’un groupe de 3 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Korosso au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Bakary, âgé de 54 ans, est le père de 20 enfants âgés de 8 à 32 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Bakary à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Bakary cultive le mais, le sorgho, le coton sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie. Bakary entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Bakary effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Bakary cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Bakary planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu d'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en: Bakary who is sitting down in the middle of the photo, is a member of a group of 3 farmers enrolled in myAgro and lives and works in the village of Korosso which is southeast of Bamako in Mali.  Bakary, who is 54 years, is the father of 20 children ages 8-32, two of which are currently in school.  Bakary decided to become involved in the activity of farming 20 years ago in order to anchor the family tradition of agriculture as a main source of revenue and food self-sufficiency for the household, but also to allow him to ensure self-sufficiency for his family.  Bakary cultivates corn, sorghum and cotton on his plot but faces some difficulties as a farmer such as the lack of rain.  Bakary is in his first year with myAgro, and enrolled with the hopes of being able to improve his productivity through the services offered by myAgro.  This year Bakary is making his payments to buy a myAgro packet of open pollination seeds and fertilizer for the growing of corn in order to increase his productivity on his plot of 0.0625 hectare.  Bakary has been cultivating corn for 20 years now for its food value and also its commercial value, because corn is a food that he sells at the market.  Bakary plans with the increase in his productivity and his revenue to ensure the food self-sufficiency of his family.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of open-pollinating seeds and fertilizer for the growing of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ICT educational resources which will help the children at Sun-Spring school receive life-changing quality education using modern education technology.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia, de 64 años de edad, está casada, vive junto a su esposo y su nuera en la casa que su hijo les construyo a toda la familia; su esposo es agricultor y ella se dedica a las labores domésticas junto a su nuera, mientras que dos de sus hijos están en el extranjero y los otros dos viven cerca de su casa.

Ofelia, se ha criado en el campo, es por eso que las actividades agropecuarias no son extrañas para ella, ya que desde pequeña ayudaba a sus padres a sembrar maíz.

Ofelia, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y semilla para sembrar en este invierno.

Ella sueña con trabajar hasta donde la Dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
Ofelia, 64, is married and lives with her husband and daughter-in-law in the house her son built for all the family.  Her husband is a farmer and she attends to the home with her daughter-in-law.  Two of her sons are overseas and another two live near her home.

Ofelia was raised in the country so farm activities are not strange to her.  When she was young she used to help her parents plant corn.

Ofelis is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for the winter planting season.  She dreams of being able to work for as long as God is willing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds for the winter planting season.

loans.name: Andres Edmundo

texts.es:
Andres es un joven hombre de 24 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería mecánica. 
Él es inteligente, responsable, comprometido, constante, sincero y muy estudioso. Sus estudios lo realiza en la universidad pública ubicada en la zona central, sitio que sirve de punto de convergencia entre calles, por lo cual siempre tiene un animado tráfico, Junto se encuentra la biblioteca municipal. Desde temprano en la mañana hasta tarde en la noche, este lugar está colmado de personas. No es sólo por ser el lugar más confortable de la ciudad con una amplia oferta de opciones: cafés, restaurantes, museos, etc., sino, además, por su seguridad: por doquier hay destacamentos de policía, patrullas militares, custodios. Aquí siempre hay muchos extranjeros. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Andrés  es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro corto peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan como comerciantes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con los servicios de energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de ingeniería mecánica y se encuentra en 5 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta conociendo la forma de construir las máquinas, le gusta entender los procesos de industrialización, su carácter es de servicio. Paralelamente a sus estudios, trabaja como supervisor mecánico en una fábrica de cemento, “trabajo y el resto del tiempo lo dedico a la preparación de mi tesis final…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre si la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar los trámites de titulación y defensa de tesis. Su sueño es salir profesional para ascender en su trabajo y desea realizar el pago de su defensa de tesis para obtener su título profesional. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a ambas actividades. 
Es por esos motivos que Andres solicita un préstamo para pagar los trámites de titulación y defensa de tesis para obtener su título profesional y ascender en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Andres is a young man of 24 years, single, has no children, and is studying mechanical engineering. He is very intelligent, responsible, committed, disciplined, sincere and studious. 

He studies at the public university located in the city center, near a big junction, which is why there is always a lot of traffic. The city's library is located next to it. From early in the morning until late at night, this place is packed with people. With its variety of options (cafes, restaurants, museums) it is not only the most comfortable place in the city, but also the safest. Everywhere are police officers, military patrols, and guards. There are always a lot of foreigners. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies from 0°C to 12°C [32°F to 54°F] during the day.

Andres skin and eyes are dark, he wears glasses and his black hair is fashionably short. He is short and lean. 

His first language is Aymara, which he does not use anymore because he goes to university and lives in the city. He lives with his parents, who work as merchants. They live in their own house, built of bricks and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, and a wooden floor. They have electricity, drinking water, and a sewer system.

He is studying mechanical engineering in his fifth of five years. He enjoys learning about the construction of machines, likes to understand industrialization processes and he has a servicing nature.

Parallel to his studies, he works as a supervising mechanic in a cement factory. "I work and the rest of the time I spent writing my final thesis", he says. The good thing about his two activities is, that his schedules do not interfere with each other. But the disadvantage is, that he does not have the money to pay for his tuition and his thesis defense. His dream is to get his degree and advance at his work. He wishes to be able to pay for his thesis defense to get his degree.

This is his first loan with the organization in the five years he has been studying and working. This is why Andres is requesting a loan: to pay his tuition fees and for his thesis defense to get his degree and advance at work.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees and for his thesis defense to get his degree and advance at work.

loans.name: Luna Nueva Group

texts.es:
En cierta comunidad de Veracruz la actividad económica se ha incrementado gracias a la producción de caña de azúcar, la cría y venta de ganado, la industria vidriera y las tiendas de autoservicio. Sin embargo no deja de ser un lugar pintoresco en donde las familias se reúnen en los ríos para refrescarse en los días de altas temperaturas. 
   Luna Nueva  es el nombre del grupo conformado por cuatro mujeres todas ellas comprometidas consigo mismas y, por supuesto, con su actividad. Las integrantes y sus actividades son: Carolina quien vende comida y da servicio de torno; María quien vende ropa y cosméticos; Guadalupe, perfumes y Janet quien maneja una estética. 
   Janet es una gran mujer y ha formado una familia con Carlos: tienen dos hijos que continúan estudiando. A la edad de dieciséis años, ella brindaba su servicio como estilista en un negocio de la localidad. Tiempo después decidió independizarse, para ello acondicionó la parte frontal de la casa de su madre. Con las ganancias obtenidas apoyaba a su madre con los gastos; posteriormente compró el equipo e instrumentos necesarios para ofrecer un servicio excelente a sus clientes. También, en su inquietud por mantenerse actualizada y mejorar su habilidades, asistió a varios cursos y logró certificarse como estilista profesional. Hoy en día todas sus constancias están a la vista de los clientes en su negocio.
   Desde hace dieciséis años, Janet tiene su propia estética ubicada en su hogar, lo que le ayuda a no descuidar a su familia. Además sigue apoyando con los gastos generales y la educación de sus hijos. Con el préstamo invertirá en tintes, peróxido, cera, tijeras, y una secadora de cabello con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, quienes le buscan por el trato amable y por cumplir con sus expectativas. Actualmente ya ofrece algunos productos de belleza como exfoliantes. 
   Las cuatro integrantes del grupo agradecen cada uno de los préstamos otorgados pues han permitido el crecimiento y desarrollo de sus actividades.

*En la fotografía se encuentran todas las integrantes, Janet es quien viste blusa color morado.
texts.en:
In a certain part of Veracruz the economic acitivity has increased thanks to sugar cane production, cattle sales, the glass industry and supermarkets.  However, it is still a picturesque location where families meet at the river to swim on hot days.

Luna Nueva is the name of the group made up of four women who are committed to each other and, of course, to their businesses.  The members and their activities are: Carolina who sells food and offers lathe services; Maria who sells clothing and cosmetics; Guadalupe sells perfumes and Janet has a beauty salon.

Janet is a nice lady who is married to Carlos.  They have two children who attend school.  At age 16 she was already working as a hairdresser in her town.  After some time she decided to work independently and renovated the front part of her mother's home.  With her earnings she helped her mother cover expenses.  Then she bought the equipment and tools she needed to offer an excellent service to her customers.  Also, because of her concern about staying up-to-date and honing her skills, she attended several courses and became certified as a professional stylist.  Now all of her skills are on display among her clientele.

For 16 years Janet has been running her salon from home, so she is also able to attend to her family.  She continues helping out with general expenses and in the education of her children.  She will use the loan to buy hair color, peroxide, wax, scissors and a hair dryer in order to meet the demands of the customers who seek a kind, committed service.  Currently she also sells products such as exfoliants.

The four members of the group are grateful for the loans because they have allowed them to grow and develop their businesses.


*All the members are present in the picture.  Janet is the one in purple.

loans.use: To buy hair color, peroxide, wax, scissors and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.
