Gladys operates a vegetable stall, and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs to her place of operation. 


With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join the Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda has two children and they go to school while she attends her farm. Nilda sells milk and needs a loan to buy a milking cow, which will allow her to sell more milk.

Nilda is assisted by her boyfriend but he can't provide her with money, which is why she needs your help. She is healthy and responsible, and she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a married woman and has four children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business of buying livestock and selling them at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial. 
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida, constante, dulce, cariñosa, sensible y sincera. Sus estudios lo realiza en una universidad privada ubicada en la zona ‘Miraflores’ caracterizada por encontrarse el estadio de futbol donde se celebran grandes eventos deportivos así como eventos musicales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.  
Valeria es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones usa lentes de aumento, cabello castaño largo peinado a la moda, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya casi no habla porque estudia y vive en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza junto a sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera tipo parket, que cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella cursa la carrera de ingeniería comercial y se encuentra en 3 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; cuanta con habilidad y destreza para razonar, su espíritu es crítico y su actitud inquisitiva frente a los problemas, es muy creativa, y su compromiso con el desarrollo de su región es de servicio, “mi trabajo me da la oportunidad de aplicar mis conocimientos dentro del campo laboral, tengo la ventaja de contar con mis padres que me ayudan en todo…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para el pago de las cuotas.  Su sueño es terminar su carrera profesional para abrir una empresa, ella desea realizar el pago de las cuotas de su carrera por adelantado para recibir un descuento. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que trabaja y estudia. 
Es por esos motivos que Valeria solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera por adelantado y obtener un descuento, para terminar sus estudios y abrir una empresa.
texts.en:
Valeria, 21, is a young woman who is single and has no children.  She is studying Commercial Engineering.  She is intelligent, responsible, committed, consistent, sweet, affectionate, sensitive and sincere.  She attends a private university in the area of "Miraflores" which is known for its football stadium where large sporting events and musical concerts are held.  The location has a cool, dry climate with an average daytime temperature of 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Valeria has a light complexion, brown eyes and wears reading glasses.  She wears her long brown hair in a fashionable style, is short in height and has a slim physique.  Her mother tongue is Aymara which she practically does not use because she is studying and lives in the city.  She lives with her parents who work.  They live in their own home which is made of brick and concrete.  It has a metal zinc roof and parquet flooring, as well as running water, electricity and a sewage system.

She is currently in her third year (of five) of commercial engineering.  She is skillful in her reasoning and has a critical spirit and inquisitive mind regarding problems.  She is very creative and committed to developing her services in the region, "My work gives me the opportunity to apply my knowledge in the work field.  I have the advantage of having parents who help in everything..." she says.  Luckily, she has distinct schedules that do not overlap.  The disadvantage she has is that she does not have the money to pay fees.  Her dream is to get her professional degree and open a business.  She wants to pay her expenses in advance to receive a discount.  This is her first loan sequence through the institution in the three years she has been working and studying.

Valeria is requesting a loan to pay university costs in advance to obtain a discount, and to finish her education and open a business.

loans.use: To make and advance payment on her education costs to get a discount and to open a business.

loans.name: Mamine's Group

texts.fr: Mamine qui se trouve sur la photo juste devant avec un foulard vert, est membre d’un groupe de 26 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Oure au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mamine, âgé de 50 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 21 à 37 ans.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture, ont incité Mamine à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Mamine cultive l'arachide, le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Mamine entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Mamine effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 21 ans que Mamine cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'elle vend sur le marché. Mamine planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et de diversifier ses cultures. Enfin Mamine espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants
texts.en: Mamine, who is in the front of the photo wearing a green scarf, is a member of a group of 26 farmers enrolled in myAgro and lives and works in the village of Oure in the southeast of Bamako in Mali.  Mamine, who is 50 years old, is the mother of 4 children ages 21-37.  The ability to ensure the self-sufficiency of her family, but also her love of agriculture prompted her to begin this activity 20 years ago.  Mamine grows peanuts and corn on her plot but faces some difficulties as a farmer such as the lack of rain and lack of quality agricultural materials and fertilizers.  Mamine is in her first year with myAgro and she enrolled with the hopes of being able to improve her productivity through the services offered by myAgro.  This year Mamine is making payments to buy a myAgro packet of open pollination seeds and fertilizer for the growing of corn in order to increase her productivity on her plot of 0.5 hectare.  Mamine has been cultivating corn for 21 years now for its food value and also its commercial value, because corn is a food that she sells at the market.  Mamine plans, with the increase in her productivity and her revenue to extend her acreage and diversify her crops.  Lastly, Mamine hopes to also be able to finance the marriage of her children.

loans.use: to buy a packet of open-pollinating seeds and fertilizer for growing corn and to benefit from the trainings and techniques of myAgro

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is married, and she and her husband have two children. They married eleven years ago and live on a modest farm where Vicenta sells milk to make money. She learned about the business from her mother when she was a child and now she needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Her husband assists her on the farm but he does not have working capital so Vicenta has to earn the money. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en: Sergio is married and he has 3 children that are going to school. Sergio sells milk and he is assisted by his wife. He learned about the business when he was a child so he knows what to do. He needs a loan to buy a milking cow as he wants to sell more milk. He needs your help as his wife attends the children and she is not working.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, la socia continua con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo  su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas, chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the SAN VALENTIN communal bank. She continues in her clothes selling business. She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments. She continues to sell her merchandise to her customers who order from her, like friends, relatives and others. This is how she gets her family ahead. 

This borrower is asking for the loan to buy jackets, sweaters and more.

loans.use: to buy jackets, sweaters and more.

loans.name: El Rencuentro Group

texts.es:
REVISADO
La novia del sol es una comunidad veracruzana que lleva dicho nombre debido a la gran intensidad de calor que alcanza la zona durante el día. Esta localidad es además conocida por otros símbolos que le dan identidad como las caritas sonrientes que son un antecedente precolombino, los monumentos a la madre y la bandera, la iglesia parroquial y la torre de vigilancia. 
   El Rencuentro es un grupo formado en la comunidad antes mencionada, llevan el nombre debido a que después de un tiempo de estar inactivos ahora se volvieron a reunir. Ellos quieren la oportunidad del crédito para continuar con sus actividades que son: Olivia quien vende sabanas y colchas; Saraí y María, antojitos; Cristina, cosméticos; Isaí, cinturones y carteras; Martina y Jessica, ropa; Verónica, repostería y Abisag quien maneja una tienda de abarrotes. 
    Saraí es una mujer muy trabajadora conocida en su localidad por tener diez años de experiencia en la venta de comida típica. Está casada con Luis y es madre de una joven de once años cuya escuela está cerca del negocio familiar. Inició con la venta de quesadillas en un espacio prestado y sólo con una mesa donde acomodaba el quemador y los ingredientes y utensilios necesarios. Después de generar una clientela sólida decidió rentar un local mucho más grande: “tener mi propio local era mi sueño y lo he cumplido, gracias a los préstamos y ganancias obtenidas” así demuestra la satisfacción que le brinda su negocio.
   El negocio lo atiende de lunes a domingo en un horario de 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 3:00 de la tarde. Después de cerrar el local acuden a comprar la mercancía como manteca, carne, chiles, chicharrón, aguacate; todo lo necesario para preparar los guisados y posteriormente realiza los quehaceres de la casa. 
   Actualmente con las ganancias cubren los gastos de la casa, la educación de su hija y las necesidades personales. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne, refrescos y gas para continuar ofreciendo ricas quesadillas y picaditas a sus clientes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro de La novia del sol, Saraí es quien porta un vestido negro.
texts.en:
La Novia del Sol is a community in Veracruz that gets its name from the intense heat the area has during the day. This locale is known for other symbols that identify it, such as the pre-colombian smiling faces, its monuments to mothers and its flag, the parish church and the watchtower. 

El Rencuentro [The Reunion] is a group that was formed in the aforementioned community. It has that name because after a time of being inactive, the members reunited. They want the opportunity of the loan to continue with their activities, such as: Olivia sells sheets and blankets, Saraí and María sell snacks, Cristina sells cosmetics, Isaí sells belts and purses, Martina and Jessica sell clothes, Verónica sells pastries, and Abisag quien runs a grocery store. 

Saraí is a very hardworking woman who is known in the area because she has 10 years' experience selling traditional food. She is married to Luis and is the mother os an eleven year old whose school is close to the family business. She started selling quesadillas in a borrowed space and with just one table she had the burner and the ingredients and necessary utensils. After generating a solid customer base she decided to rent a much bigger locale. “having my own locale was my dream and I have achieved it thanks to the loans and the profits I obtained", she says, demonstrating the satisfaction she brings to her business.

She runs the business Monday through Sunday from 8:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon. After closing the locale they go buy merchandise such as lard, meat, cracklings, chiles, avocados- everything necessary to prepare the stews. Then she goes and does the housework. 

Right now, the profits cover her daughter's education and her personal needs.  She will invest the loan in buying meat, beverages and gas to continue offering delicious quesadillas and snacks to her customers.  
*The photograph was taken in downtown La Novia del Sol. Saraí is wearing a black dress.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages and gas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo casacas, chompas ,polos entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas  entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the SAN VALENTIN communal bank. She continues in the clothes selling business. She has had her business for some time, which is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She continues to sell jackets, sweaters, polo shirts and more to her customers who order from her, such as friends, relatives and more. This is how she gets her family ahead. 

The borrower is asking for the loan to buy sweaters and more.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and more.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a farmer and she sells milk.  She has her own house, made with adobe, and she is married. 

Julia needs a loan to buy a milking cow. 

Julia hopes you can help her because her husband is unemployed. She doesn't have children, but she has to support her home.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 69 years old and she is a baker. Rosario is a widow. She has 3 kids and has her own house. 

Rosario knows how to make delicious pastries. She needs another loan to buy more supplies (flour, sugar, margarine, butter) for her business because she wants to make and sell bread as it is a good business.

She hopes you can help her again. She is working hard and she is healthy.

loans.use: to buy supplies (flour, sugar, margarine and butter).

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina has five children and she is married.  

She needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she sells milk and she wants to increase her milk production.

Delfina's husband lost his job recently, and that is why she thinks now is the best time to improve the family farm. She hopes you can help her; she is healthy and she works hard.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina is 32 years old and she sells beauty products such as cosmetics, hand creams and other products.  Reina is the mother of four children. She is married and her husband is a barber who works at home. The couple has their own house. 

Reina needs a loan to buy more cosmetics for her business. 

She works hard. She visits people at their houses and offices; she hopes you can help her. Reina would like to have her own store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 61 years old, she is married and she has 4 kids. Martha is still managing a grocery store and she has also started to make curtains and tablecloths.

She needs a loan to buy inputs to make curtains and tablecloths. Martha has experience in the sewing business that is why she is convinced she can make extra money if she makes curtains and tablecloths. She is healthy and she hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to buy inputs to make curtains and tablecloths.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 46 years old, she has two sons. Angela sells clothes and she is a professional masseuse. 

She needs a loan to buy more clothes for her business because she sells the clothes in many different locations including offices and houses.

Angela sells new clothes. She hopes you can help her because she is the only person who earns money in her household. Angela is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Al adentrarse en el camino de terracería se pueden apreciar sembradíos de caña de azúcar; brechas, veredas y senderos que a diario son recorridos por los campesinos que trabajan en la tierra. En esta comunidad oaxaqueña es donde se formó un grupo integrado por 9 personas quienes decidieron identificarse con el nombre de Desarrollo. 
   Los miembros y sus actividades son: Consuelo quien maneja una tienda de abarrotes y María, un molino de nixtamal. Mientras que Adela se dedica a vender refrescos y cerdos; Edi, Marcos y José, cerdos; Esther, cosméticos; Verónica, medicamentos y Silvia, ropa.
   Doña Consuelo es una mujer emprendedora quien hace 28 años se convirtió en madre. Desde entonces inició con su actividad: “ser madre soltera no es nada fácil hay que trabajar y cuidar a un pequeño, por eso inicié con la venta de refresco; jamás olvidare esas dos rejas de refresco con las que inicié, esas dos rejas me abrieron las puertas” según palabras de Doña Chelo, como es mejor conocida en la región.
   Esta misma actividad le permitió abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su domicilio de tal manera que tanto los ingresos como la calidad de vida de sus dos hijos mejoraron. Para poder iniciar con su tienda acondicionó un cuarto dentro de su casa e invirtió sólo 5000 pesos en la compra de artículos básicos. Gracias a las ganancias obtenidas su hijo mayor terminó una ingeniería y el menor se encuentra en el sexto semestre de licenciatura.
   Otra actividad que ahora puede realizar gracias a las ganancias de la tienda es la cría y venta de animales de corral. Así, doña Consuelo invertirá el préstamo en la compra de queso, pollitos, alimento de crecimiento y engorda manteniendo activas sus dos actividades. “Gracias por permitirnos continuar con el desarrollo de cada una de nuestras actividades y por ayudarnos a hacer nuestros sueños realidad” comenta con una sonrisa en el rostro.

*En la fotografía se aprecian los integrantes del grupo, doña Chelo es quien viste blusa color naranja.
texts.en:
Upon entering the dirt track, one can appreciate the fields of sugar cane, and the gaps, lanes, and paths that are daily traveled by the people in the countryside who work the land. In this Oaxacan community, a group was formed by 9 members who decided to identify themselves by the name of Desarrollo. 

The members and their businesses are: Consuelo who runs a grocery store and Maria who has a cornmeal mill, while Adela works selling soft drinks and pigs; Edi, Marcos and José, pigs; Esther, cosmetics; Verónica, medicines and Silvia, clothing.

Consuelo is an enterprising woman who became a mother 28 years ago. Since then, she began with her business. "Being a single mother is not easy at all. You have to work and take care of the little one. For this reason, I began by selling soft drinks. I will never forget these two bars that opened the doors," are the words of Chelo, as she is better known in the region. 

This same job allowed her to open a small grocery store located in her home, so that the income and her two children's quality of life both increased. To be able to open the store, she outfitted a room in the house and invested only 5000 pesos in the purchase of basic items. Thanks to the earnings earned, her older child finished a program in engineering and the younger one is in his sixth semester of his degree program. 
 
Another job that she can now do thanks to the earnings from the store is raising and selling small animals. So, Consuelo will invest the loan in the purchase of cheese, chicks, and feed for growth and fattening, maintaining both businesses actively. "Thank you for allowing us to continue with the development of each of our businesses and for helping us to make our dreams a reality," she says with a smile on her face. 

*In the photo are the members of the group Chelo is wearing an orange top.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, chicks, and feed for growth and fattening.

location.town: Buena Vista, San Miguel Soyaltepec,  Oaxaca

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 39 years old and she has 2 kids. Claudia is an itinerant saleswoman and sells many different kinds of beauty products from catalogues. 

She goes to offices and houses so she has to walk a lot and to travel a lot to purchase the merchandise. She needs a loan to buy more beauty products such as perfumes. 

She hopes you can help her. She is healthy, works hard and is good at calculation so she is ready to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as perfumes.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 73 years old. She is married and she has a son. 

Nina makes pillowcases to earn some money.  She is retired, but her retirement fund is not enough for her. 

She needs a loan to buy fabric for making pillowcases  

Although she is a senior citizen, she is healthy and strong. She hopes you can help her again. Ninfa is the only person that supports the home right now.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making pillowcases

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is single and he doesn't have children. He lives with his parents.  The family only has two rooms. 

Fernando is a good mason, and he has to make a lot of physical sacrifices. He is learning about being a farmer; he is helped by his dad.

He needs a loan to buy cattle. He will take care of the animals then he will sell them. 

Fernando would like to quit his mason job and to be an independent farmer; he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is single and doesn't have children. However he lives with his parents and takes care of them. He is a mason, and has a little room. His job is very demanding because of the physical effort he has to make as he carries sand all day. 

Victor is also a farmer and he needs a loan to buy cattle. He will take care of the animals and then he will sell them. Victor would like to purchase his own land in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is 31 years old and she has a 9-year-old son. She is still working as a carpenter assistant .

She needs another loan to buy wood for her business. 

Clotilde hopes you can help her again; she has to pay the rent and she is the only one at her house who is working. Clotilde is healthy and she has a lot of work to do.

loans.use: to buy wood for her business

loans.name: Nimia Celinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Nimia Celinda; la socia continua trabajando en uno de los colegios de la zona, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua ejerciendo su profesión de docente, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar vivieres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Valentin communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member is Nimia Celinda. She continues to work in one of the schools in the area. The member is a responsible and diligent person, she continues working in her profession of teaching. She has been working at her job for a good while, which is going well, thanks to to the diligence that she puts into her work each day, as this is the way that the member gets her family ahead. 

The member asks for the loan to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, milk and more.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her home such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina has a boyfriend and the couple have 5 children. The family lives in a modest adobe house.

Cristina sells milk. She needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she wants to sell more milk and she also wants to make cheese in the future. Her boyfriend is a mason but he doesn't earn very much money; that is why Cristina needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has a boyfriend and the couple have 5 children to feed. Yolanda is an experienced farmer and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow to increase her milk production. 

Yolanda also knows how to make cheese but right now she is worried about her milk production. She wants to be more competitive. Yolanda's boyfriend helps her with the farm but he doesn't have money to give that is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is a farmer and she sells milk to earn money. She has two kids and she is married. She needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she needs a new milking cow because her animals are old and little by little they have to be replaced.

Primitiva is very experienced with the business and she hopes you can help her. She is assisted by her husband.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora is living with her boyfriend and the couple have 2 children. Isidora lives on a very poor farm and she sells milk. She learned about the milking business when she was a kid now she needs a loan to buy a milking cow for her farm. 

Isidora is healthy and she needs your help because her boyfriend is unemployed and she needs more cows to have a better milk production. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, se dedica a criar pollos y los vende a sus clientes aliñados y vivos, es una mujer viuda, vive con sus hijos, el negocio lo aprendió sola y lo tiene hace aproximadamente hace 16 años, lo atiende con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Comprará pollos recién nacidos, concentrados, vacunas y hará reparaciones en las galeras, esta inversión le permitirá fortalecer su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de los pollos, espera contar con capacidad de venta y cubrir las demandas que hacen sus clientes, ya que de esta manera estará mejorando sus ingresos y podrá cancelar sus deudas.
Sus aspiraciones son mantener su negocio en el mercado para reducir sus deudas y lograr trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Marta works raising chickens and she sells them to her customers seasoned and live. She is a widow and lives with her children. She learned the business on her own and she has had it for approximately 16 years. She takes care of it with the help of her children. 

She will purchase recently-born chicks, concentrated feed, vaccines, and will do some repairs on the sheds. This investment will allow her to strengthen her business and improve the chickens' living conditions. She hopes to have sales capacity and to meet the customers' demand, since in this way she will be increasing her income and can pay off her debts.

Her aspirations are to continue her business in the market to reduce her debts and manage to work with her own capital.

loans.use: to purchase recently-born chicks, concentrated feed, vaccines, and to make repairs on the sheds; this investment will allow her to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 40 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yovana; la socia continua dedicándose al negocio picantería, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo  diferentes tipos de platos como milanesa de pollo, carne, sopas, lechón entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, menestras entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Valentin communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Yovana. She continues working at her picantería [a restaurant that specializes in spicy food]. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments. She continues selling different types of dishes such as chicken cutlets, meat, soups, pork, and more, as this is the way that she gets her family ahead.

The member asks for the loan to purchase rice, oil, legumes, and more.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, legumes and more.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en: Clemente is 58 years old. He is married and lives with his wife. Clemente is a police officer. The couple also has a minibus that they use to transport people. Clemente's wife used to drive the minibus, but they hired a driver some time ago. Clemente needs a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle because the vehicle needs them. He hopes you can help him. Clemente's salary is not good, and the family depends on the vehicle a lot. They have five children to feed.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old; she has five kids to feed. She manages a grocery store. 

Martha needs a loan to fix her house. She hopes you can help her. 

She is healthy, and she is responsible. Martha has a boyfriend, but he doesn't live with her and he has his own expenses. 

Martha is a very hardworking person; she has to attend her grocery store very early in the morning and she is good with numbers.

loans.use: to fix her house

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en:
Sonny is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sonny is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

Sonny has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Sonny requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Sonny would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a duck bartering business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending and farming rice. Jona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support herself. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, shampoo, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 47 years old and married with two children.

Mary Jean works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft-drinks, diapers, canned goods and other personal care products.

Mary Jean has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Mary Jean aspires to save enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, diapers, canned goods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Oralia

texts.en:
Oralia is 50 years old, married and has no kids. She has worked selling mobile phone accessories for the last eight years. In her store she sells accessories and air time, and also provides a service of phone repairs. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more inventory of accessories. 

She says that she feels accomplished because she has been maintaining her business for such a long time and has been able to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy inventory of accessories for mobile phones.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional cartons of men's and women's slippers

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.en:
Mario Alberto is 26 years old and works teaching elementary school students computing. He also has a business in his home where he provides maintenance services for computer equipment.  

He is asking for a loan to finish the construction and set-up of his repair shop. He says that this will ensure he has access to more clients and will increase his sales. 

Mario Alberto says that in the past he has taken some loans and always paid them back on time.

loans.use: To set-up his computer maintenance shop.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 48 years old.

Rosalie has a business selling gravel and sand in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional sand and gravel to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Wilson Albertico

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre muy amable y generoso, tiene una linda familia de un hijo de la edad de siete años, ellos viven una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Para este gran hombre su familia es lo primordial es por ello que para obtener sus ingresos trabaja como guardián de una institución privada de donde proviene   sus ingresos y ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
El ahora necesita de un prestamo porque se ve a la necesidad de comprar algunos materiales para la construcción de su casa, pues con lo que el obtiene de su trabajo no se da abasto para poder realizar estas compras, el con el crédito comprara cemento, cal, arena y otros.
El gran anhelo de Wilson es poder terminar la construcción de su casa en este año, para darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Wilson is a friendly and generous man. He has a lovely family of one son who is seven years old. They live in a community in Santo Tomas La Unión.

For this great man, his family is the most important. It is for this that he earns his income working as a security guard for a private institution where he gets his income and has managed to get his family ahead. 

He now needs a loan because he needs to purchase some materials to build his house, since with what he earns at his job, it is not enough to make these purchases. With the loan, he will purchase cement, lime powder, sand, and more.

Wilson's great desire is to be able to finish building his house this year, to provide a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, lime powder, sand, and more.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a single man who doesn't have children. He works as a driver. He works over 10 hours a day and all night at weekends. 

Ruben is living with his parents. He supports the family as he is the only one at the home that makes money. 

Ruben needs a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. Ruben is healthy and he hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 6 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an 8m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Nanci Yoni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN VALENTIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue con su  negocio de venta de cereales como trigo, cebada y quinua, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo al por mayor a los diferentes mercados que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cereales como trigo entre otros.
texts.en:
Nanci is a member of the San Valentin Communal Bank located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Nanci continues with her business of selling cereal such as wheat, barley, and quinoa wholesale in the different markets that wish to buy it. She is a responsible and diligent person and wishes to continue with this work so she can carry on supporting her family.

Nanci is requesting a loan to buy cereals such as wheat etc.

loans.use: buy cereals such as wheat etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wire for a new roof on his house

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Perla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Perla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Johna is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Johna has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Johna requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more pants, blouses, towels and other things like curtains to offer for sale.

Johna has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Johna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more pants, blouses, towels and other items to offer for sale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane and a motorycle passenger businesses.

Leonor dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and to pay the labor costs of putting in a cement floor in her house as well as the area she uses for business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsie is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

Elsie has a general store business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, personal care products and school supplies.

Elsie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries like canned goods, soft-drinks, personal care products and school supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Judith is 53 years old and has children who are in school.

Judith has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Judith has been in this business for three years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Aidalyn

texts.en:
Aidalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Aidalyn is 30 years old and all three children are in school.

Aidalyn has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Aidalyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and pay for the registration of her tricycle for passengers.

Aidalyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Aidalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and pay for the registration of her tricycle for passengers.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a widow woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Elsie is 40 years old and both of her children are in school.

Elsie has a general store business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Elsie has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Veronica is 59 years old and all three children are in school.

Veronica has a fishing business in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Veronica has been in this business for five years. In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Lyn

texts.en:
Ma. Lyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Lyn is 48 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Lyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Lyn requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Lyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig-fattening.

Connie dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy ingredients and ustensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Efrain Luis

texts.es:
El socio Efraín pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio sigue  dedicándose a la artesanía, él socio es técnico restaurador, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio continua dedicándose  a su trabajo de restaurador el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que el socios saca adelante a su familia.
 
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas .
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Efraín belongs to the communal bank San Valentín, located in the district of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

He continues making a living in craftwork as a restoration specialist.  He is a responsible and persevering person.  He continues dedicating himself to his work as a restorer which is going well for him thanks to the efforts that he puts into his business every day, this being the way that he gets his family ahead.

Efraín is requesting the loan to purchase paint.  He feels grateful for the loan and is committed to making his installment payments.

loans.use: to purchase paint.

loans.name: Cesar Yobani

texts.es:
Cesar, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado debido a las limitantes económicas de su familia; actualmente se encuentra acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, aún no tienen hijos.

Cesar, dejo de estudiar y se dedico a la siembra de maíz, como una fuente de ingresos para su familia, es por eso que conoce a perfección el trabajo de la agricultura.

El crédito que solicita Cesar, es para comprar dos bolsas de semilla, seis sacos de abono, prepara la tierra y pagar mano de obra, para cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
 
El sueño de Cesar, es poder obtener buenas ganancias en el cultivo de maíz, para asegurar el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 21 years old. He only attended school until the sixth grade due to his family's lack of finances.  Now he is married and his partner makes a living doing housework, but they still do not have children.  Cesar quit school and dedicated himself to growing corn as a source of income for his family.  That is why he knows farming work so well.

The loan that Cesar requests is to buy two bags of seed and six sacks of fertilizer, to prepare the land, and to pay for the labor to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn.  Cesar's dream is to be able to get good profits from growing corn in order to assure his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy two bags of seed and six sacks of fertilizer, to prepare the land, and to pay for the labor to cultivate 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
Enrequita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a charcoal retailing business. 

Enrequita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lorena dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Renita dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store and pig fattening businesses.

Dominga dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jean dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Los Soles Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca hay una comunidad que se destaca por la gran hospitalidad que ofrece a los visitantes. Sentarse junto a la gran presa para observar una formidable puesta de sol mientras se disfruta de una deliciosa mojarra recién pescada por los lugareños es un verdadero placer. Además esta región conserva la cultura y tradición mazateca, como la elaboración de trajes típicos realizado por las mujeres de una pequeña isleta. 
   Es ahí donde se formó el grupo Los Soles, nombre que fue acuñado debido a que, al igual que el sol,  ellos quieren dar cobijo a sus familias y brillar en cada una de sus actividades. Los miembros son: Darien e Isabel quienes manejan una local de comida; Mario, una carpintería; Cristina, una bisutería. Por su parte Elvia vende material para construcción; Araceli, postres; Teresa, cosméticos y finalmente Luis quien se dedica a la albañilería. 
   Don Mario tiene diez años de radicar en esta comunidad junto con su esposa y dos hijos que aun dependen de él. Tiene los mismos años de ser dueño en su propia carpintería como él mismo lo explica “Desde que tengo uso de razón he sido carpintero, hace diez años se me presentó la oportunidad de iniciar mi negocio, ser mi propio jefe y no depender de nadie más”. Sin embargo la experiencia adquirida le permite a Mario crear desde cosas sencillas hasta muebles muy complejos. 
    Aún conserva con añoranza las tres herramientas con las que inició en su actividad: una sierra, un cepillo y un torno. Con las ganancias obtenidas ha podido comprar martillos, clavos, lijas, barniz, laca, pinzas, brochas y, el elemento fundamental de todo carpintero, la madera.  Ahora los mismos clientes lo recomiendan pues además de realizar un trabajo de calidad, los entrega en tiempo y cumplen con cada una de las expectativas. Este primer préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de madera.
   Don Mario también ofrece empleo a dos jóvenes de la comunidad quienes le ayudan en el negocio. Para él más que una simple actividad económica es el patrimonio de sus hijos a quienes enseñará el oficio.

*En la fotografía se encuentran todos los integrantes de Los Soles, Don Mario es quien viste playera negra y bermuda a cuadros.
texts.en:
There is a community in Oaxaca which is well-known for its hospitality to visitors. To sit beside a large dam and watch a beautiful sunset while enjoying a delicious locally-caught sea bream, is a real pleasure. The region also preserves its culture and Mazatec traditions such as the making of traditional clothing by the women of a small island.

This is where the group called Los Soles was formed. Its name represents the land and shelter the members want to provide for their families and the skills they wish to excel in in each of their jobs. The members are Darien and Isabel who run a small restaurant; Mario, a carpenter; Christine, a jeweler; Elvia who sells building supplies; Araceli who makes pastries; Teresa who sells cosmetics; and finally Luis who works in construction.

Mario, his wife and his two dependent children have lived in this community for ten years. He has been the owner of his carpenter's business for the same length of time and explains that ever since he could think, he has been a carpenter. Then, ten years ago, he got the chance to start his own business, be his own boss, and not depend on anyone. His experience to that point allowed him to make simple things as well as complicated pieces of furniture.

Mario still reminisces about the three tools with which he began his business: a saw, a plane, and a drill. With his earnings he was able to buy hammers, nails, sandpaper, varnish, lacquer, pliers, and paint brushes, and, of course, the most important for a carpenter, wood. Nowadays his customers recommend him because of the quality of his work, on-time delivery, and doing what he said he would do. This first loan Mario will use to buy wood.

He also employs two young men from the community who help him with his business. More than a straightforward job, Mario's work is to him his children's inheritance and he plans to to teach them his skills.

All the members of Los Soles can be seen in the photo. Mario is wearing a black t-shirt and plaid Bermuda shorts.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy feeds and hay for her dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 61 years old and married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more wood to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rhoda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rhoda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Rhoda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing and pig fattening. 

Lorna is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a married man living in Fort Portal Uganda operating a business of producing red peppers and at the same time grows tea that supplements his incomes. He faces challenges of price fluctuation that hinder expansion of his business. 

However, he is working very hard to expand his vegetable farm to bigger areas to increase his harvest volume and income at large. Thomas has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Sixto Antonio

texts.es:
Sixto, de 70 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a las tareas del hogar, sus hijos ya son independientes y ellos viven solo con un nieto, el cual está asistiendo a la escuela.

Sixto, se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy joven, adquiriendo de esa manera mucha experiencia en el cultivo de maíz, ya que solo se ha dedicado al trabajo del campo.

Sixto, necesita el crédito para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para lo cual comprara cuatro sacos de abono, una bolsa de semilla de maíz y pagar mano de obra.

El sueño de Sixto, es que la cosecha de maíz sea buena, para obtener mucha ganancia y poder cancelar el crédito y que le quede una parte para seguir cultivando.
texts.en:
Sixto is 70 years old and attended school until the third grade.  He is married and his wife carries out the household tasks. Their children are adults and they live with their grandchild, who attends school. Sixto has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He has acquired a lot of experience growing corn because he has only ever worked with the land. 

Sixto needs a loan because he is growing 7,000 square meters of corn. For this, he will need to purchase four bags of fertilizer and one bag of corn seeds, and pay laborers. Sixto's dream is that his harvest will be good so that he can earn profits, pay off the loan, and have enough money left over to continue growing.

loans.use: to grow 7,000 square meters of corn, for which he will purchase four bags of fertilizer and one bag of corn seeds, and pay laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install plumbing for clean water and sewage in order to have better access in the bathroom and toilet, and so improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy feed and hay for her dairy cows and hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell and support his family.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret, 27, is married and is blessed with 4 children. She does farming and has been growing cash crops to sell. She will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm, and she hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her dairy farming, make more income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer for use in her farm.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 56 years old, married, and has five children.

Azucena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Azucena has been raising pigs for 11 years. She has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF -- and more recently, from Kiva -- to sustain it.

Azucena requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from selling home products.

Aileen dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Bahtiniso

texts.ru:
Бахтинисо проживает на районе Чиликул. У Бахтинисо одна дочка.  Она разведена с мужем и живет  на районе с дочерью. Бахтинисо занимается в родном районе животноводством. Ей в работе помогает ее брат. Она 3 года своей жизни занимается этой деятельностью.  Бахтинисо любит домашних животных, по этой причине она занимается животноводством. Ей в деятельности нравится доить коров и обеспечивать семью молоком и молочными продуктами. Она берет кредит, чтобы  купить несколько голов скота и расширить деятельность. Животноводческая деятельность является основной источником дохода, потому что доход от этой деятельности обеспечить ее семью. Бахтинисо добрая и заботливая мать. Она любить свою дочь, и хочет улучшить ее условия жизни.
В будущем за счет дохода от животноводства Бахтинисо планирует увеличить поголовье скота. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahtiniso lives in the Jilikul region. She is divorced from her husband and lives with her only daughter. She works in animal husbandry with the help of her brother, an occupation she has had for three years. She loves domestic animals, which is why she chose this work. She likes to milk the cows and provide milk and dairy products to her family.

Bahtiniso is taking out a loan in order to buy a few head of cattle and expand her business. Her animal husbandry is her main source of income, since she uses income from this business to provide for her family. Bahtiniso is a kind and caring mother. She loves her daughter and wants to improve her living conditions. In the future she plans to use profits from her business to increase her head count of livestock. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock and expand her business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old, married, and has two children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from rice-farming and food-vending businesses. 

Analyn requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. She has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Analyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to work with her corn crop.

loans.name: Na Tau 13 Group

texts.en:
Xien, 39, is an ethnic Thai lady who is married and has two children, ages 13 and 16. She lives with her husband and her two children in an ethnic Thai  traditional house in a remote village where people mainly rely on agriculture for a living. 

Just like other residents in the village, Xien and her husband work very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry for a living and to provide for the children. They grow rice, cassava, corn and edible canna, and they raise buffalo, pigs, chickens, and musk ducks. 

This is the first time Xien has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the pigs. She believes that with the financial support and the training in techniques of raising pig provided by the program, the pigs will grow healthily and help her gain good earnings to  gradually improve living conditions for her family. 

Xien dreams that her children will enter good colleges and get good jobs and have a bright future. In the picture, she stands first on the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married businesswoman who resides in Nairobi. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. Her husband is not employed which means that educating her children has been more of a struggle for her although somehow she has managed to keep them in school. The hardship of trying to make ends enabled Gladys to venture into different businesses. That is when she came across a Fresh Life operator, who, after educating her about the business, advised her to acquire one. Gladys was interested and started looking for a location to install the toilet.

Gladys is requesting a loan to pay for two Fresh Life toilets. She is very inspired by the franchise business and believes that she will be able to earn enough money to repay her loan as well as educate her children. She will not close her other businesses because her husband is very willing to assist her with her work. In the future, Gladys intends to add more toilets within her informal settlement area to improve sanitation standards of people in her community.

loans.use: to pay for two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Na Tau 15 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuan is a 25-year-old who divorced woman and she has brought up her 4-year-old daughter. She currently lives with her parents, her three brothers, her sister-in-law and her child in a Thai ethnic traditional house at a small remote village. She works very hard to provide for her child and support her big family. She works for construction employers and this is heavy and tough work. She also grows edible canna, raises pigs and chickens to have additional income. 

Mrs. Xuan has always wanted to increase and expand her agriculture production to have a more stable and better income. For that reason, she has taken out a second loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy piglets and expand pig farming. She hopes that the training in the techniques of raising pigs and the counselling provided by the Program's staff will help her increase efficiency of production as well as gain good income from the investment. 

Mrs. Xuan dreams a brighter future for her daughter. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and expand pig farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 31 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. She is a farmer and grows cash crops to sell. She will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and provide food for her family. Her future hopes are to improve her farming by growing more cash crops, increase her income and support her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. She hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce to sell and be able to support her family.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 51 years old and married with three children. One of her children is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Belinda is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Belinda has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Esabel

texts.en:
Esabel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Esabel is 56 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Esabel has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Esabel requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Esabel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Esabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 28 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Jovelyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafoods to sell.

Jovelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafoods to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 47 years old and has two children. She is married, and both of her children are in school.

Teodora is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Dayib

texts.en:
Dayib is 26 years old and lives in Hargeisa. He is married and he has four children. 

Dayib has a grocery and small shop that he started in 2010. Dayib works at his grocery and small shop. He uses his income-generating activity to pay the children's school fees. 

Dayib wants to expand his grocery and small shop and he requested a loan of $1,000 from Kaaba MFI. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables and will help to generate greater profits and increase his working capital. 

In the future, he will be able to expand his grocery and small shop .

loans.use: To expand his grocery and small shop.

loans.name: Na Tau 12 Group

texts.en:
Cuc is 28 years old, married and the mother of a 2-year-old girl. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her small daughter in an ethnic Thai traditional house in a remote small village. 

They rely on agriculture production for a living with plenty of activities, including cultivating rice, raising cows, goats, pigs, breeding fish, chickens and ducks. Cuc works very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry to support the family, and her husband works as a police officer. 

This is the first time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use it to buy food for the pigs to increase production. She hopes that she can gradually improve income for her family. 

Cuc dreams that her daughter will grow up healthily, study well and have a bright future. In the picture, she stands first on the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs to increase production.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 23 years old, married and has one child. 

Felipa is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Felipa requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felipa has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is a hardworking and responsible young man. He is married and has one child. 

He does machine repairs at his garage. Since his last loan from Kiva, Stepan has hired an employee.

Stepan is asking for a loan of 35,000 UAH to do renovations in the new part of his house. He wants to install a new window, put in a floor, ceiling and walls. The loan will help to make a huge step towards his dream to expand the living space of his family.

loans.use: to do renovation and increase space for his family.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana has been selling women's clothes at the local market for 22 years. A previous Kiva loan enabled her to purchase summer inventories of pants, dresses and tunics.

Oksana is a responsible and open person. She wants to develop her business further.

Oksana is asking for a loan of 31 000 UAH to increase the assortment of women's summer clothes. The loan will help her to get new clients.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of women's summer clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dairy feeds, napier grass and hay for her dairy cows and hopes this will enable her to get more milk to sell.

loans.name: Chirley

texts.en:
Chirley is 57 years old and lives in Mabini, Baliangao, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Chirley has a sari-sari store and has had this business for 5 years. 

Chirley uses her backyard to raise pigs. She requested a loan to buy 2 piglets and 2 sacks of feed so she will have another source of income. Chirley has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Chirley hopes to increase her income and buy goats so she can expand her income.

loans.use: to buy additional 2 piglets and 2 sack of feed.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 64 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell. Celerina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of bananas.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and has five children. She is married, and four of her children are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilou has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nelieta

texts.en:
Nelieta is 54 years old and married with seven children.

Nelieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Nelieta has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nelieta aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia is 51 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Remegia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Remegia has been farming corn for three years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marjorie has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and married with four children.  

She is in the agricultural business and farms sugarcane in the Philippines. Virginia requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming sugarcane for twenty years and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elevenia

texts.en:
Elevenia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs. 

Elevenia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store and a business raising livestock.

Alejandra dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, es ama de casa, debido a la pobreza en que vivía con sus padres, le fue imposible estudiar una carrera universitaria, más sin embargo estudió hasta quinto grado; luego se casó y de esa relacion nacieron 2 hijos, que son el apoyo incondicional para ella, ya que le ayudan en la agricultura, al igual que un nieto que es el que vive con ella; su esposo falleció hace 8 años, sus dos hijos están casados pero son el soporte para ella, porque siempre están pendientes. 

María, conoce todo acerca de la agricultura desde hace 30 años aproximadamente, lo aprendió de sus padres y luego cuando se casó, le ayudaba a su esposo ya que él tambien conocia de este trabajo.

El préstamo que está solicitando María, es para comprar insumos agricolas como: abono, semilla y pesticidas para atacar la plaga.

El sueño de María es, obtener buenos resultados de su cosecha, para venderla a un buen precio, cancelar a tiempo la deuda y de la ganacia cubrir algunas necesidades básicas para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María, age 55, is a housewife.  Due to the poverty in which her parents lived, it was impossible for her to get a university degree.  Nevertheless, she did go to school through the fifth grade.
