Later, she got married and had two children, who give her unconditional support.  They help her with the farming as does a grandson who lives with her.  Her husband passed away eight years ago.  Her two children are married, but they are her support because they always watch out for her.

María knows everything about agriculture.  She learned approximately 30 years ago from her parents.  Then she got married and helped her husband, who also knew about this work.

The loan that María is requesting is to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to attack infestation.

María’s dream is to get good results from her harvest in order to sell it for a good price, to repay her debt on time, and to use her earnings to cover some of the basic necessities for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to attack infestation.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 37, is from Dioyo, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her pig-raising business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gives her best efforts to produce good pigs in order to sell them continuously.

Nancy is now trying to expand her pig business and has also decided to venture into a little restaurant. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs.

In addition, she wanted her business to be well known and to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they may have stable careers.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet and feed.

loans.name: Ma. Jeanilee

texts.en:
Ma. Jeanilee is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Jeanilee is 39 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Jeanilee has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Ma. Jeanilee requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Jeanilee would like to save enough money to expand her busines.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Juditha works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Juditha is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Juditha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Ligaya works hard to support her family.

She has a fish veding business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell in her food stall.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: travel to Guinea to buy clothing materials, bags of rice etc for her business

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, logro mejorar el inventario de su negocio con la ayuda del crédito anterior, con los ingreso ha cancelado su deuda y cubierto necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Como el negocio es de subsistencia está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar azúcar, jabón, detergentes, arroz, maíz, harina para tortillas y para pan, etc., para reactivar la tienda, su principal objetivo es tener la mercadería necesaria para seguir teniendo clientes satisfechos.
texts.en: Ana was able to improve the inventory of her business with the help of her previous loan. With the income she has paid off her debt and taken care of basic needs for her household. Since her business sells basic necessities, she is requesting a new loan to buy sugar, soap, detergents, rice, flour for tortillas and bread, etc. to restock the store. Her main goal is to have the merchandise needed to keep her clients satisfied.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, detergents, rice, corn, flour for tortillas and bread, etc. to restock the store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old, a widow with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maria has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Maria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: In 2013, Mila learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Mila tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Mila loaned another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help her farming income a big boost. Mila looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and compost

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 63 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children who are now adults. Lolita is engaged in fishing activity particularly operating a fishing boat. Lolita earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity in which the said amount is so helpful to meet her needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Lolita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is married but no child yet. She is 38 years old and lives in Cawayan, Mabini, Baliangao. She earns a living offering home service manicure/pedicure services. She now has been in this business for about 3 years and well known for the nice quality of services she offers. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and was able to save from it. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 2,000 per month. 

Lina is seeking a PHP 10,000 loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for her foot spa services. In her previous loans she has never had a delinquency. Lina is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy new items for her foot spa services

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.
She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is 52 years old, and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, who are now adults or school ages. Florida has been engaged in a snack vending business for more than ten years. She also loves to raised hogs, her new livelihood activity. She earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She is also receiving support from her husband, who is a farmer, and from her son, who is a seaman. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional 3 heads of piglets and sacks of feeds for her hog raising business. Florida has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Florida hopes to diversify her snack vending business.

loans.use: To be used for purchasing 3 heads of piglets and sacks of feed

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en: From Oroquieta City, Andresa earns a living through her clothing sales. She sees to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. For her capital needs, PMPC stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. To earn more, she applied a loan to purchase more clothing inventories to sell. Andresa hopes to live comfortably with adequate income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventories to sell

loans.name: Ma. Mercelita

texts.en:
Ma. Mercelita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Mercelita is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Mercelita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Ma. Mercelita requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy curtains, pillow cases, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing .

Ma. Mercelita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ma. Mercelita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy curtains, pillow cases, blouses and other ready-to-wear clothing .

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 64 years old, a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marciana has a general store business in the Philippines. Marciana requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks and beverages.

Marciana has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marciana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks and beverages.

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia, 50, is a widow with five children.  Her husband worked as a contractual laborer in construction but earned just enough for hand-to-mouth needs and she is now striving hard to earn a living without a stable job. The education of her three children and the day-to-day consumption was challenging, so she decided to open a store selling basic commodities.  

She is thankful that they joined Paglaum MPC. With very little capital, she was able to start her sari-sari (general store) business. The daily sales go the extra mile for the family's needs. She was also able to save the extra income. She has applied to Paglaum MPC for additional capital of PHP 10,000. She says she was attracted to Paglaum MPC for its savings and insurance services of the cooperative. She wants to gradually expand the little store and have a taste of a good life someday.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her grocery store

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 57 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now adults. 

Rosie earns a living from her own sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has been in this business for 12 years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month from her business. 

She has requested a loan to purchase groceries and other consumable goods to sell retail. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. 

In the future, Rosie hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Novembrita

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Novembrita, 56 years old, residing in the Sepac Municipality of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Novembrita has 4 children and is married to a carpenter.  The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs in their family. So, Novembrita started a business, a food stand or “carenderia” at her own home.  Novembrita has been in the business more than a year now. 

Novembrita wants to expand her food stand business.  She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and she would be able to send her son to college. In order for Novembrita to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 50,000.00 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business.  She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen utencils and ingredients

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a furniture maker. From the working garage which is located on the ground floor of his house, Armen makes different type of furniture. Some year's ago, Armen has also started jalousie production. He is very skilled and provides high quality works and due to that receives numbers of orders during the month. 

Armen  lives with his wife and three chidlren (12,11 and 6-years-old). Armen is the only worker in the family, because his wife has too much work to do with the children and household. 

Armen has now applied for this loan to purchase equipment needed for furniture making. He wants to enlarge his business so the requested loan is very important. 
Armen's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business loans to informal businesses that do not qualify through normal channels.

loans.use: to pay for equipment needed for furniture making to be able to take on more orders from customers and gather income for the family

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maria Luz is 32 years old and has one child who is in school.

Maria Luz has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Maria Luz requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Maria Luz has been in this business for four years. In the future, Maria Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is 33 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Prescilla has a buying and selling spices business in the Philippines. Prescilla requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell.

Prescilla has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Prescilla would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is from Larena. 

She operates a ready-to-wear (RTW) business and sells house-to-house in their barangay (village). Recently Lena has taken out a loan to purchase stock for her RTW business. 

Lena deeply wishes to save enough for their children's education.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her ready-to-wear (RTW) business

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en: Rufo is 48 years old with four children.  Rufo personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. He already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  He also wants to buy the fish catch of his neighbors so he can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  He wishes to see his children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase some new fishing nets

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 41 years old, residing at Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. Recently, she's accessing her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 12,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy variety of commodities which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities for her food products business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 60 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children who are now adults.

Alberto earns his income from buying and selling good lumber. He has been in this activity for 2 years already and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

He is also engaged in agri-business, particularly in coconut production and hog fattening. He has requested a loan to purchase sacks of feed for his hog fattening activity. He has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. 

In the future, Alberto hopes to become a major supplier of coconut and wood lumber in the area.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of feed for his hog fattening activity

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers. She has a small piece of farm land near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs. Rosalinda dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Harry

texts.en: Harry shows his newly renovated house from his savings as a farmer. He is a dedicated father who dreams big for his family. Harry is not only a farmer but also a business man. He accepts rentals on his thresher machine and does warehousing of palay for a minimal fee. Harry hopes that with his new loan to buy cement and paint for finishing of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and paints for finishing of his house

loans.name: Las Minas Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad oaxaqueña se combinan la riqueza natural del paisaje con el adelanto industrial. Por un lado es un territorio muy tranquilo conocido por su aire puro y sus parajes llenos de árboles; por otro, es una zona que cuenta con uno de los ingenios azucareros más importantes de la región y también con una gran planta eléctrica. 
   Allí se creó el grupo Las Minas quienes comentan “El préstamo que nos otorguen será la mina de oro para iniciar con el crecimiento de nuestros negocios”. Los miembros son: Mirella quien vende fruta y cosméticos; Alondra, pollo; Guillermina, cerámica y regalos mientras que María maneja una tienda de abarrotes. 
   Doña Guillermina es una mujer muy trabajadora en su comunidad la conocen como Guille o Mina de cariño. Es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales sólo uno continúa viviendo con ella, juntos cubren los gastos del hogar. La actividad que realiza desde hace catorce años es la venta de artículos de cerámica. 
   Al inicio vendía de manera ambulante por lo que acomodaba su mercancía de forma delicada para no romper las macetas, floreros y adornos. A pesar de que mucha gente no confiaba en el éxito de la actividad, Doña Guille demostró que con esfuerzo y dedicación se pueden cumplir los objetivos, “estoy orgullosa de mí, pues con las ganancias obtenidas logré dar estudio a mis hijos, hice crecer mi negocio y continúo como productora de caña” comenta con una sonrisa en el rostro.
   Desde hace cuatro años logró acondicionar un local y ahora vende de forma estable desde casa aunque no deja de salir de vez en cuando a las calles para seguir ofreciendo las figurillas. Para ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos doña Guille invierte parte de las ganancias y los préstamos en comprar más mercancía; esta vez comprará macetas y bolsas de mano.
   En un futuro planea abrir una papelería debido a que no existe ninguna cerca de la localidad y quiere aprovechar la situación. 
   “Gracias por facilitarnos el crecimiento de nuestras actividades si antes eran minas activas ahora son súper activas pues nos reditúan mejores ganancias” son las palabras del grupo.

*Doña Guille es quien tiene en la mano una gallina de cerámica, en la foto se aprecia la mercancía de su actividad.
texts.en:
A community in Oaxaca combines the natural beauty of it's landscapes with industrial progress. On one hand it is a very quiet region known for it's pure air and it's tree filled areas and on the other it is an area that has one of the biggest sugar mills of the region and also has a large electric plant. The "Las Minas" communal bank was formed here who commented "The loan that will be awarded us will be the gold mine to start the growth of our businesses".

The members are; Mirella who sells fruit and cosmetics, Alondra sells chicken, Guillermina sells pottery and gifts while María operates a grocery store.

Guillermina is a very hard-working woman who is known with love as Guille or Mina in the community. She is the mother of 5 children of which only one still lives with her and together they cover the household expenses. Her business for the past 14 years has been selling pottery. She began selling itinerantly so she had to pack her merchandise carefully so as not to break the flowerpots, vases and decorations.

In spite of the fact that many people did not think her business would be successful, Guille demonstrated that with effort and dedication you can achieve your goals. "I am proud of myself, as with the profits I managed to educate my children, grow my business, and continue as a sugar producer". she commented with a smile on her face.

Four years ago she adapted a place and now sells in a regular way from her house although she hasn't stopped going out in the streets to offer her figurines. In order to offer a greater variety of products Guille invest part of her profits and the loans buying more merchandise. this time she will buy flowerpots and handbags. In the future she plans to open a stationary shop since there isn't one close to her location and she wants to take advantage of the situation.

"Thank you for helping the growth of our businesses. If before they were active mines now they are super active as they yield more profits" are the words from the group. Guille is the person holding the pottery chicken in the photo so you can see the merchandise from her business.

loans.use: to buy flowerpots and handbags.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janice is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Janice has a general store business in the Philippines. Janice requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Janice has been in this business for five years. In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, de 22 años de edad, es agricultor y actualmente vive con sus padres porque está soltero, estudió hasta noveno grado y no pudo seguir sus estudios por la falta de recursos económicos.

Manuel, trabaja en la agricultura desde que estaba pequeño, ya que sus padres se han dedicado a este trabajo toda la vida, tambien desde hace 4 años aproximadamente se dedica a las estructuras metalicas, este trabajo lo aprendió de su hermano, juntos tienen un pequeño taller en su casa y es otra fuente de ingreso para ayudar a sus padres.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar un soldador y una pulidora para mejorar su taller y brindarles un mejor servicio a los clientes.

El sueño de Manuel, es ampliar su taller para ofrecer mejores servicios a los clientes, asi mismo desea hacer una casa propia, para darle una mejor vida a su esposa e hijos cuando se case.
texts.en:
Manuel, 22, works in agriculture and lives with his parents since he is still single. He attended school until the ninth grade, but could not continue his education for a lack of funds. 

Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was small, as his parents have done this work all their lives. For the past four years or so he has also done metalwork, which he learned from his brother. Together they have a small shop in their home, and this is another source of income to help out their parents. 

He will use the loan to purchase a soldering iron and polisher to improve their shop and offer better services to their customers. 

Manuel's dream is to expand their shop to offer better services to their customers, and to build his own house someday so he can give his wife and children a better life once he gets married.

loans.use: to purchase a soldering iron and polisher to improve his shop and offer better services to his customers.

loans.name: Thanh An 6 Group

texts.en:
Mr. Khoi is 26 years old, is married and has a 5-year-old daughter. He lives with his wife and his child in a Thai ethnic traditional house. He works as a welder while his wife works at agriculture production to earn a living. Apart from the time working at the factory, he usually supports his wife with the hard work of cultivation and animal husbandry, such as growing rice, corn, and raising pigs, chickens and muskovy ducks. 

This is the third time he has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and he will use the loan to buy piglets. He hopes that his investment will go well and improve his family's income significantly. 

Mr. Khoi dreams that his family will soon escape from poverty and his daughter will have a bright future. In the picture, he stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets, so as to be able to improve his family's income and escape from poverty

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 52 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Aida is engaged in salted pry “uyap” (mixed salt/shrimp) processing and vending activity. She earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional kilos of pry, glass jars and sealer for her salted pry "uyap" processing and vending business. Aida became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Aida hopes that her product will be exported to other nearby towns and cities business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional kilos of salted pry (salt/shrimp mix), glass jars and sealer

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 75 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children now at their adult age. 
Nicolasa owns a parcel of agri-land that produces root crops like sweet potato, “gabi” and cassava. She has been in this activity for over 30 years already and earning an average monthly income of PHP2,000.00 each month doing this activity.  

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials like bamboo “amakan” for house repair.  
Nicolasa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Nicolasa hopes to engage in a buy and sell business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing construction materials like bamboo “amakan” for house repair

loans.name: Jacinita

texts.en: Jacinita has a piece of agricultural land in Calaran, Calamba. She grows rice and root crops and earns well for her family. She is thankful that Paglaum MPC has been her constant financing partner for her farming activities. Now, she applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost. Jacinita hopes to have a good yield so that she can save for emergencies.

loans.use: to pay seedlings and compost

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary has banana farm in Pta. Sulong, Baliangao, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she plant bananas and grow root crops. Rosemary makes it a point to have good land preparation to have maximum yield and a good income. She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing of land and holing and planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC. Rosemary wishes to have more produce and be able to supply agri-products in the market.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing of land

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 23 years old, married and has one child. 

Gene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gene requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to renovate and improve her pigpens.

Gene has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gene would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to renovate and improve her pigpens.

loans.name: Souleymane's Group

texts.fr: Souleymane qui se trouve sur la photo étant au bout à gauche, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mamissa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Souleymane, âgé de 60 ans, est le père de 10 enfants âgés de 10 à 32 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Souleymane à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Il a mentionné que, "c'est la pauvreté." Souleymane cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériel agricoles. Souleymane entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Souleymane effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Souleymane cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Souleymane planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements de vendre les excédents. Enfin Souleymane espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Souleymane is at the far left in the photo. He is part of a group of 7 farmers who have partnered with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Mamissa, southeast of Bamako in Mali. 

Souleymane, age 60, is the father of ten children aged 10 to 32, none of them currently in school. His family's long-standing tradition in farming as the main source of revenue and food self-sufficiency for the household is why he started farming 40 years ago. “It’s poverty” he explains.   

Souleymane grows groundnuts and rice on his plot, but he faces challenges such as insufficient rain and a lack of farming equipment. This is his first year with myAgro; he signed up because of the potential to bolster his productivity through the services available. This year, Souleymane is buying one myAgro packet of OPV seeds and fertilizers to grow groundnuts and increase the yield of his 0.25-hectare holding. 

Souleymane started growing groundnuts 10 years ago for its value as a staple food because it is directly edible by the family, and it is used as a base sauce in cooking; it is also a profitable and marketable crop.  

Souleymane hopes that an increase in productivity will leave him with a surplus to sell. He also wishes to be able to finance his children’s weddings.

loans.use: to buy one packet of seeds and some fertilizers to grow groundnuts and bolster the yield of his plot.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corrugated metal, wood, nails and wire to replace the roof over the corridor in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy small fish and expand her fish farming industry to provide a better income for her family

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is married with four children. She is 69 years old and lives in Calaran, Calamba. Perla is a farmer and grows palay (unhusked rice) and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and compost. Perla has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Perla hopes to harvest more palay and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost for for her rice fields

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her motor transport business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. Recently, she requested a loan to pay for motorbike licenses and franchising in order to boost her income. 

In the future, she would like to build pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale for additional income.

loans.use: to pay for motorbike licenses and franchising

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is from Alcantara, Cebu. She is 40 years old with one daughter who is 14 years old. Mary Ann has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business for three years now. From this small business, she usually earn PHP 4,000 per month. She is also raising hogs for a living. 

She is asking a loan to buy stocks for her store such as to buy chips; candies; sachets of shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste and detergent powder; canned food; cooking oil; coffee; milk; and feed, and to pay for the tuition fee of her daughter. 

Mary Ann’s income also help her husband, who works as a driver. In the future, she hope to successfully send her daughter to college.

loans.use: to buy chips; candies; sachets of shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste and detergent powder; canned food; cooking oil; coffee; milk; and feed, and to pay for the tuition fee of her daughter

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
Aireen hails from Alcantara, Cebu. She is married with four children. Her eldest is 12 and the youngest is 1. Aireen has been raising hogs for seven years. She likes this business because she can earn while also looking after her whole family. She barely earns PHP 7,000 per month, but this also helps her spouse, who is a carpenter. Together they earn for their family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed and pay for school fees. Like most mothers, she only dreams of sending her children to school so that they will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed and pay for school fees

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and from Badian, Cebu. She and her husband have been blessed with 10 children, most of whom are grown. The youngest is 11 years old. Theirs has been a hard life, raising many children and relying mostly on farming and raising hogs. 

For the last four years, Rebecca has been concentrating on raising hogs, while her husband is farming to earn a living. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs. Quality feed has been attributed to fatter hogs that will help Rebecca earn a better revenue. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 47-year-old married woman from Jenin City. She is a mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income.

Heyam works as a farmer in the family agricultural land. Her sons help her in the farm work. She took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the farm. This will improve the family business and increase its productivity. 

Heyam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.name: Jay Neil

texts.en: Jay Neil is 29 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child now of school age. Jay Neil earns his living from sales of duck's eggs, as one of the suppliers in the area. He earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of livelihood activity. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional 100 ducklings in addition to his existing duck raising and laying business. Jay Neil has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Jay Neil hopes to expand his duck raising and laying business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing an additional 100 ducklings to expand his duck egg business

loans.name: Ernelyn

texts.en: Ernelyn lives in Larena, Siquijor and supports her family through gasoline retailing. She has thought this retailing business as there is a high demand in their local barangay which is located far from the town proper.  She has applied a loan, which she used to purchase gasoline for retail. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline for retail in her roadside stall

loans.name: Molmol

texts.ru: Молмол, успешно погасила свой кредит. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании кредита в тот непростой момент после печальных событий на юге страны, когда полностью пострадал и был разрушен ее бизнес. Молмол восстановила и развила свой магазин, на сегодня в обороте есть товар на сумму примерно 148,000 сом (KGS), это преимущественно скатерти, коврики, мыло-моющие изделия. Она вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Молмол направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и свадьбу сыновей, так как она давно уже мечтает стать бабушкой.
texts.en: Molmol successfully repaid her previous loan. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing during the difficult time after the tragic events in the south of the country, when her business was destroyed. Molmol has restored and developed her store and currently has 148,000 som (KGS) worth of goods in stock, mainly tablecloths, mats, soap and cleaning products. She applied for another loan with Bai-Tushum Bank, this time for 150,000 som (KGS) to expand her inventory. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to develop her business further and to pay for her son's wedding. She has dreamed of becoming a grandmother for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her shop in order to increase her assortment of goods and attract new customers

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 53 years old and has ten children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Alejandra is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Alejandra has been farming vegetables for twenty-three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gs Los Amigoa Group

texts.es:
El Señor Marcelino tiene 53 años de edad, es padre de cinco hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar. Su actividad es la caficultura, su finca  esta ubicada en la Aldea de la Paz, en el departamento de Trojes al oriente de Honduras,
Don Marcelino con el credito  que esta solicitando podrá obtener una planta solar que el a soñado ya que en su comunidad no hay energía eléctrica y con esta inversión el beneficiara su finca y a su familia ya que tendrán una mejor calidad de vida.
Don Marcelino su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, sueño que ha tenido desde hace tiempo el cual se le ara realidad con el apoyo de la Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA.
Don Marcelino El credito lo solicita en grupo ya que quiere que el beneficio llegue a varios vecinos de su comunidad por lo que se han organizado en grupo.
Humberto se dedica a la caficultura y Oscar que también se dedica a la caficultura ellos comparten el mismo sueño de llevar la energía a sus hogares.                                                                   


                                                                                                     Trojes, Honduras Abril 2015
texts.en:
Marcelino is 53 years old and the father of five children.  He lives with his partner.  His business is coffee farming.  His farm is located in Aldea de la Paz (Peace Village), in the department of Trojes in eastern Honduras.  With the loan Marcelino is requesting, he will be able to obtain a solar energy plant that he has dreamed of since in his community, there is no electricity and this investment will benefit his farm and his family since they will have a better quality of life.  Marcelino's dream is to improve the living conditions of his family, a dream he's had for a long time that will become a reality with the support of Microfinanciera Prisma of Honduras and KIVA.  

The loan is being requested as a group since they want many neighbors in the community to receive the benefits and that's why they have organized in a group.  Humberto works as a coffee farmer and Oscar works farming coffee as well.  They share the same dream of bringing energy to their homes.                                                                                              

Trojes, Honduras April 2015

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy plant for his home.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is a 63-year-old widow from the town of Badian in the province of Cebu. For 20 years now, she has been engaged in a hog raising business. She also does farming of vegetables and corn and raises goats for a living. Perpetua’s challenges include her limited funds to keep her pigs and farm healthy.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and feed. Perpetua can work better once her fertilizer and feed are taken care of. This means that she will have the chance to buy feed per the sack and not on a per kilo basis. This will help fatten her hogs, which will be easier to market in the coming months.  

Any additional income that she will generate will be used for healthy meals and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 33 years old and from Alegria, Cebu. She is a mother to an 11-year-old son. Mary Jane has been engaged in a transportation business using her tricycle. This vehicle transport passengers from her place to the next village or as requested. This has been her business for five years. On average, she earns PHP 10,000 per month from this business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy another sidecar. It is her dream to continue expanding so she can secure the needs of her child and their future as a family.

loans.use: to buy another sidecar

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда ответственный человек. Ей 39 лет, и он из района Дж.Руми. В этом районе она поселилась очень давно. Махсуда живет с детьми. Ее муж находится на заработках загранице, и каждый месяц отправляет им деньги. Махсуда с молодостью занималась животноводством, и до сегодняшнего дня продвигает свою любимую работу. Она 7 лет занята этой деятельностью. Махсуда много мечтала о расширении своего бизнеса. Единственным ограничением для нее стала отсутствие денег, чтобы реализовать задуманное. За счет запрашиваемого кредита она хочет приобрести скота. В данный момент вести хозяйство ей помогают дети. Махсуда не останавливается на достигнутом и продолжает дальше расти и реализовываться.
texts.en: Mahsuda is an honest person. She is 39 and comes from the J.Rumi district, where she settled down a long time ago. Mahsuda lives with her children while her husband works abroad and sends money home every month. Since she was a child, Mahsuda has raised livestock, which is her favorite type of work and her current occupation. She has been raising livestock for seven years. Mahsuda has dreamed a lot of expanding her business, but the only limit was her lack of funds. She wants to purchase livestock with the loan she requested. Her children currently help her around the farm. Mahsuda does not relent and continues to grow her business and realize her goals.

loans.use: to buy livestock and advance her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn makes a living through her snack vending business.She has signed up her membership with PMPC to gain access of capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she availed a loan to purchase more snack ingredients to sell. Evelyn hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more snack ingredients  to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a farmer and sells rice to the local community. She is a 54-year-old married woman who never tires of selling and working. She earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Teresita is a full fledged member of PMPC and has received several previous loans. She maintains her membership in good standing. She will use the loan to purchase rice to sell which will increase her inventory and sales. Teresita continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell in her community

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina has always dreamed of opening and managing her own retail store to support her needs. Marina is a widow and lives in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. She applied for a loan to restock her store with inventory items slippers, sandals, snickers and shoes. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits and supporting her children.

loans.use: to restock her store with inventory items slippers, sandals, snickers and shoes

loans.name: Tomasito  Sr.

texts.en:
Tomasito Sr. is 65 years old and lives in Pta. Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  He is married with two children now at their adult age. Tomasito Sr. is engaged in plastic, scrap metal and other junk collecting activities and coconut production, and has been for several years. He has been earning approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

He has requested a loan to be used as down payment for a second-hand motorcycle to be used for business. Tomasito Sr. has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Tomasito Sr. hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to use as down payment for a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 31-years-old married woman from Jabalia city.  She is a mother for four children, two sons and two daughters. Her husband works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a very low income. Maryam and her husband would like to buy all the needed items for the family house.

Maryam took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. This will decrease their electricity usage
Maryam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 55 years old and lives in Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents. Manuel loves to be raising hogs and presently has 6 heads in his back yard. He's in the business for 5 years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP each month. 

He has requested a loan to purchase 3 piglets and sacks of feed. Manuel has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Manuel hopes to expand his hog raising business by building additional hog fences for his pigs.

loans.use: To purchase 3 piglets and sacks of feed

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a resident of Alcantara, Cebu. She is 61 years old with four grown children. Arsenia is engaged in buying and selling of tuba (coconut wine). She also raise hogs for a living. Coconut wine when fresh is consumed by locals like wine or liquor. And if after a few days, when fermented they use it to make vinegar. There is a high demand for vinegar from coconut wine due to its distinct taste. 

She is asking a loan of PHP22000 to buy feed and more coconut wine to sell. She hope that someday her business will become more sustainable and will eventually give her a better return of investment.

loans.use: to buy feed and more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Gelna

texts.en: Gelna signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Gelna was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita has agricultural land in Aloran. She and her husband are both farmers. They plant corn, vegetables, and other crops. Rosita makes good earnings doing this type of work, which is the primary source of income for her family. To expand her resources, Rosita makes it a point to prepare the land well for planting dwarf coconut and banana seedlings, as well as root crops. This preparation gives her the maximum yield and generates a good income. 

Recently, Rosita needed an amount to pay for clearing land, digging the soil, and planting seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Rosita wishes to sustain her business and to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for clearing land, digging the soil, and planting seedlings

loans.name: Anilu

texts.es:
Anilu tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio, ganadería y agricultura.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, cerdos, gallinas, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales con gran influencia en su negocio, con esto Anilu espera incrementar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anilu is 25 with a partner and two children. She lives with her family in a rural area in the Cayaltí district which is in the Chiclayo Province of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Perú. Life in this area is peaceful. The residents mostly make their living in commerce, ranching and agriculture. She makes her living raising and selling animals such as ducks, chickens, roosters, pigs, and more. Her business is located in her home. She has more than 5 years of experience in this business with good personal and business references in the area. 

The current loan will be used to buy a larger number of animals such as pigs, guinea pigs,and chickens to augment her stock. This investment will increase the variety and productivity of her stock which will have a big effect on her business. With it Anilu hopes to increase her earnings and, as a result, improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of animals such as pigs, guinea pigs,and chickens to increase the stock for her business.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar ladrillos, cemento, láminas, palas, cucharas, etc., continuara mejorando su vivienda y tendrá equipo necesario para desarrollar sus trabajos de albañilería.
Gracias a la ayuda del financiamiento anterior cuenta con luz eléctrica en su casa propia y realizo otras mejoras en su infraestructura, junto a su familia tiene un mejor estilo de vida  y se deseo es seguir trabajando para pagar la nueva deuda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: José needs a new loan  to buy bricks, cement, laminate sheeting, shovels, trowels, etc. to continue improving his house and have the equipment needed to carry out his work as a bricklayer. Thanks to the help of the last loan he has electricity in his house and made other improvements on the infrastructure. Together with is family he has a better living standard and wants to continue to work to pay off the new loan and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, laminate sheeting, shovels, trowels, etc. to continue improving his house.

loans.name: Flordelona

texts.en:
Flordelona is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 46, is married, in Larena, Siquijor. She runs a store that primarily supports her family. Everyday she never gets tired of tending her store. Flordelona is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. 

Now she borrowed another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities.In the future.She dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell

loans.name: Jose Norvil

texts.es:
José Norvil tiene 40 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y su madre en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana del distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi por zonas aledañas a su distrito, cuenta con 2 mototaxis desde hace 5 años. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de aceite, limpieza de cadena y mantenimiento de su vehículo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Norvil is 40 years old. He lives with his children and his mother in his own home in a large community in the urban area of the Cayalti district. The population there is engaged in agriculture, trade and livestock. The area is located in the Chiclayo povince in the Lambayeque region of northern Peru.

José provides public transport in his motorcycle taxi in the areas around his district. He has had 2 motorcycle taxis for 5 years. He is requesting a loan to pay for oil, chain cleaning and maintenance for his vehicle. In this way he will be able to generate more income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: pay for oil, chain cleaning and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Rosa de 43  años de edad, vive con sus hijos  en casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 08  años al negocio de venta de ropa  usada, vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales como cemento, ladrillos y arena para mejorar su vivienda una parte del repello que le falta de las paredes y también piensa comprar blusas y faldas, etc.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -   Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 43 yeras old. She lives with her children in her own home, She has sold secondhand clothing for eight years. She lives in a village in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead, and she struggles day by day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, bricks and sand to make improvements in her home where plaster is missing from the walls. She also wants to buy blouses, skirts, etc. With the support of this loan she aims to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a returning client who desires to work with Kiva partner Prism.

Her dream is to run a good business and to expland her clientele while improving her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: buy cement, bricks and sand as well as blouses and skirts for her house and her business.

loans.name: Karim's Group

texts.fr: Karim qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, assis à l'extreme droite, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sidio au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Karim, âgé de 47 ans, est le père de 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 26 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture qui lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire pour sa famille, ont incité Karim à exercer cette activité. Karim cultive le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Karim entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Karim effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de mais afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Karim cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Karim planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre sa surface cultivée. Enfin Karim espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants
texts.en:
Karim, the one seated on the far right in the first row in the photo, belongs to a group of seven farmers who have signed up with myAgro. They all live and work in the village of Sidio, to the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Karim, 47 years old, has four children ranging from three to 26 years old, three of whom currently are in school. Farming is his source of income and source of food for his family just as it was for his parents. Karim grows corn on his field. His challenges are low rainfall and the lack of farm supplies and quality fertilizers. 

Karim is starting his first year with myAgro. He has signed up because of the possibility to buy high-quality seeds and fertilizers on an installment plan. This year Karim is making payments on a pack of myAgro OPV [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers needed to increase the yield on his field of 0.125 ha [0.3 acres]. Karim grows corn as a source of food and for its commercial value. With the increase in his yield and his revenue, Karim plans to start raising livestock and increase the size of his field. Finally, Karim hopes to be able to cover the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizers to increase the yield of corn on his field.

loans.name: Welchela

texts.en:
Welchela is a businesswoman from Larena, Siquijor. She is 32 years old ,a widow and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Welchela is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Welchela continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities plus other consumable items

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold operates a motor transport business. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 400 (Philippine pesos) in sales every day, from which he supports his family's needs. To continue his business, Arnold availed himself of a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repairs. He dreams to own some motor units and to be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repairs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 72 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children now at their adult age. Victoria earns a living from snack vending specifically “puto” and ice water vending. She’s been in this business for 10 years already and earns approximately PHP5, 000.00 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet their needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing one brand new freezer for business use.
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. At present, Victoria is enjoying the programs and services of PMPC particularly on loans, insurances and savings.

loans.use: To use in purchasing one brand new freezer

loans.name: Advincula

texts.en:
Advincula, age 41, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with three children, and her husband is a farmer. The store is her means of earning a living in support of her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales.  Advincula keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores.   Advincula believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Advincula has reached her 4th year being a member to Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. "It's already tested", she said.  She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there a good education she could afford for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 61 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with three adult children. Alicia earns her daily income from food particularly viand and snacks processing and vending business for 10 years already. Alicia earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing more meat, ingredients, spices and other seasonings for her food processing and vending business. Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her business by establishing her own eatery.

loans.use: To be used for purchasing more meat, ingredients, spices and other seasonings

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 63 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children now at their adult age. 
Jessica earns a living from snack processing and vending business particularly “suman tinambiran”. She’s been engaged in this business for 12 years already and this business serves as her main source of living. Jessica earns approximately PHP4,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing main ingredients like malagkit rice, sugar and other flavoring for her “suman tinambiran” business. Jessica has been a member of PMPC for 3 years already. In the future, Jessica hopes to expand her “suman tinambiran” business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing main ingredients like malagkit rice, sugar and other flavorings

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 24 years old and from Baniswef. He is single and has 4 siblings. His father is a laborer and has some hearing problems.

Mohammad has a grocery project and uses its income to help his father with the family income and to cover the needs of his siblings.  He wishes to expand his small business to increase his sales and income, so he requested a 3,000 EGP loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as bananas, apples, potatoes and melons.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables such as bananas, apples, potatoes and melons

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 51 years old and has two children. She is married and both children are in school.

Janet is in an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Janet has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 67 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children now at their adult age. 
Bella is a retired public school teacher and presently enjoying her monthly pension. She is also engaged in hog raising livelihood activity with existing 2 pigs.  Bella receives approximately PHP8, 000.00 each month. This amount is so helpful to meet their needs. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for the repair of her pig pen and the remaining amount for sacks of feeds and vitamins.
Bella has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Bella hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing construction materials for repairing the pig pen

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 55 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children now all adult ages. Leonila is engaged in agricultural activities, specifically rice production for 14 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month from doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the SOLAS fees of her son in who is a graduate of marine transportation related course. Leonila has been a member of PMPC almost three years. In the future, she hopes to engage in retailing business.

loans.use: in paying the SOLAS fees for her son's marine transport license certification

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending and raising livestock businesses.

Merlinda dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49 years old, married with six children. Four of her children are in school.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft-drinks, bread, sardines noodles and school supplies to sell.

Lucia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lucia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, bread, sardines noodles and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Maribel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is 28 years old and is from Baniswef. He is married and has two daughters. 

Hussien has a wedding lighting system and DJ project. 

He wishes to expand his project to increase his income and grant his children a decent life. So he requested a 5,000 EGP loan to buy more audio and light system devices.

loans.use: To buy more audio and light system devices.

loans.name: Amelinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Amelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Amelinda is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Amelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 59 years old, married with six children.

Consolacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Consolacion has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and raising livestock businesses.

Consolacion aspires to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 25-year-old from Baniswef. He is single and has 5 siblings. His father is on a pension but the pension income is very small and can't cover the family's monthly expenses. Ayman has a wedding lighting project that he started to help his older brother with the family income and to guarantee decent living conditions for his siblings. He requested an 8,000 EGP loan to buy new lighting system devices to attract more customers so he may increase his income for his family.

loans.use: To buy new lighting system devices.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 39 years old and is from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has three children. 

He has a grocery store business and works as a part time driver. He wishes to develop his business and allow his wife to join him in the business. 

So he requested a 3,000 EGP loan to buy more grocery products such as oil, rice, and pasta and a deep freezer.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products such as oil, rice, and pasta and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam is 46 years old from Alcantara, Cebu. She is married and with three grown children. Meriam has been raising hogs for a decade now. This is her way of helping her husband earn a living when their children were little. She is asking a loan of  PHP25000 to buy noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, insect repellent, candles, chips, shampoo, bath soap and detergent. Meriam hope that by increasing her inventory, she can increase her revenue as well. Her income will be for savings and healthy meals.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, insect repellent, candles, chips, shampoo, bath soap and detergent

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela lives in Badian, Cebu with her partner and children. For two years she has been a tuba (coconut wine) vendor. She also buy and sell mats. She barely earn PHP6000 per month. She is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy food coloring (for coconut wine) and materials for her house renovation like hard wood and nails.  With a loan, it will serve as an additional capital so she can buy more coconut wine to resell together with her partner. In the future, Carmela aimed for business expansion and better business profitability.

loans.use: to buy food coloring (for coconut wine) and materials for her house renovation like hard wood and nails

loans.name: Jay Mahakali Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
This group of 5 women hail from Dahod, India. They are led by Manaben who is standing in the center. Manaben is a 49 year lady with a household of 3 members. The household income is Rs 12,000 which is insufficient to meet all the household expenses. The monthly savings are just Rs 2000. Hence Manaben thought of starting her business to supplement the family income. She started selling vegetables which include tomato, potato, carrot, ginger, cauliflower etc. With this business she is currently earning Rs 3500. 

But she wants to earn more to support her family. Hence she came up with the idea to avail a loan to expand her business. She got together with 4 other women who share similar interests. The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing business. These families on an average earn Rs 10,000 a month out of which they are able to save only Rs 2000. Similar to Manaben, Mangudiben is into selling vegetables which include tomato, potato, carrot, ginger, cauliflower etc. She will use the loan to expand her vegetable store and earn more income. Sharadaben and Manishaben are into selling dairy products which include milk, butter, paneer etc and they will use the loan to buy more supplies of these products to expand their business. Senaben runs a grocery store which includes oil, sugar, ghee etc. She will use the loan to buy more items for her grocery store. Together the group seeks a loan of Rs 50,000. Your loan will help these women earn better and give a good education to their children.

loans.use: To expand her vegetables selling business in order to save for the future

loans.name: Jay Ambey Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
This group of 5 women hails from Dahod, India. They are led by Manjulaben, who is standing in the center. Manjulaben is a 30-year-old mother of 2 children. Her household income is 10,000 INR,  which is insufficient to meet household expenses and pay for children's education. The monthly savings are just 2,000 INR, so Manjulaben thought of starting her business to supplement the family income.

She started selling groceries, which include oil, sugar, rice, ghee, etc. With this business she is currently earning 2,000 INR, but she wants to earn more to support her children's education, so she came up with the idea to avail herself of a loan to expand her business. She got together with 4 other women who share similar interests. 

The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing business. These families on an average earn 10,000 INR a month, out of which they are able to save only 2,000 INR. Similar to Manjulaben, Sangitaben is into selling groceries, which include oil, sugar, rice, ghee, etc. She will use the loan to expand her grocery store and earn more income.

Anjuben is into selling vegetables and she will use the loan to buy more supplies of vegetables to expand her business.  Induben and Ramilaben are into a hotel (restaurant) business and they will use the loan to expand their hotel business which makes tea, fast food, roti, dal rice, snacks, etc.

Together the group seeks a loan of 75,000 INR. Your loan will help these women earn better and give good educations to their children.

loans.use: to expand her grocery business

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is 38 years old and is from Baniswef. She is married to a part-time farmer and she has four sons. 

She helps her husband with the family income by a fattening business. She makes cheese and butter and sells them in the market. 

Mona requested an 8,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to make more cheese and butter to enable her sons to resume their education.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Horeya

texts.en:
Horeya is 32 years old and is from Baniswef. She is married with two children. 

She has a small grocery kiosk that she started to help her husband with the family income and improve the living conditions of her children. Horeya wishes to fill her kiosk with products and to buy a refrigerator to sell cold fizzy drinks. 

So Horeya requested a 3,000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator and some grocery products such as oil, fizzy drinks, and pasta for her kiosk.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and some grocery products such as oil, fizzy drinks, and pasta

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is 33 years old, from Baniswef. She is married to a construction worker and has three sons. 

After her father's death, Heba became financially responsible for her aged and sick mother. Heba decided to start a clothing shop to cover her mother's and children's basic needs, but her project needs development. 

So, she requested an EGP 5,000 loan to buy more clothing to increase her sales and her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 40 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has three sons. After his father's death, Mohammad became financially responsible for his old mother and younger siblings since they have no constant income. He has a small grocery store and it is the only source of income to his whole family. 

Mohammad requested a 5000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator and some grocery products such as frozen vegetables, oil and pasta to expand his store and increase his sales for his family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and some grocery products such as frozen vegetables, oil and pasta.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a woman from Badian, Cebu. She is 47 years old, married with four dependents. Her youngest is twelve and the oldest is eighteen. To help her husband who is a driver, Maria cook hot cakes (pancake) to sell in the afternoon for snacks. She usually earned PHP2500 from this venture. She is asking a loan to buy hot cake ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine and eggs. Maria hope that she can further improve her business in terms of variety for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy hot cakes (pancakes)  ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine and eggs

loans.name: Maria Pilar

texts.en:
Maria Pilar is a 39  year old woman from Badian, Cebu. She is a mother to two children ages one and three. She has been in the hog raising business  for eleven years now. She also sell purified water in her community. Usually, she earned PHP7500 per month from her business.
