Maria Pilar is asking a loan of PHP8000 to buy feed for her hogs. With the loan,  she will be able to grow healthy pigs thus giving her more opportunity of higher sales.
She  wants to develop and improve her business to augment her income. She believes that you only have to be hardworking in order to succeed in your life.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog fattening business

loans.name: Jance Joy

texts.en:
Janice Joy is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two children ages 14 and 15.  She is currently engaged in sari-sari store (corner store) business for five years now. She also buy and sell empty coconut shells. These coconut shells are usually processed to produce charcoal. Her businesses earned her PHP11000 per month.

Janice Joy is asking a loan of PHP12000 to buys stocks for her store such as canned goods, chips, cooking oil, sachet items for coffee, toothpaste, milk, bath soap, hair conditioner, eggs, noodles and soy sauce. She believes that if she will be provided with financial support through loan, she can finally be able to purchase the necessary stocks for her business. 
In the future, Janice Joy believes that through this opportunity she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her larger amount of income. And she hopes that she can continually send her children to school so that they will be able to gain a higher level of learning for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buys stocks for her store such as canned goods, chips, cooking oil, sachet items for coffee, toothpaste, milk, bath soap, hair conditioner, eggs, noodles

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling snack food in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Josephine is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her snack food business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack food business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 34 year old married woman from Badian, Cebu. She is a mother to three children ages three, five and seven. She is engaged in a hog raising business for five years now. She also buys and sells chickens from other people in the community.
This business provides her the income that she needs to help in supporting her family.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services the organization offers. With the loan, Evelyn will be able to buy feed for the pigs and additional piglets to raise.
Evelyn hopes of making her business more profitable and lucrative.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, actualmente vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos, hace más de 20 años inicio a trabajar en la carpintería, oficio que heredó de su familia, trabaja todos los días, elabora muebles por encargo y tiene contratos con comerciales.
Comprará madera, barniz, lijas, clavos, entre otros materiales importantes para elaborar los muebles, espera fabricar camas, roperos y juegos de comedor que le han solicitado sus clientes, se mantendrá trabajando para generar los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son crecer con su carpintería y mantener el apoyo económico a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
José currently lives with his family, made up of his wife and children. More than 20 years ago, he began to work in carpentry, a trade that he inherited from his family. He works every day producing furniture by order and he has contracts with businesses.

He will purchase wood, varnish, sandpaper, and nails, among other materials important for the production of furniture. He hopes to manufacture beds, wardrobes, and dining sets that his customers have requested from him. He will continue working to make the income necessary to come out ahead with his family.

His aspirations are to grow with his carpentry and to economically support his children so that they continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase wood, varnish, sandpaper, and nails, among other materials important to produce furniture.

loans.name: Mary Glenn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mary Glenn works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Glenn is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

Mary Glenn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Mudansir

texts.en: Mudansir is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabon Gida Village. Mudansir joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Mudansir suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Mudansir has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 60 bags of maize this year, Mudansir can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his maize yields

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en: Murtala is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabuwar Unguwa Village. Murtala joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Murtala suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Murtala will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. This season Murtala has ambitious plans to harvest 80 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Murtala now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 24-year-old married lady from small village near Hebron. She lives with her husband in small humble house. Taghreed husband's works as a taxi driver where he gets low income.  Three years ago, Taghreed decided to open her own business.  Her work began in handmade embroideries and now she has loyal customers. 

Taghreed took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to buy yarns and fabrics. After Taghreed takes this loan, she will increase her productivity and sales. Taghreed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy yarns and fabrics for her embroidery business, which helps support herself and her husband.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 49-year-old, divorced woman from Nablus City. She is a mother of one son and she lives with her son in a small house. 

Suzan lives in bad economic conditions, but she has a long experience in sewing where she has worked as a tailor for 20 years. 

Suzan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to buy a new sewing machine.  After she takes this loan, she will increase her production and sales and she will improve her economic situation. 

Suzan appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Segundo Ruperto

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 45 años de edad, vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún una comunidad que se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivo de arroz, maíz, yuca, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como patos, gallinas, cuyes, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales, lo que le permitirá una mejor producción y al mismo tiempo ingresos mayores para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is 45 years old. He lives in a rural zone in the Oyotún District, a community that makes a living from selling young animals and cultivating rice, corn, and yucca. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

He makes a living from raising and selling young animals such as ducks, hens, and guinea pigs. His business is located in the rear of his home. He can count on having experience in this business and the good personal and work references in his district. He has requested a loan to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals, which will allow him a better production and at the same time a higher income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Ediza

texts.en:
Ediza is a 31 year old woman and a resident of Badian, Cebu. She has a daughter who is six years old. She has been in the business of tire capping, selling of gasoline and barbecue in the evening. Her partner is primarily who manages the recapping business. She helped by ensuring that what he needs are bought. 

She is asking a loan of PHP12000 to buy tire caps and also ingredients for barbecue like soy sauce, chicken meat, cooking oil, ground pepper, catsup and charcoal. The business is a lucrative one and she wanted to further do an investment on it.
Ediza hopes that she could expand her ventures and earn as much as she can so that she will be able to serve more buyers. Most importantly, she wanted to send her child to school for her welfare and for her bright future.

loans.use: to buy tire caps and also ingredients for barbecue like soy sauce, chicken meat, cooking oil, ground pepper, catsup and charcoal

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita  is a 32 year old mother of a four children ages one to thirteen from Badian, Cebu. She is currently in the hog raising business and she finds it profitable and improving. She works hard in her business hoping that it could help her sustain and meet their financial needs for their daily living.
Presently, Carmelita needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan worth 6000 PHP for her to buy additional piglets and feed. She is certain that through loan, she could basically buy what she needs for the growth and development of her business. 
Carmelita is looking for a better future for her business and she hopes that one day it would metamorphose into a higher-yielding investment. With the income from the business, she can provide a better future for her children and put some money for her savings for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en: Salisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rimi Village. Salisu  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Salisu  suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Salisu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 65 bags of maize this year, Salisu can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Alla Magan Group

texts.en:
Abdiqadir is 35 years old and he is married and has 12 children: four girls and eight boys. 

Abidqadir is the leader of the Alla Magan Group and they have been working in a pharmacy for the last 14 years. Abdiqadir, who is the older one wearing glasses, is the leader of this group. 

Abdiqadir and Fuad are in nursing and they have a pharmacy in Hargeisa. Abdiqadir studies at the university—Civil Service Institute—in the nursing program.  

Abdiqadir and his group member requested $2,000 from the Kaaba microfinance institution for a loan to expand their pharmacy. Abdiqadir will take $1,500 and Fuad $500. 

In the future, they want to import medical equipment to get more profit.

loans.use: To expand their pharmacy

loans.name: Thanh An 7 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van, 39, is Thai ethnic woman who is married and the mother of two girls at the age of 13 and 17. She lives with her mother-in-law, her husband, and her two daughters in a Thai ethnic traditional house. Mrs. Van and her husband work very hard to provide for the family. Indeed, they work at agriculture production, including cultivating rice, and breeding chickens and pigs. Besides, they work extra for a bus company with cleanup work to have additional income. 

Mrs. Van has always wanted to increase production to improve income for her family and provide better for her children. For that reason, she has taken out loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to invest in animal husbandry. This is the third time Mrs. Van has received a loan from the Program and she will use it to buy piglets after the success of her investment from a previous loan in pig farming. She hopes that the investment will go smoothly and bring good income, then she could gradually enhance living conditions for her family. 

Mrs. Van dreams her mother-in-law will be healthier, her family will have more sufficient life and her children will have bright future. In the picture, she wears a red top and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets, as an investment for the future prosperity of her family

loans.name: Chachanivadi Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
This group of 5 enterprising dedicated women hail from Dahod, India, They are led by Rizvanaben  who is standing in the center. Rizvanaben is a 36 year mother of 3 children. She is a homemaker as well as an entrepreneur. The household income is Rs 12,000 which is insufficient to meet household expenses and pay for the children's education. The monthly savings are just Rs 2500. With the ever increasing costs of household goods, she finds it very difficult to manage the expenses with a meager amount of Rs 12,000 every month. Hence Rizvanaben thought of starting her business to supplement the family income. She started selling vegetables which include tomato, potato, ginger, carrot, cauliflower etc. With this business she is currently earning Rs 5000. But she wants to earn more to support her children's education. Hence she came up with the idea to avail a loan to expand her business. 

She got together with 4 other women who share similar interests. The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing business. These families on an average earn Rs 10,000 a month out of which they are able to save only Rs 2000. Similar to Rizvanaben,Tabsuben is into selling vegetables which include tomato, potato, ginger, carrot, cauliflower etc. She will use the loan to expand her vegetable business and earn more income. Roshanben and Kilolabibi run their own grocery store which sells sugar, ghee, rice, oil etc. They will use the loan to expand their grocery store. Sabnam has her own variety store and she will use the loan to expand her store.Together the group seeks a loan of Rs 67,000.Your loan will help these women earn better and give good education to their children.It will also pave way for a good standard of living and happiness among these families.

loans.use: To expand a vegetable selling business for the continued welfare of her family

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a young woman 22 years old. She is the mother of two young children two years and six months old. For her children, Julieta learned to weave mats using buri. In this picture, Julieta is standing next to the leaves that she uses to weave mats. She weaves mats to sell and also buys ready-to-sell mats for a profit. She is asking for a loan to buy more mats that she can resell for an income. In the future she plans to expand her business and engage in other business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy more mats to sell

loans.name: Soraya

texts.en: Soraya is 33 years old.  She is a married woman with two children ages six and fourteen.  For a decade now, she has been in the business of upholstery. She sews furniture covers with the help of her sewing machine. She likes this work because she can just stay at home while doing the business. Soraya is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy materials like cloth, needles and thread. In the future, she plans to make her shop bigger and be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth, needles and thread

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la actividad en la cual su padre le ayuda, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas chatarra como aluminio, cobre, hierro, plástico, bronce y papel para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi tener junto con su familia un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young lady pictured with the blurred face is 26 years old and lives in a high risk zone.  She works in the purchase and sale of scrap metal/recyclable materials.  She has been doing this for six years and her father helps her.  With the sales, she is able to cover some home expenses.  She lives in her own house with her life partner and her two daughters.  

She is asking for the loan in order to purchase more scrap metal such as aluminum, copper, iron and bronze, as well as paper and plastic.  This allows her to continue her work, which is her only source of income.  This allows her and her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metal such as aluminum, copper, iron and bronze as well as plastic and paper.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She is 55 years old and married with two children ages 17 and 18. Leonida is a coconut vinegar and banana dealer. For this, she facilitates the buying of coconut wine from farmers to be made into vinegar and bananas to be sold to other local fruit vendors. This has been her business for twenty years, earning her PHP 7,000 per month. Leonida is asking for a loan to buy coconut wine from farmers and materials for home renovation like hardwood and nails. Her income will be used to buy a healthy diet for her family, reinvest in the same business and save for future use.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine from farmers and materials for home renovation like hardwood and nails.

loans.name: Luis Orlando

texts.es: Don luis de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de muebles, tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio muchas personas lo prefieren ya que ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles, el está  solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Don Luis is 55 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and his daughter.  He has a carpentry workshop in which he makes and sells a variety of furniture.  He has been working in this business for many years.  Many people prefer his work as he offers quality and fair prices for his furniture.  

He is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business by purchasing wood, nails, glue, varnish, scraps and other items that will allow him to attract more clients.  In this way he will be able to achieve his goal of bettering his quality of life as well as that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, glue, varnish, scraps and other items.

loans.name: Vilma Gladis

texts.es: Doña Vilma de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su nuera, ella se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tamales y venta de queso, tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad y gracias a eso es como ha podido salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima como maíz, pollo, vegetales, aderezos, tomates entre otras cosas y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos económico.
texts.en:
Doña Vilma is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her two sons and her daughter in law.  She assembles and sells tamales as well as selling cheese.  She has been doing this for more than ten years.  This is how she has been able to move forward.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase her basic ingredients for her product:  corn, chicken, vegetables, seasoning, tomatoes and other items.  This will allow her to continue with her sales and have more income.

loans.use: to purchase basic goods such as corn, chicken, vegetables, seasonings and tomatoes among other items.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is 47 years old from Alegria, Cebu. He operates a sari-sari store in his neighborhood for an income. He sells basic household items like canned goods, chips, seasonings and toiletries. He is asking for a loan to buy in bulk merchandise such as noodles, eggs, seasonings, toiletries, soft drinks and rice. He is confident that with hard work and perseverance, he can continue to improve his inventory and sales. In the future, he would like to make his store bigger and sell items that he has not previously carried. Any additional income will be for family daily consumption, savings and expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, seasonings, toiletries, soft drinks and rice.

loans.name: Felipe Nery

texts.es:
Felipe, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus hijos, ellos dos mantienen su hogar para que nada les falte a sus hijos, su esposa es ama de casa y se encarga de los que haceres del hogar y de los trabajos agricolas tambien.

Felipe, tiene un parcela ubicada en la comunidad muy cerca de su casa, en la cual pretenden sembrar y asi obtener el alimento para consumo del proximo año.

Felipe, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agricolas como pesticidas, fertilizantes y semilla para poder sembrar en este invierno.

Felipe, sueña con obtener una buena cosecha y seguir trabajando de esta manera.
texts.en:
Felipe is married and lives with his wife and children. The two of them maintain their home in a manner that leaves their children wanting for nothing. His wife is a housewife and is in charge of household chores as well as farm chores. Felipe has a plot of land located in the community close to his house. They want to sow seeds in it to obtain food for consumption next year.

Felipe needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for planting this winter. He dreams of having a good harvest and continuing to work in this way.

loans.use: buy agricultural products such as pesticides, fertilizers, and seeds for planting this winter.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 39 years old from Badian, Cebu. She is married with two boys ages four and fourteen. She is into weaving mats for five years now. She earn PHP4000 per month from her livelihood. She is asking a loan of PHP10000 to buy assorted and colorful mats that she can resell for a profit. Elizabeth dreamed of seeing her business grow and make expansion in the future.

loans.use: to weave and also buy assorted and colorful mats for sale

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.en: Ismaila  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sabon Gida Village. Ismaila  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ismaila suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ismaila will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ismaila now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en: Tukur is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Rimi Village. Tukur joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Tukur suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Tukur will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags, increasing his household income considerably. This season, Tukur has ambitious loans to harvest 70 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Tukur now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Gs Dios Con Nosotros Rio Arriba Group

texts.es:
El Señor Fredy tiene 49 años de edad, es padre de 4  hijos, Su actividad es la producción y  venta de café, cuenta con más de 22 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad este producto lo vende a intermediario en el municipio de Trojes, el cual le genera muy buenos ingresos. 
Don Fredy con el crédito que nos a solicitado le contribuirá a tener una mayor producción de sus productos ya que con esta inversión el podrá comprar abono y fertilizantes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don Fredy su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y toda su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.
Los demás integrantes se dedican también a la caficultura y lo integran; Asunción y Darwin.
                                                                                

                                                                                       Trojes, Honduras Abril 2015
texts.en:
El Señor Fredy is 49 years old and is the father of four children.  His  work is the production and sale of coffee.  He has more than 22 years experience working in this field.  He sells his product to a middle man in the town of Trojes, which generates very good income.  

With the loan Don Fredy will be able to have a greater yield from his crops.  This loan will allow him to purchase compost and fertilizer, which will allow him to increase his income.  This increase will help to cover his family's expenses and financial debts.  

Don Fredy's dream is to better his life and the life of all of his family.  The support that he receives from the loan will aid him in achieving his goals.  The other members also work in coffee, including Asuncion and Darwin.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 45 years old from Badian, Cebu. He is married with five sons. His eldest is sixteen and the youngest is seven. He has been engaged in the sari-sari store business for two years now. In his store, he sells canned goods, chips, noodles, seasonings and toiletries.

Reynaldo is asking for a loan to buy stocks of merchandise like noodles, canned sardines, cooking oil, and toiletries. He will also use the money to install an Automatic Tubig Machine (a type of machine that will dispense drinking water operated by a peso coin). He is determined to manage his business well so he can have a better return on his investment. In the future, he hopes to expand his store and offer more services and merchandise to resell.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned sardines, cooking oil, toiletries and install an Automatic Tubig Machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chickens, condensed meal, animal feed, vitamins and material to make improvements to the chicken coops.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 44 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Felomina is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Felomina has been farming vegetables for 13 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felomina would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Liza is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so he can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 46 years old and both of her children are in school.

Marilou has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional kitchen-wares and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Marilou has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchen-wares and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for growing bananas and pay for labor.

loans.name: Chutzorop Segundo Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Chutzorop Segundo” is on their second loan cycle, and the women are most grateful to Kiva investors for funding the loans.

Tomasa is a 36-year-old member of the Trust Bank who has six children. In spite of the fact that she has not had any formal education, she has been highly motivated to look for ways to create income. Tomasa decided she would buy and sell traditional textiles in various unique and beautiful designs. So, she sells tablecloths, bags, and caps, not only in her own community but also in nearby towns. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase more caps and bags in a variety of colors that are currently in high demand.

Friendship Bridge has created non-formal, participatory education lessons on topics clients identified as most important, such as business, money management, self-esteem, women’s rights, health, and children’s education. At the monthly meeting of the Trust Bank, a Facilitator delivers these lessons in the native language of the women. The organization calls the effective combination of loans and education “Microcredit Plus.”

Tomasa and her friends in the “Chutzorop Segundo” Trust Bank are poised to step into a brighter future benefitting themselves, their families and their community. Kiva investors are valuable partners in this effort! Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase more caps and bags in a variety of colors that are currently in high demand.

loans.name: Bessy Larissa

texts.es:
La joven Bessy de 22  años de edad, vive con sus padres  en su  casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 02  años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada,  vive en aldea una  al sur de Honduras,  es una joven  emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, braseares, biquinis,  etc. con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -   Mayo del  2015.
texts.en:
Bessy is 22 years old. She lives with her parents in their own home in a village in southern Honduras. She has been selling new and used clothing for two years. She is an enterprising young woman with a desire to move ahead and to struggle day by day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, shorts, boxer shorts, tights, tops, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, etc. With the support of this loan, she aims to improve her income and quality of life. She is a new customer who is willing to work with Kiva partner Prism.

Her dream is to have a good business and to expand her customer base while improving her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, shorts, boxer shorts, tights, tops, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Armando, de 45 años de edad, tiene su propia casa, en donde tiene su negocio; él viaja los fines de semana a visitar a su mamá, ya que sus hermanos todos estan casados y ella vive sola.

Armando, es un hombre emprendedor y muy trabajador, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y productos para la belleza femenina.

Armando, necesita el crédito para comprar más productos de belleza, como delineadores, maquillaje, labiales, ganchos para el cabello, para surtir su negocio, ya que está teniendo mucha más demanda de estos productos.

Armando, desea que su negocio crezca y poder tener una mejor vida para él y su madre que es a quien ha apoyado siempre.
texts.en:
Armando, age 45, has his own house, in which he has his business.  He travels on the weekends to visit his mother, who lives alone now that his brothers have all married.  Armando is an enterprising and hardworking man.  He sells cosmetics and women's beauty products.  

Armando needs the loan to purchase more beauty products such as:  eyeliners, makeup, lipsticks and hairclips to supply his business.  He has had high demand for these products.  Armando hopes to grow his business and be able to have a better life for himself and his mother, who has always supported him.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products, such as eyeliners, makeup, lipstick, hairclips in order to better supply his business.

loans.name: Rosdiyarti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rosdiyarti, one of Ruma’s agents. Rosdiyarti lives in Klaten, a regency in Central Java province in Indonesia, located about ten hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. Together with her husband, she has two children, one daughter and one son. Rosdiyarti owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for her community. She has already joined Ruma for almost a year. She found out about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology. Rosdiyarti is a kind and cheerful person. Her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Rosdiyarti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about this importance, your loan will be very useful to help Rosdiyarti improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. Rosdiyarti's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce service to her community, so her community can have access to purchase products with better prices. As seen in the photo, Rosdiyarti is the one who is sitting. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a merchant from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling various goods to the people in her community. She also own a fishing business which is mostly managed by her husband. Analiza works hard to earn a living so that she can support her family's needs. Her four children are ages two to sixteen. 

Analiza  is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store, such as cooking oil, soy sauce, canned goods, diapers, shampoo, coffee, sugar, milk, detergent, chips and fishing nets. Through this, she will be able to attract more buyers to her store, thus augmenting her income. Analiza dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, canned goods, diapers, shampoo, coffee, sugar, milk, detergent, chips and fishing nets

loans.name: Analou

texts.en: Analou is a 25-year-old woman from the community of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 3 and 5. Analou has been engaged in hog-raising for two years now. This is her main livelihood to support the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and more piglets to raise. Feed is very important for quality growth of her hogs. This contributes to good sales for most hog raisers. She hopes that she can continue sending her children to school and make a success out of her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and more piglets to raise

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora de 41  años de edad, vive con sus hijos y su mama  en casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 06  años al negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada, vive en aldea  al sur de Honduras,  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Dora está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materiales como cemento y arena para mejorar su vivienda y en especifico el piso de la sala y también piensa comprar pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, etc. para su negocio con el apoyo de este crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente subsiguiente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-  Mayo del  2015.
texts.en:
Dora is 41 years old, she lives with her children and her mother in her own home. She has been working for the past six years selling new and used clothing. She lives in a small town in southern Honduras.  She is a business woman who dreams of getting ahead and she works hard each day to improve her quality of life. 

Dora is requesting the loan to buy materials such as cement and sand to improve her home, specifically the living room floor. She will also buy pants, shirts, shorts, boxer shorts, etc., for her business. 

With the help of this loan, she hopes to increase her income as well as her quality of life. She is a successive customer with hopes of working with Prisma. 

Her dream is to have a successful business and to increase her clientele, while at the same time, improving her and her family's futures.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, pants, shirts, shorts, boxer shorts, etc., for her home and business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia  is from Talibon, Bohol. She is 53 years old, with four dependents ages 11 to 18. She has been engaged in a fishing business for 28 years now. This has been her source of income since her children were young. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a new fish net and fish trap. Antonia hopes to continue to expand her business so she can buy what her children need. In the future, she plans to continue making improvements on her livelihood to increase profitability.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and fish trap

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Like most people in Talibon, 48-year-old Asteria is into seaweed farming. She is married with seven children, and four of them are still dependents.

Asteria has applied for a loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to finance her seaweed enterprise. She will use 30,000 PHP to buy straw, floaters and seaweed seedlings. She aims to increase profitability of her business by focusing on her production. Her income will go to her children’s schooling and the family’s daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy straw, floaters and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 42 years old and is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a driver of their tricycle. She has two children, ages 10 and 17. In addition to their tricycle business, Emelita also cooks snack foods like rice cakes and banana cue (deep-fried bananas in caramelized sugar). Her loan will be used to pay for tricycle maintenance and to buy flour, cooking oil, bananas and sugar. She dreams of making the most out of her business so she can give her children a better future through education. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle maintenance and to buy flour, cooking oil, bananas and sugar

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 35 years old and is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children, ages 3 to 13. Emma and her husband work driving a habal-habal (motorcycle with extended seat for passengers) in her town. Emma is asking for a loan to buy a spare tire, motor oil and grocery items so she can start a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is confident that the loan will make their lives better with a new income stream. In the future, she hopes to send all her children to school so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a spare tire, motor oil and grocery items

loans.name: Deyvi Jesus

texts.es:
Deyvi tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. En esta comunidad la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales principalmente.

Deyvi se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería como peón agrícola, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, brinda el servicio en el mismo distrito y alrededores. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y brindar mantenimiento a sus herramientas ya que actualmente se encuentran en mal estado, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio, con esto el espera mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deyvi is 24 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his family in a rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru’s northern coast. Here, life is quiet and the people mainly make a living in farming, trade and raising animals.

Deyvi makes a living as a labourer. He has his own tools and more than five years’ experience working in the Oyotún and surrounding districts.

Devi is applying for this loan in order to carry out repairs and maintenance on his tools, which are currently not in very good condition. This investment will help Deyvi to keep his tools and equipment in better condition, which will be good for his business.

Deyvi hopes this loan will allow him to increase productivity and to tend to the diverse needs of local customers. This will in turn mean that Deyvi can increase his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out repairs and maintenance on his tools, which are currently not in very good condition.

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis, de 41 años de edad, está casado y vive con su esposa y tres de sus hijos, ya que uno ya formó su propia familia; su esposa es ama de casa y también le ayuda en los trabajos agricolas.

Luis, trabaja como corralero, es el encargado de cuidar las vacas de su patrón, pero también es agricultor y siembra los granos básicos, para poder tener maíz para el consumo de su familia.

Luis, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agricolas como fertilizantes y pesticidas, para asegurar una buena milpa.

Luis, desea que sus hijos estudien y sean personas honestas y honradas, también desea poder darles una mejor vida y que aprendan el valor del trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children, one of whom now has his own family. Luis’ wife is a housewife and also helps Luis with farming work.

Luis is a rancher. He is responsible for looking after his boss’ cows. Luis also works as a farmer. He grows basic grains in order to have corn to feed his family.

Luis needs this loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilisers and pesticides in order to ensure a good yield of corn.

Luis wants his children to be educated and be honest and decent people. He would also like to give them better lives and for them to learn the value of work.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilisers and pesticides in order to ensure a good yield of corn.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a los escasos recursos de su familia, no pudo continuar estudiando el bachillerato, por lo cual decidió acompañarse y junto a su compañero de vida trabajan en la agricultura, para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.

Vilma, junto a su compañero de vida tienen cinco años de trabajar en la agricultura, este trabajo lo aprendió de su pareja y de sus suegros.

El crédito que está solicitando es para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y comprar cuatro sacos de abono, semilla de maíz, fertilizantes, pagar el alquiler de la tierra y pagar mano de obra.

El sueño de Vilma, es poder vender este cultivo de maíz a buen precio, para obtener buenas ganancias, para llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos y poder seguir cultivando más maíz.
texts.en:
Vilma is 22 years old and has only a ninth-grade education. Owing to her family’s limited resources, she could continue at high school and so decided to find a partner. The couple now works in farming in order to help their children to progress.

Vilma and her partner have been working in farming for five years. Vilma learned this work from her partner and parents-in-law.

VIlma is applying for a loan in order: to sew corn on 7000 metres square of land; to buy four bags of manure, corn seed and fertilisers; to pay rent for land; and to pay labourers.

Vilma’s dream is to be able to sell the corn harvest at a good price in order to earn a good profit, to support her children, and to continue growing corn.

loans.use: to sew corn on 7000 metres square of land; to buy four bags of manure, corn seed and fertilisers; to pay rent for land; and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer de 33 años de edad es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijas de las edades entre 6 y 14 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Susana con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos y venta de atol, ella tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor.
Susana es una madre de familia que le preocupa su familia es por ello que ha decidido construir su cocina y los baños de la casa porque hasta ahora no cuenta con una cocina y baños adecuados, pero una de las dificultades que Susana tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar sus materiales como cemento, block, arena y hierro, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Susana es poder mejorar su vivienda para darle a su familia más comodidad.
texts.en:
Susana is a 33 year old married woman and has a beautiful family with 3 daughters between the ages of 6 and 14 years old. This humble family lives in a community of Suchitepéquez.

Susana, with her desire of earning income and of helping her husband with the household expenses works raising chickens and selling “atole” (cornflower drink). She has been doing this for 5 years.

Susana is a mother who worries about her family, therefore, she has decided to build a kitchen and the bathrooms of the house because their house does not have an appropriate kitchen or bathrooms. One of the difficulties that Susana has is that she does not have enough money to buy the materials, such as cement, blocks, sand and iron. For this reason she is requesting the loan, to cover this necessity. Susana’s great dream is to be able to improve her home to provide more comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand and iron.

loans.name: Fedrita

texts.en: Fedrita is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is 44 years old and has one daughter, age 14. She operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community, which she has done for five years.  She sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. In addition to this, she also sells snacks and hamburgers. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, feed, canned goods, candies, detergent and seasoning.  These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, Fedrita is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous. She will use her profits to pay for the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, canned goods, candies, detergent and seasoning

loans.name: Federita

texts.en: Federita is 70 years old and still works hard on her farm where she and her husband grow cassava. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Federita is requesting a loan from CEVI to buy fertilizer for her farm. She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She hopes to live a long life and continue her business so that she can help her grandchildren and other people. Her income will be for food and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has an adult son. She has her own business.

Tatyana has been selling women's shoes and sportswear for 19 years. He has two sales spots at the market. Tatyana had some problems with business because of money exchange rate. She wants to develop her business further. Tetyana is active and hardworking person.

Tetyana is asking for a loan of 35 000 UAH to purchase women's clothes and shoes for summer season. The loan will help to increase the assortment of goods.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes and shoes to expand her range for the summer season

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 48 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a security guard while Erlinda cooks dishes to sell in her community of Talibon, Bohol. She cooks noodles, sautéed vegetables and fried fish during meal time. She is asking a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy meat, soy sauce, vinegar, vegetables, spices and grocery items to start a sari-sari (variety) store. Erlinda has high hopes for the future and is optimistic about her expansion. Her income will be for food, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy meat, soy sauce, vinegar, vegetables, spices and grocery items

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Morena is a married woman with six grown-up children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a bakery for five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband also has a small business which will help her to meet their daily needs. Morena is asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs, oil, sugar and baking soda. These ingredients will be used in making bread, and she will sell it in her local community. In the future, Morena dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar and other baking supplies for making bread

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is from the municipality of Getafe, Bohol. She is 57 years old, married with three grown children.
For eleven years now, she has been engaged in selling gasoline and fish to the people in her community. She is asking a loan to buy more fish and gallons of gasoline to sell. 

Diosdada is excited knowing that a loan will help her to have an increase in her revenue. In the future, she hope to have more investments and a better location where she can sell her fish.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline and fish to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and has ten children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is 46 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Silveria is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Silveria requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Silveria has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Silveria would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice growing business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married with eleven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pay for her laborer.

Teresita has been farming rice for eleven years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor in her rice growing business

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar semilla de marañón al mayoreo para tostarla, limpiarla y luego venderla a sus clientes, tendrá la disponibilidad del producto durante el año para cubrir demandas de sus clientes y tener los recursos necesarios para que su familia tenga una vida digna.
Los créditos le han sido de utilidad para que su negocio continúe con vida, las ganancias generadas son invertidas en cancelar su deuda y reconstruir su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to buy cashews wholesale to toast, clean, and then sell to his customers.  He will have the product available during the year to cover his customers' demands and have the resources he needs for his family to have a respectable life.  

The loans have helped him keep his business going; the profits he makes are used to repay his debt and rebuild his home.

loans.use: to buy cashews wholesale to toast, clean, and then sell to his customers.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 21 years old hard-working woman, from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. As she was unable to start any stable job, she has opened a general store locally and start generating her own income. Teona becomes financially independent and has own loyal costumers also among local people and passer-byes as well. Now she needs financial support to purchase stock of additional products for her store and satisfy all her costumers needs. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
The loan will greatly assist Teona and she will be able to continue running her business more profitable way and improve the economic situation of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of products for her general store

loans.name: Erly

texts.en: Erly owns a Carenderia in Talibon, Bohol. Carenderia is a local term for small restaurants frequented by people in small towns. Out if this business, Erly supports a daughter who is seven years old. She is asking  a loan to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meat and beer. She is confident that with hard work and perseverance, she can continue to support her child’s needs. In the future, she would like to make her place more comfortable and spacious to attract more customers. Any additional income will be for food, savings and school fees.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meat and beer for her small local restaurant

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 29, is a mother of three children. Her husband works in a quarry to support the family.

Felisa wanted to help provide for her family so she started raising bananas. She is now applying for a 4,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner GDMPC to buy fertilizer so as to better her harvest.

Felisa’s plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle to use to deliver her bananas to market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 39 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Araceli runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Araceli has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erlene

texts.en:
Erlene is 32 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Erlene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Erlene would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 46 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural community on the outskirts of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

Leah owns and operates a small general Store, selling items such as canned food, noodles, biscuits, snacks and cooking oil. She has been doing this for three years.

She needs a loan to buy bags of rice and a account to recharge mobile phones for her business. She hopes to meet her children school fees with the profits she makes and also meet her family's weekly expenses.

Leah joined SPBD since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: A loan of $7500 helps Leah buy bags of rice, as well as recharge account  for mobile phone for her general store.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia, who is a 39 years-old-married woman, lives in Kutaisi City, West Georgia. She has a husband and both family members get pensions for their persecution. Apart of this, Maia teaches English language to the local children and gets a small income from this, in order to help the  financial stability for her family.  As the existing income is not enough for the family, Maia decided to start an additional business. 

All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Maia applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting  poor people to start or re-start businesses.
 
With the loan, Maia plans to go to Turkey, where the biggest market is located and purchase a stock of baby clothing. She will then sell the products in her community and generate additional income.
 
Maia will get the chance to tackle their financial difficulties and make a better style of life for her husband and herself.  She will be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To stock her new enterprise with imported baby clothing, so that she may help support herself and her husband

loans.name: Bolortungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Bolortungalag, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been transporting coal between districts since 2009. Their elder son goes to elementary school and younger son stays at home. 

She and her husband plan to buy the truck they used for a long time during its contract from a rental company. She is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to buy the truck. By doing so, she will no longer need to pay rent and can generate more income for her family. Her husband mainly drives and transports coal and she herself finds jobs, prepares materials and manages the family finance.

loans.use: to buy the previously rented truck for her husband's use hauling coal

loans.name: Arcinia Yadira

texts.es:
La señora Arcinia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio que es la venta de plata y productos por catálogos, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal desde hace 2 años y se levanta muy temprano para salir atender a sus clientes.
Doña Arcinia solicita el préstamo para la compra de  cadenas, pulseras, anillos, etc. para poder surtir su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes que  son vecinos de su colonia y alrededores.
Doña  Arcinia sueña con que su negocio sea uno de los más grandes y reconocidos de la zona y poder seguir adelante apoyando a su familia.

Danli, Honduras – Mayo del  2015
texts.en:
Arcinia is an entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to her business; her main source of income is her business, which is selling silver and products from catalogs; she has managed this business personally for two years and she gets up very early to go out and visit her customers.  

Arcinia is requesting this loan to buy chains, bracelets, rings, etc. to stock her business and better serve her customers, who are her neighbors in the community and the surrounding areas.  

Aricinia dreams of her business becoming one of the largest and most well known in the area and of being able to continue to support her family.  

Danli, Honduras – May, 2015

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings, etc. for her business

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 46-year-old mother who has two children attending school. Despite financial hardships, she and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will find a good job someday. In this regard, Pacita aspires to further improve the business in order to earn a higher income.

Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of an additional PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of t-shirts, polo shirts, short pants, blouses, pants, foot socks, and underwear to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of t-shirts, polo shirts, short pants, blouses, pants, foot socks, and underwear to resell.

loans.name: Los Portales Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de Oaxaca se integró un grupo de cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y con un amplio sentido de la responsabilidad de nombre Los Portales. Esta región es conocida por su gran producción de caña de azúcar, los habitantes han trabajado por generaciones dentro de los cuatro ingenios azucareros. El campo, por lo tanto, es muy respetado por los lugareños quienes lo consideran sagrado. 
   Los miembros del grupo son: Jessica quien se dedica a la venta de agua purificada; Mirna, comida; Ada, pollo y cosméticos; Teodora, cosméticos.
   Doña Ada es una mujer comprometida con su familia conformada por Don Diego, su esposo, y tres hijos; dos de los cuales dependen económicamente de ellos. Desde hace veintiún años  decidió involucrarse en el negocio familiar de venta de pollo. La actividad la realiza en conjunto con su marido; se levantan a las 5:00 am, colocan de 5 a 6 pollos en una reja, los pesan y etiquetan, posteriormente los acomodan en un vehículo para comenzar a ofrecerlos en la comunidad. Los fines de semana sus hijos acompañan a don Diego en la repartición mientras que Ada se queda en casa, atendiendo a los clientes que acuden hasta el domicilio a comprar más animales.
   Por otro lado las habilidades de doña Ada son aún más amplias, hace quince años inició un nuevo negocio: “no sólo vendo pollo, en mis ratos libres me dedico a vender cosméticos de las mejores marcas, por eso digo que los cosméticos se venden solos, mis mejores clientes son las maestras” comenta entusiasmada. Con las ganancias obtenidas de ambas actividades ha cambiado los muebles del hogar, pudo comprar una camioneta para vender pollo y sus hijos han podido continuar con sus estudios sin mayores complicaciones. 
   Esta vez el préstamo lo ha solicitado para invertir en cosméticos: esmaltes, labiales, sombras, delineadores, bases, cremas, lociones y desodorantes. 
   Todas las integrantes del grupo Los Portales agradecen infinitamente por los préstamos otorgados ya que han sido de gran utilidad para invertir en sus actividades.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio trasero de doña Ada quien viste blusa color azul, en la fotografía se aprecia a las otras tres compañeras del grupo.
texts.en:
In a community in Oaxaca a group named Los Portales was formed by four hardworking women with a great sense of responsibility.  This region is known for its high production of sugar cane; its residents have worked for generations at its four sugar factories.  The land, as a result, is very respected by the locals, who consider it to be sacred. 

The members of the group are: Jessica, who sells purified water; Mirna, prepared food; Ada, chicken and cosmetics; Teodora, cosmetics.  

Ada is a woman who is dedicated to her family, which is made up of Diego, her husband, and three children, two of whom are financially dependent on them.  Twenty-one years ago she decided to join the family business selling chicken.  She does this work together with her husband; they get up a 5:00 am, put 5 to 6 chickens on a grate, weigh them and tag them, then they put them in a vehicle so they can start to put them on offer in the community.  On the weekends their children go with Diego to do the sorting, while Ada stays home to serve the customers who come to their house to buy more animals.    

Additionally, Ada's skills are even more varied; fifteen years ago she started a new business: "I don't just sell chicken, in my free time I sell the best brands of cosmetics, which is why I say my cosmetics sell themselves; my best customers are the teachers," she tells us enthusiastically.  With her earnings from both of these businesses she has replaced the furniture in her home; she was able to buy a truck to sell chicken; and her children have been able to keep attending school without real difficulty.  

This time the loan she has requested is to buy cosmetics: nail polishes, lipsticks, eyeshadows, liners, foundations, creams, lotions, and deodorants.  

All the members of the Los Portales Group are infinitely thankful for the loans they have received, as they have been very helpful in terms of investing in their businesses.  

*This photo was taken on Ada's back patio; she is wearing a blue top; the other three group members also appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics; nail polishes, lipsticks, eyeshadows, liners, foundations, creams, lotions, and deodorants.

loans.name: Anamae

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Anamae works hard to support her family. She has a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming rice.

Anamae has sustained her store through her past successful 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. Anamae is now borrowing 35,000 PHP to buy additional stock for it. She is working continually to develop her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Emelinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Emelinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Emelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy packaged food products, cosmetics, and accessories

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Eufemia tiene 54 años, es separada, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como gallinas, pollos, patos, pavos, entre otros, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, con esto ella espera generar mayores ventas y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eufemia is 54 years old, separated, and lives in her own home with her children in a community of merchants, farmers, and ranchers that is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast.  

She raises and sells farm animals, such as hens, chickens, ducks, and turkeys, among others; she has experience in this business and good personal and professional references in the area.  She will use this loan to buy a larger number of animals, as well as to buy feed to fatten them; with this she hopes to generate better sales and thereby generate income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of animals as well as feed to fatten them

loans.name: Tamuna

texts.en:
Tamuna is a 24 years old young woman, from Terjola district. She is married and lives with husband, 2 children and mother-in-law.  Tamuna's husband has a private job and gets a fixed salary. Tamuna herself works on  family-owned land and also takes care of the cattle. She sells milk products at the local market. However, the family finds it hard to cover all family expenses and require an additional source of income. 

She received the credit in the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  Tamuna plans to purchase a car and make it work on private orders, like a taxi. The car will be used for routine services and it will make an additional source of income for the family. 
Tamuna and her family members rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be very thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a car and make it work on private orders, like a taxi

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne, 26, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past three years she has been raising and selling pigs.

Marianne has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working to increase her enterprise’s production.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 46 years old and has six children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Roselyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Roselyn has been raising livestock for twenty years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and married.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Grace has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Grace aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lea Nerissa

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Lea Nerissa works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a bicycle taxi. Lea Nerissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Lea Nerissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Yuni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Yuni, one of Ruma’s agents. Yuni lives in Kudus, located east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. She and her husband have three sons. Yuni owns a stall that sells consumer products and mobile airtime credit for her community daily. She has already joined Ruma for almost a year. She knew about Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to expand her business in technology, as well as give more contribution to her community. Yuni is a hardworking and kind person. Her community sees her as a trusted and cheerful mobile provider.

As the business grows, Yuni is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community. Having known about this importance, your loan will be very useful to help Yuni improve her business and accordingly, her community, which needs access to such services. Yuni's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve e-commerce for her community, so her community can have access to better products with better prices. As seen in the photo, Yuni is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Sindy Susette

texts.es:
Sindy es una joven de 19 años, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de San Antonio.
Sindy para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres se dedica a la compra y venta de oro y plata, esta labor lo realiza ella dese hace tres años.
Sindy es una joven  de muchos sueños que ahora ha tenido la iniciativa de invertir un poco más en su negocio de venta de oro, aunque una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder realizar la inversión, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para hacer de su negocio algo más grande.
El gran sueño de Sindy es poder contar con un local donde pueda exhibir mejor sus productos y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sindy is a young lady of 19; she is single and lives with her parents in a neighborhood of San Antonio.

In order to make money and support her parents, Sindy buys and sells gold and silver; she has been doing this work for three years.  

Sindy is a young person with many dreams who has now taken the initiative to invest a little more in her gold-selling business, though one of the challenges she faces is not having enough capital to be able to make this investment, which is why she is requesting a loan to make her business bigger.  

Sindy's greatest dream is to be able to have a shop where she can display her best goods and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy and sell gold and silver.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Ahmad, one of Ruma’s agents. Ahmad is a young man who lives in Magelang, Central Java, a city located about an hour and 30 minutes flight from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he knows that it has the best service and system. He wants to increase his revenue and savings so that he can continue his study in the university. Ahmad is a friendly and informative person and his community sees him as a trusted and kind mobile airtime provider.

As the business grows, Ahmad needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community.
