Ahmad's goal in the near future as a Ruma agent is to provide an e-commerce service to his community, so his community can purchase better products with better prices. As seen in the photo, Ahmad is the one who is sitting. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old married with two children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

Rose raises and sells chicken in her community to earn a living and has been doing this for two years.

She requested a loan to buy 150 new chicks and chicken feed for her business. She plan to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses and also provide a better living for her family in the future.

She has been a SPBD member since 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 51 years old. She lives in a wooden house with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her son, who is still studying. Her three other children are already working and/or married. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields.

In 2001, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kong makes scarves, which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family’s expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field, and to extend her lending business.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and the preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, de 27 años de edad, con gran esfuerzo y sacrificio logró estudiar hasta noveno grado, luego decidió casarse y junto a su esposo tiene un hijo, que está asistiendo a la escuela.

Rosa, junto a su pareja se han dedicado a la agricultura desde hace diez años, por lo que conocen muy bien el trabajo de la agricultura, pero especialmente la siembra de maíz.

Rosa, está solicitando un crédito para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y para comprar cuatro sacos de abono, semilla y pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde sembrará.

El sueño de Rosa, es que con las ganancias que le queden de vender la cosecha, pretende comprar una novilla de repasto, para que se le convierta en vaca y así poder obtener los beneficios de la leche.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 27-years old, put forth a lot of effort and sacrifice to go to school until ninth grade.  She then decided to get married.  She and her husband have one son, who goes to school.  

Rosa and her husband have made their living in agriculture for the last ten years.  The are very familiar with agricultural work, especially growing corn. 

Rosa is requesting a loan to plant 7,000 square meters of corn, to purchase four sacks of compost and seeds and to pay the rent on the land she will plant.

Rosa's dream is to use the profit she is left with after selling her harvest to purchase a grass-fed calf.  She would raise the calf so that once grown, she could benefit from the milk.

loans.use: to plant 7,000 square meters of corn, to purchase four sacks of compost and seed and to pay the rent on her land.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is a 24-year-old married man with a child in his care and also a marketing major at a university in the city. He is from the province of Kampong Speu, Cambodia and has worked for an organization since 2012. His wife is 24 years old and she works in a hotel. Sopheap and his wife can make a daily income of USD15 each day. 

Now he is requesting a loan because he is short of the finances to cover his third-year tuition fees. This loan will help him have enough finances to cover his tuition fees and go through the third year at university successfully. In the future, Sopheap dreams of having a good job with a decent salary, therefore he will be able to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to cover his third-year university tuition fees in marketing

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 58 years old, married and has 1 child to provide for. To earn a living, she engaged in a dressmaking shop. She makes dresses and accepts tailoring. She wants to increase her income, so she decided to avail herself of a loan at GDMPC to purchase machine parts for her sewing machine repair and by this she can make more dresses and cater to more customers.

Jenny plan for the future to buy another sewing machine to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase machine parts for her sewing machine repair.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos desde hace 3 años, tomo la decisión de tener su propio negocio para tener mejores circunstancias económicas, su jornada de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde; vive en el campo, es una persona de escasos recursos, que tiene la responsabilidad de cubrir los gastos de su familia integrada por su esposa y dos hijos, ellos no tienen ayuda familiar del extranjero.
Está necesitando de un crédito para comprar herbicidas, insecticidas, abono y semilla para darle un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos de granos básicos, el resto del capital lo utilizara para pagar el alquiler del terreno en que desarrolla sus actividades agrícolas, con esta inversión tendrá lista la parcela para la temporada de siembra que se aproxima y las ventajas o desventajas dependen del clima. 
Tiene la esperanza que con el crédito su negocio sea más rentable lo que le facilitará el cumplimiento de sus compromisos.
texts.en:
José has grown staple grains for 3 years. He made the decision to have his own business in order to be in better financial circumstances. His work day is from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon. He lives in the country. He is a person with scarce resources who is responsible for covering the costs of his family, consisting of his wife and two children. They do not have help from family abroad.

He needs a loan in order to buy herbicide, insecticide, manure, and seeds so that his staple grain crops will develop well. He will use the rest of the capital to pay the rent on the land where he farms. With this investment, he will have the parcel of land ready for the planting season that is coming, and the advantages or disadvantages depend on the climate. He hopes that with the loan his business will be more profitable, which will help him to fulfill his obligations.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, insecticide, manure and seeds so that his staple grain crops will develop well

loans.name: Zelita

texts.en:
Zelita is 41 years old, married, and has nine children. She is engaged in banana production. She's been in this business for ten years already. It is a good business for them because she earns PHP 2,500 a month, which helps them in their daily family needs.

Zelita aims for a better income for the family, so she decided to borrow a loan at GDMPC to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm and be able to produce good harvest.

Zelita’s plan for the future is to save money out from her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 55 years old, married, and has one child. To earn a living she is engaged in a sari-sari store business. It is a great help for the family because it is an earning business for them.

Wilma still wants to improve their income; that's why she borrowed a loan to buy more goods to sell and be able to have more store inventory. That will generate more sales and result in an increase in income.

Wilma’s plan for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maritza, habita una vivienda que es de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus hijos, su pareja es empleado como vigilante de una empresa de seguridad privada, sus hijos son menores de edad y tres de ellos ya asisten a la escuela; cuando formo su hogar de su esposo aprendió a realizar los cultivos de maíz y frijol, lo desempeña desde hace cuatro años, contrata obreros para que le ayuden en su negocio.
El préstamo le servirá para comprar insumos agrícolas y costear los gastos que se generan al eliminar la malaza del terreno y cuando se tiene que sembrar, adquirirá el abono e insecticidas a un precio bajo antes  que comience la temporada de siembra.
Su visión es tener una buena cosecha para almacenar y alimentar a su familia, además podrá vender y  generar mayores ingresos para cancelar su deuda.
texts.en: Maritza lives in a house that is her property with her husband and her children. Her husband is employed as security at a private security company. Her children are all minors and 3 of them attend school. When they formed their household she learned from her husband how to grow corn and beans. She has been doing this for 4 years and hires workers to help her with the business. The loan will be used to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the cost of clearing the weeds from the land and planting. She will acquire the manure and insecticides at a low price prior to the start of planting season. Her goal is to have a good harvest to store and feed her family as well as sell and generate greater income to pay off her debt.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the cost of clearing the weeds from the land and planting.

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwest Cambodia. She is twenty years old and lives in a wooden house with her family. Her family owns ten hectares of rice fields and one hectare of cassava. Her four brothers and sisters all work in the fields.

Kiva's field partner Soieries du Mékong is a social enterprise that fights against rural exodus and empowers women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Thanks to this program, in 2012 Sreyneang began weaving scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe.

With Sreyneang’s 310 USD loan from Soieries du Mékong, she can buy silk, pay for dyeing it and prepare her loom for weaving. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and help her mother pay for food, fertilizer and diesel fuel for the fields. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful, traditional, handwoven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk, pay for dyeing it and prepare her loom for weaving.

loans.name: Rika

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Rika, one of Ruma’s agents. Rika is a young lady who lives in Lumajang, a regency located in East Java province, Indonesia, about 20 hours by train from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Rika owns a stall that sells daily consumer products, mobile airtime credits and provides mobile payment services for her community. She joined Ruma almost a year ago and was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. She decided to join Ruma because she was interested in Ruma's system for paying bills (like electricity and water bills). Rika is a kind and cheerful person. Her community sees her as a trusted and informative mobile airtime credits and bill payment services provider.

As the business grows, Rika needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to her community. Rika's goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce service for her community, so her community can have access to better products with better prices. As seen in the photo, Rika is the one who is standing in front of her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc.) for members of her local community.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Los habitantes de cierto municipio oaxaqueño tienen como símbolo de identidad una gran laguna. Ésta representa además una fuente de empleo para muchos lugareños quienes como agradecimiento los días 11 de diciembre recorren su perímetro acompañados de la Virgen de Guadalupe; patrona de los pescadores. Otra actividad importante de la comunidad es la siembra de maíz, frijol, hule y caña de azúcar. 
   Dentro de dicha comunidad se integró el grupo Las Gaviotas, eligieron el nombre pues tienen gusto por estas aves que surcan el cielo sobre la laguna. Ellos son: Lidia quien vende cosméticos; Ángela y Blandina, abarrotes; Clara y Guadalupe, pescado y Mauricia, pollo. 
   Doña Guadalupe, o Lupe como es mejor conocida, inició en el negocio de la pesca gracias a su esposo Don José con quien está casada desde hace veintiocho años. Ahora también sus tres hijos realizan esta actividad que es común no sólo entre la familia sino de la región entera. 
   La actividad inicia cuando su esposo se adentra en la laguna a bordo de una lancha en donde trasporta las herramientas necesarias, pesca por la tarde y regresa hasta el día siguiente. Luego Doña Lupe limpia la mojarra y sale a vender para terminar con toda la mercancía a más tardar a medio día.  Actualmente su hijo Abraham se unió al negocio familiar, él se encarga de recorrer los cerros en una motocicleta, en la cual acomoda una nevera donde almacena de 40 a 50 kilos de mojarra. “Vender mojarra me gusta, tengo trato con muchas personas, he conocido distintos lugares y me da gusto que mis hijos se hayan involucrado en la actividad con la que pudimos ofrecerles lo mejor cuando dependían de nosotros” comenta Lupe sonriendo. 
   Con las ganancias obtenidas y los préstamos otorgados anteriormente Lupe pudo comprar dos motores y dar mantenimiento a las lanchas, comprar y reparar telares de arrastre; todo ello ayuda a que ofrezcan producto de mejor calidad a sus clientes. Con el nuevo préstamo, comprará nuevos telares, tendales y completará el pago de un vehículo que utilizará para comenzar a vender queso en la comunidad. 

* La fotografía se tomó en la tienda de doña Ángela, lugar donde los integrantes llevan a cabo sus reuniones para hacer sus pagos de préstamo, Doña Guadalupe viste falda color negro y blusa floreada.
texts.en:
The residents of a certain municipality in Oaxaca have as a symbol of their identity a great lagoon. The lagoon also represents a source of employment for many of the locals who, as a gesture of gratitude, walk around its perimeter every 11th of December accompanied by the Virgin of Guadalupe, patroness of the fishermen. Other important activities in the community are the planting of corn, beans, rubber tree, and sugar cane.

Within said community, the Las Gaviotas [the Seagulls] group was formed. They chose this name since they have a liking for these birds that fly across the sky over the lagoon. The members of the group are: Lidia, who sells cosmetics; Angela and Blandina, who sell groceries; Clara and Guadalupe, who sell fish; and Mauricia, who sells chicken. 

Doña Guadalupe, or Lupe as she is called, started the fishing business thanks to her husband, Don José, with whom she has been married for the past 28 years. Now, their 3 children also participate in this activity, which is not only common in their family but in the entire region.

The activity begins when her husband goes into the lagoon on a boat in which he transports the necessary tools, then fishes throughout the afternoon and evening, and returns the next day. Afterwards, Doña Lupe cleans the mojarra fish [a fish similar to tilapia] and goes out to sell it so as to have everything sold by noon at the latest. Recently, her son Abraham joined the family business. He is in charge of going around the hills on a motorcycle in which he has fitted a cooler where he stores 40 or 50 kilograms of mojarra. "I like to sell mojarra. I deal with many people, I have gotten to know different places, and it makes me glad that my children have become involved in this activity with which we were able to offer them the best when they were dependent on us," says Lupe.

With the earnings obtained, and previous loans she received, Lupe was able to buy 2 engines, service the boats, and buy and repair the fishing dragnets; all of which helped them offer a better quality product to their customers. With a new loan, she would buy new nets, awnings, and will finish paying off a vehicle she will use to start selling cheese in her community.
 
* The photograph was taken in Doña Angela's store, where every two weeks the members of the group conduct their meetings in order to pay their loan installments. Doña Guadalupe is the woman dressed in a black skirt and a flowered blouse.

loans.use: fishing nets, awnings, and to finish paying off a truck she will use to sell cheese.

loans.name: Betty Walquidia

texts.es:
La Joven Betty  de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo  en la ciudad  de Choluteca al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 5 años  al negocio de venta de ropa usada  sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que trabajan en el proyecto de las plantas solares.
Betty también se traslada a vender a las meloneras los fines de semana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  ropa usada como blusas, vestido, camisas, pantalones, etc.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo  desea salir adelante con su negocio y así aumentar las ventas del mismo para poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Uno de sus sueños es tener un local para vender sus productos.

Choluteca, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Betty is a young lady of 28; she lives with her husband and their son in the city of Choluteca in southern Honduras; for five years she has had a business selling used clothing to her neighbors and people who work at the solar plant project.  

Betty also travels to sell to the melon venders on the weekends.  She is requesting this loan to buy used clothing, such as blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, etc.  With the support of this lon she wants to move forward with her business while increasing her sales so she can keep supporting her family.  

One of her dreams is to have a shop where she can sell her goods. 

Choluteca, Honduras - May, 2015.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business

loans.name: Yessi Viginia

texts.es:
La Joven Yessi  de 25 años de edad,  es soltera es bien trabajadora y honesta  tiene el apoyo total de su mama y vive en la ciudad  de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Yessi, se dedica desde hace 1 año  al negocio de venta de cosméticos sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que viven en su misma comunidad, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de lociones, champo, cremas, perfumes, lis tic. Sombras, etc.
Yessi espera que con esta inversión su negocio crezca y poder seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar, uno de sus sueños es también dedicarse a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y tener su propio local.


Choluteca, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
The young woman Yessi, 25 years old, is single, very hard-working, and honest. She has the total support of her mom and lives in the city of Choluteca in the south of Honduras.

Yessi has sold cosmetics for 1 year. Her customers are her neighbors and people who live in her community. She is asking for the loan in order to buy lotions, shampoo, creams, lipstick, eyeshadow, etc.

Yessi hopes that with this investment her business will grow and she will be able to continue supporting her family at home. One of her dreams is to also sell clothing of all kinds and have her own store.

Choluteca, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: to buy lotions, shampoo, creams, perfumes, lipstick, eyeshadow, etc., for her business

loans.name: Sandra Lisseth

texts.es:
Sandra, se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva maíz, con las cosechas alimenta a su familia y comercializa el resto para cubrir otras necesidades de su familia, además vende antojitos; ella es casada y vive con su esposo e hijos, su pareja es empleado y en su tiempo libre le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz, espera contar con los materiales que necesita para que sus cultivos tengan un buen desarrollo y así lograr una cosecha abundante, con la que tendrá mejores ingresos que respaldaran el pago de la deuda.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar la productividad de su negocio y tener estabilidad financiera.
texts.en:
Sandra works in agriculture. She grows corn. She feeds her family with the harvest and sells the rest to cover other needs of her family. She also sells snacks. She is married and lives with her husband and children. Her partner is employed and in his free time he helps her with the farm work.

She will invest in agricultural supplies in order to grow corn. She hopes to have the materials she needs so that her crops will develop well and she will thus achieve an abundant harvest. With that, she will have a better income that will support payment of the debt.

Her aspirations are to improve her business' productivity and to have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow corn. She hopes to have the materials she needs so that her crops develop well.

loans.name: Heri

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Heri, one of Ruma’s agents. Heri lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. He and his wife have one son. Heri owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He has already joined Ruma for almost a year. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive who came to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business in technology. Heri is a kind and hardworking person. His community sees him as a trusted and informative mobile provider.

As the business grows, Heri is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far apart they are. Having known about this importance, your loan will be very useful to help Heri improve his business and accordingly, his community which needs access to such services. Heri's goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to provide an e-commerce service for his community, so his community can buy products with better prices. As seen in the photo, Heri is the one who is sitting in front of his own stall. He thanks you for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Bertha De Jesus

texts.es:
Bertha, vende tortillas, práctica la agricultura y la crianza de ganado, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, junto a su esposo trabajan diariamente para sostener su hogar, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, Bertha ya tiene mucho tiempo desempeñando estas actividades.
Invertirá en abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla para cultivar maíz, se limitara a comprar lo necesario para cultivar y así podrá generar mejores ingresos con los que resarcirá su deuda y apoyara en los gastos de su hogar.
Sus sueños son tener cosechas abundantes, darle a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Bertha sells tortillas, works in farming and livestock raising, and lives with her husband and their four children.  She and her husband work together every day to support their household; her husband works in construction; Bertha has had her business for a long time now.  

She will invest in fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, and seed to grow corn; she will limit herself to buying what she needs for her crop so she can generate more income, which she will use to repay her debt and cover her household expenses. 

Her dreams are to have abundant harvests and to give her family better food, clothing, and health.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer, insecticides, herbicide, and seed to plant corn.  She will limit herself to buying what she needs for her crop.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan through NWTF to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 in order to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lilibeth dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Yovani Rene

texts.es:
Yovani, está acompañado, junto a su pareja han procreado tres hijos, viven en casa de la mamá de su compañera de vida desde hace 2 años, práctica la agricultura, específicamente el cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene su propio negocio desde hace 3 años, el oficio lo aprendió con la guía de su papá.
Utilizará el capital para comprar fertilizantes, semillas mejoradas (de maíz y frijol), abono e insecticidas para poder cultivar una manzana de tierra, tendrá todo listo para su próxima siembra, vive en una zona muy favorable para los cultivos.
Sus objetivos son obtener una cosecha abundante, mejorar la alimentación de su familia y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Yovani is married. He and his wife have three children. They have lived in his mother-in-law's home for the last two years. Yovani works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans. He has had his own business for the last three years. Yovani learned his trade under his father's guidance.

Yovani will use this capital to purchase fertilizer, improved seeds (corn and bean), compost and insecticide to be able to plant a block of land. He will have everything ready for the next planting. Yovani lives in an area that is quite favorable for growing crops.

Yovani's objectives are to have an abundant harvest, to improve his family's diet and to pay off his debt.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, improved seeds (corn and bean), compost and insecticides so he can plant a block of land.

loans.name: Mary Lisa

texts.en:
Mary Lisa is 61 years old, married and has one child. She and her husband grow bananas to earn a living. Income from the bananas helps cover their daily needs.

In a desire to better their income she decided to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner GDMPC. With it she will pay for labor to harvest their bananas.

Mary Lisa is working to increase her banana harvest so she can fill more orders. Her plan for the future is to buy a motorcycle with a sidecar to use in delivering the bananas.

loans.use: to pay for labor to harvest their bananas.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 50 years old and married with two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Norma has been doing pig fattening for 15 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 12 years now.

Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fiama

texts.es:
La Joven Fiama de 22 años de edad,  es soltera es bien trabajadora y honesta  tiene el apoyo total de su mama  y vive en la ciudad  de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Fiama se dedica desde hace 5 años  al negocio de venta de ropa usada  sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que viven cerca de su comunidad, también se traslada a vender a las meloneras los fines de semana.
Fiama está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  ropa como blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, chores, etc.   Con el apoyo de este préstamo desea salir adelante con su negocio y aumentar sus ventas.
 Su sueño es tener un local para vender sus productos y poder ampliarlo.

Choluteca, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
This young woman, Fiama, is 22 years old. She is single, hard-working, and honest. She has her mother's full support, and she lives in the city of Choluteca in the south of Honduras. 

For the past 5 years, Fiama has made a living selling used clothing. Her customers are neighbors and people who live close to her community. In addition, she travels to sell to market vendors on weekends. 

Fiama is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, shorts, etc. With the help of this loan, she hopes to move forward with her business and to increase her sales. Her dream is to have a local where she can sell her products and to expand her business.

Choluteca, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, shorts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Carmensita

texts.en:
Carmensita is 39 years old, married and has three children to provide for. She is engaged in pineapple production to earn a living and it is a good business for the family. This business has existed for six years already. She aims for a better income for the family so she decided to avail a loan to buy fertilizer for her pineapple plants to produce a good harvest.

Carmensita's plan for the future is to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the pineapple farm.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a mother of two children at the age of 60. She wants to help her husband earn a living so she is engaged in banana production while her husband is a driver. She aims for a better income so she borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for the banana plants to produce a good quality of bananas and have a good harvest to generate more income.

Merlita plans in the future to buy a new motorcycle to use in delivering their bananas to the market.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Roche

texts.en:
Roche is 33 years old and married with two children. With both of her children currently in school, Roche works very hard to provide for them.

Roche runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. to sell.

Roche has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cereals, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Roche would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, and cereal to sell

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es:
Los Lirios es el nombre de un grupo formado en una pequeña pero hospitalaria comunidad ubicada en el Estado de México. Los miembros se sienten muy orgullosos de pertenecer a dicha comunidad ya que conservan la lengua y tradiciones mazahuas. La mayor parte de la población se dedica a la agricultura; el maíz es el producto más cosechado y más apreciado por los habitantes. Otra actividad importante es la cría y venta de ganado, en especial ovinos. 
   Doña Refugia es una mujer ejemplar, siempre tiene energía para trabajar y ayudar a su familia. Está casada con don Maximiliano desde hace cuarenta y seis años y tuvieron siete hijos quienes ahora son independientes. Actualmente tienen a su cargo a una pequeña nieta.
   Al no haber ningún negocio que ofreciera abarrotes cerca de su hogar, doña Refugia y su esposo decidieron abrir su propia tienda; la han mantenido durante treinta y cinco años consecutivos. "Realmente nos iba muy bien en las ventas porque todas las personas de la comunidad nos compraban" recuerda con entusiasmo. Ahora solicita un préstamo para comprar más productos de abarrotes como leche, pan, huevo, refrescos y productos enlatados, entre otros y mantener la variedad para elevar sus ventas.
   Desafortunadamente, don Maximiliano ha perdido la vista por lo que Refugia se encarga de atender el negocio de abarrotes y su molino de nixtamal quien rentan a las personas de su comunidad. "El tratamiento de mi esposo es muy caro y  también debo solventar los gastos de mi niña por eso trabajaré mucho y sacaré adelante mi tienda de abarrotes". Para Refugia, sus pequeñas actividades económicas son la manera de cumplir con sus metas. 
   Los demás miembros del grupo Los Lirios son Eleida quien invertirá en la compra de borregos y becerros, Laura en pollos, Cecilia en cimbra, María del Refugio en tienda y borregos a su vez Leticia en ropa.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco municipal, Doña Refugia es quien viste el suéter morado
texts.en:
Los Lirios is the name of a group formed in a small but hospitable community in the State of Mexico. The members feel proud to belong to this community which has conserved it's language and Mazahuas traditions. Most of the population works in agriculture, corn is the most harvested crop and much appreciated by the inhabitants. Another important business is raising and selling livestock, especially sheep.

Refugia is an exemplary woman, who always has energy to work and to help her family. She has been married to Maximiliano for 46 years and has 7 children who are all now independent. She has one small grandchild she is taking care of. As there was no business that offered groceries close to their house, Refugia and her husband decided to open their own store which they have operated for 35 years now. "Sales really are going well for us because all the people in our community buy from us", she recalls with enthusiasm.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy more grocery products like milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks and canned goods amongst others and maintain her variety to elevate her sales. Unfortunately Maximiliano has lost his sight so Refugia has taken charge of taking care of the grocery store business and her nixtamal (corn) mill which she rents to people in the community. "The treatment for my husband is very expensive and I also have to pay for my granddaughter's expenses so I have to work hard and get my grocery store ahead". For Refugia her small businesses are a way to achieve her goals.

The other members of the "Los Lirios" communal bank are Eleida who will invest in buying sheep and calves, Laura in chickens, Cecilia in frames, María del Refugio in her store and sheep and Leticia in clothing. The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal bandstand. Refugia is wearing a purple sweater.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks and canned goods.

location.town: Santa Cruz Mextepec, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Unise

texts.en:
Unise is 39 years old, married and has four children. She is engaged in a piggery business as a source of living with the help of her husband who is working abroad. Unise wants to have a better income to provide her children with a good life. So she decided to borrow a loan to buy feed for the pigs to have a good quality of pigs and be able to sell them in the market to generate a good income.

Unise's plan for the future is to save money to help her family to sustain their needs even if her husband stops working abroad.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann is 22 years old and single. 

Rose Ann is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Rose Ann has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Rose Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Terraclear

texts.en:
In Laos, nearly half of the population lacks access to safe drinking water, causing widespread waterborne illness. TerraClear is a social enterprise with the mission to increase access to safe drinking water, especially in remote households. Since 2010, TerraClear has been locally manufacturing ceramic water filters, which provide effective and long-term household access to clean water. 
 
TerraClear's success has been built on promoting an affordable and easy to use product with an innovative design. TerraClear became a Kiva Field partner at the beginning of the year to increase its outreach and provide these water filters to its end users. Ceramic Water Filters have helped over 40,000 families to access clean water in Laos.  
 
Currently, TerraClear is scaling up production and delivery to more remote areas. To achieve this, Kiva has partnered with Nexus Carbon for Development to provide a loan of $24,000 to TerraClear to purchase a second delivery truck to service remote households of Laos with safe drinking water. TerraClear recently purchased its first new truck – made possible by the generous support of the Kiva community – which is already helping to bring clean, safe drinking water to over 500 people across rural Laos every week.  
 
The second truck will allow TerraClear to transport 120-130 water filter sets per trip, which will reduce the number of trips from the provinces back to the distribution center. This will dramatically increase the number of filters reaching households every week.  
 
As TerraClear is scaling-up, this investment will require some time to produce returns. The loan has been structured with two repayment dates with the expectation that lenders could get paid back earlier if TerraClear produces results quicker than anticipated.  
 
Pictures displayed in the profile show TerraClear's staff and end users who have received water filters.
 
For more information about TerraClear and safe water in Laos, go to https://www.facebook.com/pages/Nexus-c4d/339349449574898?sk=info or www.laowater.org

loans.use: to purchase a delivery truck to deliver water filters to remote areas of Laos.

loans.name: Virly

texts.en:
Virly is 60 years old, married, and has four children to provide for. She runs a ready-to-wear business to earn a living.

She has been in this business for two years already, and it has been a source of income for the family because it helps them a lot in providing their family needs.

She aims for a better income; that's why she borrowed a loan to buy more ready-to-wear items to sell. Having more sales, she can generate more income.

With profits from her business, Virly wants to invest in another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, vive con su esposa de 30 años de edad y un pequeño hijo de 7 años de edad, ambos dependen de él; Wilfredo se pasa sus días atendiendo su negocio de venta de ropa y enseres del hogar, lo fundo hace más de 4 años, lo aprendió con ayuda de su hermano, de esta manera puede tener recursos para solventar sus compromisos.
Necesita capital para comprar hamacas, licuadoras, planchas y prendas de vestir, incrementara su inventario con nuevos productos que le sean de ayuda para atraer más clientes, su objetivo es seguir trabajando para tener una mejora calidad de vida junto a su familia.
Su propósito es saber administrar el crédito y las ganancias que le genere para tener un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Wilfredo lives with his wife, who is 30, and a small son, who is 7. Both of them depend on him. Wilfredo spends his days looking after his business selling clothing and household goods. He started it more than 4 years ago and he learned the business with the help of his brother. This way he can have resources to cover his obligations.

He needs capital in order to buy hammocks, blenders, irons, and clothing. He will increase his inventory with new products that will be helpful to him for attracting new customers. His goal is to continue working in order to have a better quality of life along with his family.

His goal is to know how to manage the loan and the profits that it will generate for him in order to have a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, blenders, irons, and clothing. He will increase his inventory with new products that will be helpful to him for attracting new customers.

loans.name: Rosvilina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosvilina works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling firewood. Rosvilina is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell to her customers for her fruit vending business.

Rosvilina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy small fish and develop fish farming

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien, born in 1978, is a Thai ethnic woman living with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is from cultivation and breeding. The annual income is about VND 45 to 50 million, but after deducting costs, it is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and save a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coffee but her saving are not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her invest effectively in the coffee, and next year all coffee trees will be laden with fruit, hopefully bringing her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo  tiene 2 hijos vive en la comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 10 años  al negocio de venta de golosinas,  sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que viven en su misma comunidad.
Doña Teresa está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de papas, yuca, plátano verde, aceite, arroz, etc. para tener la materia prima necesaria para elaborar sus productos y así poder salir adelante con su familia.
 Uno de sus sueños es tener un local ubicado por el mercado para poder vender más.

Choluteca, Honduras  -  Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
Teresa is 35 years old and lives with her husband.  She has two children.  She lives in the community of Choluteca in southern Honduras.  For the last 10 years, she has made a living through her business selling snacks.  Her customers are neighbors and people who live in the same community.  

Teresa is requesting a loan for the purchase of potatoes, cassava, plantains, oil, rice, etc. to have the ingredients to prepare her products and in this way to be able to provide for her family.  

One of her dreams is to have a place by the market in order to be able to sell more.  

Choluteca, Honduras - May 2015.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, cassava, plantains, oil, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Las Vencedoras De 9 De Octubre Group

texts.es: La Sra. Amalia tiene 38 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Austin quien trabaja como albañil y con quien tiene 3 hijos que aun dependen de ellos. Es la presidenta de la alcancía comunal “LAS VENCEDORAS DE 9 DE OCTUBRE” conformada por 6 mujeres responsables que decidieron trabajar en quipo mediante el apoyo mutuo desde hace 1 año para ayudar en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Amalia es docente en una guardería, ya que tiene ese justo por enseñar y guiar a los niños, justamente es por esto que el préstamo lo invertirá en comprar materiales que necesita para poder implementar su propia guardería que tanto anhelo y así de esta manera tiene pensado abrir otras guarderías en los lugares donde más lo necesiten los niños. En la foto grupal la Sra. Amalia se encuentra de pie en medio de las demás señoras sentadas.
texts.en:
Amalia is 38 years old and is married to Austin who works as a builder, and with whom she has three dependent children. She is the president of the communal bank "LAS VENCEDORAS DE 9 DE OCTUBRE" made up of six responsible women who a year ago decided to work as a team with mutual support to help improve the quality of life of their families.

Amalia is a teacher in a nursery, teaching and guiding children, and it is for this reason that she will invest the loan in buying materials that she need to be able to open her own nursery that she has longed to do. She is also planning to open other nurseries in locations most needed by the children. 

In the group photo Amalia is standing in the middle of the other women who are seated.

loans.use: to buy materials for a nursery.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. She is a load retailer in their village and has sold prepaid load for two years. Merlita hopes to continue the service to the people in her village. 

She requests 5,000 PHP to buy prepaid load (autoloadmax) to sell. She hopes to continue improving her profits and save money for her children.

loans.use: to buy prepaid load (autoloadmax) to sell.

loans.name: La Casa Azul Group

texts.es:
La cultura mazahua se desarrolló en varias comunidades del Estado de México en las cuales los habitantes aún entablan conversaciones en esta lengua indígena. Las tradiciones son también son muy apreciadas como el respeto, por lo que no es raro recibir un saludo incluso hasta de personas desconocidas que desean un buen día.
   En una de estas comunidades se conformó el grupo La Casa Azul cuyos integrantes están muy entusiasmados por la oportunidad que VisionFund les brinda para hacer crecer sus negocios y actividades. 
   Doña Apolonia está casada  desde hace veintiséis años con don Esteban quien trabaja en el campo además de ser comerciante; juntos han formado una familia con nueve hijos de los cuales cinco aún dependen de ellos y cuatro de ellos son menores de edad y continúan con sus estudios.
   Desde hace doce años, Apolonia se dedica a comprar y vender artículos para el hogar, se unió a la actividad de su esposo, ya que la desempeñaba desde antes de conocerla. "Nuestros gastos aumentaban cada vez más por eso mismo decidí ayudarlo; me surtió mercancía para que pudiera vender independientemente y con eso pude ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de mis niños" comentó Doña Apolonia. 
   Actualmente, la pareja vende la mercancía de manera ambulante en la Ciudad de México, lo que les genera más ganancias. El estar viajando constantemente les representa un gran reto, pero el ver los frutos de su esfuerzo los motiva para seguir adelante. 
   El sueño de Apolonia es poder mejorar su vivienda construyendo aplanados y ventanas "quiero además seguir ayudando a mis hijos en sus estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional" comentó con entusiasmo.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo Casa Azul son Santos quien invierte en cucharas y discos, Eva en cimbra y Hermelinda en invernadero de jitomates.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el invernadero de Doña Hermelinda, Doña Apolonia es quien viste la playera azul*
texts.en:
The Mazahua culture developed in various community within the State of Mexico. The residents of these communities still strike up conversations in their native language. They value their traditions highly, for example being respectful. It's not uncommon to be greeted by a stranger wishing you a pleasant day.

The "La Casa Azul" (The Blue House) communal bank started in one of these areas. The communal bank members are very enthusiastic about the opportunity VisionFund is offering them to grow their businesses and activities.

Doña Apolonia has been married to don Esteban for twenty-six years. Don Esteban works in the fields and also as a store keeper. Together, they have formed a family with nine children. Five of their children are still dependent on them, and four of them are young and still go to school.

For the last twelve years, doña Apolonia has made her living buying and selling household goods. She tied her business to her husband's, as he had his business before they met. "Our expenses keep going up, and that is why I decided to help him. He supplied with merchandise so that I could sell it independently. With that, I could help with the household expenses and my children's education," says doña Apolonia.

The couple currently sells their merchandise as street vendors in Mexico City, which generates a better profit for them. Traveling constantly presents them with a great challenge, but seeing the fruits of their hard work motivates them to keep moving forward.

Doña Apolonia's dream is to be able to make improvements to their home by building drains and windows. "I want to keep helping my children in their studies so they can become professionals," she says excitedly.

The other members of the Casa Azul communal bank are Santos, who invests in spoons and CDs; Eva, who invests in scaffolding; and Hermelinda, who invests in a tomato greenhouse. *The above photograph was taken in doña Hermelinda's greenhouse. Doña Apolonia is the one wearing a blue t-shirt.*

loans.use: to purchase spoons, forks, tumblers etc.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es un hombre de 57 años de edad, es soltero y tiene una linda familia de nueve hijos de las edades entre 8 y 30 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Pixabaj.
Gilberto para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace quince años, gracias a esta labor ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.
Gilberto desde hace algunos días a construido su casa y que ahora ya solo le hace falta sus puertas y ventanas, pero él no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprarlos, pero a Gilberto le urge que su casa quede  con sus puertas y ventas, por tal razón solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Gilberto es poder terminar la construcción de su casa para darle a su familia un mejor hogar.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a 57-year-old man. He is single and has a beautiful family of nine children between 8 and 30 years of age. This humble family lives in a community in the small town of Pixabaj.

Gilberto, in order to obtain income and move his family forward, has been a farmer for fifteen years. Thanks to this work, he has moved his children forward.

As of several days ago, Gilberto has built his house. Now all he needs is the doors and windows, but he does not have the money necessary to buy them. However, Gilberto urgently needs his house to have doors and windows. For this reason he is asking for a loan in order to be able to cover this necessity.

Gilberto's great dream is to be able to finish the construction of his house in order to give his family a better home.

loans.use: to buy windows and doors

loans.name: Liem's Group

texts.en:
Liem was born in 1977 and joined M7-MFI’s forerunner program in  January 1998. Her family consists of her husband,  two sons and herself. They live in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family cultivates 1.2 hectare of  corn and 2000 square meters of rice. The income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount of money. She has to spend  money on her children’s education and her savings is not enough to buy corn for the next crop. 

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and hopes that the loan will help her to buy good corn and then it will bring her family an abundant crop.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Cinthia Mabel

texts.es:
La joven Cinthia  de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo y  tiene  dos hijos que dependen de ambos, vive en casa propia  en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 5  años  al negocio de la venta de ropa nueva.
Doña Cinthia su venta es de forma ambulante  es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa nueva como blusas, vestidos, faldas, camisas, pantalones, chores, sandalias, etc.  Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su deseo es tener buen surtido de ropa, es su quinto préstamo que solicita. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2015.
texts.en:
The young woman Cinthia, 24 years old, lives with her husband and has two children who depend on both of them. She lives in her own house in a community in San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras. For 5 years she has had a business selling new clothing.

Cinthia sells door-to-door. She is a hard-working woman with a desire to move forward.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy new clothing such as blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, shorts, sandals, etc. With the help of this loan she hopes to improve her income and thus her quality of life. She is happy to continue working with Prisma and her desire is to have a good supply of clothing. This is the fifth loan she has requested.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, shirts, pants, shorts, sandals, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. She has operated a profitable sari-saris store for 4 years.   

She aims for a better income and requests a loan to buy inventory items and have more sales and create more income.

Lanie plans  to save money from her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheels, spare parts, and motorcycle accessories.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 65 years old and married with three children. He wanted a better life for his children, so he started a sari-sari store business with the help of his wife. It has been a good business for the family, and it has been in existence for 10 years already.

Joel aims for a better income, so he decided to avail himself of a loan at GDMPC to buy more goods to sell. Being able to increase his store inventory means he can create more sales to result in more income.

Joel's plan for the future is to save money out from his business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Suyen

texts.en:
Suyen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Suyen is 35 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Suyen has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Suyen requested a 15,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Suyen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Suyen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Rosemarie requested a 20,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for 27 years now.

Rosemarie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, vive en casa propia en compañía de su esposa y cuatro hijos, tres de ellos están estudiando nivel básico, su familia no cuenta con apoyo económico del extranjero. Su negocio consiste en trabajar en la agricultura, específicamente cultivando maíz y frijol, actividad que desarrolla desde hace 20 años, ofició que aprendió de sus padres, inicio costeando los gastos de su negocio con fondos propios, a medida que estaba creciendo tomo la decisión de solicitar créditos para ir prosperando.
Comprará insumos agrícolas y pagara a obreros para que poden el terreno en el que realiza la siembra, espera tener todo listo para cuando llegue el invierno y así lograr que sus cosechas sean más abundantes y las plagas nos las afecten.
Sus objetivos son aumentar la producción de granos básicos para almacenar una parte para alimentación familiar y la otra para generar los ingresos con los que cancelara su deuda y reparará su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives in his own house in the company of his wife and four children. Three of them are studying and the family has no economic support from abroad. His business consists of working in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans. He has been doing this for 20 years, work that he learned from his parents. He started paying the expenses with his own money and as he grew he took the decision to request loans to become prosperous.

He will buy agricultural inputs and pay laborers to clear his fields. hoping to have everything ready when winter comes. He hopes to have much more abundant harvests and avoid having infestations. His goal is to augment his production of basic grains to store part of it to feed his family and the rest to generate income to pay off his debt and to fix his house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay workers to clear the land where he will plant, hoping to have everything ready when winter comes.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a 41-year-old married woman with six children. She lives in a rural community on the island Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands.

Serah has a small garden to grow corn, potatoes, and cabbage and has sold to her community for two years.

She needs a loan to buy seeds and spray cans for her business. She plans to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses.

Prudence joined SPBD in year 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and a spray can for her farming business.

loans.name: Gs Los Triunfadores Group

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco tiene 31 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos, convive con su compañera de hogar. Su actividad es la caficultura y tambien se dedica a la siembra de maiz y frijoles,  su finca  esta ubicada en la Aldea de Germania Arriba al oriente de Honduras,
Don Francisco su sueño  es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, con el credito que esta solicitando podra obtener l aplanta solar,  Don Francisco ha soñado esde hace tiempo tener energia en su casa, este sueño se le ara realidad con el apoyo de la Microfinanciera Prisma de Honduras y KIVA. Don Francisco quiere darles la oportunidad a su familia de tener energia electrica en su hogar y darles acceso a el uso de aparatos electronicos.
Don Francisco solicita el credito con Idriss  y Rony quienes se dedican a la caficultura.



                                                                             Trojes, Honduras Abril 2015
texts.en:
Francisco is 31 years old. He is the father of three sons and lives with his common law wife. He works in the coffee industry and is also dedicated to planting corn and beans. His farm is located in the village of Germania in eastern Honduras.

Francisco's dream is to improve his family's living conditions. With the loan he is requesting, he could buy a solar plant. He has dreamed of having solar energy for his house for some time. He will make this dream a reality with the support of Kiva partner Prism of Honduras and KIVA. Francisco wants to give his family the opportunity to have electricity in their home and give them access to use electronic devices.

Francisco is requesting this loan along with Idriss and Rony, who work in coffee production.

Trojes, Honduras April 2015

loans.use: buy a solar plant for his home.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 42-year-old mother with one child. They live in a rural community and manage a small retail store. Due to problems and family conflicts, she was separated from her husband. Despite this, she is determined to give her family a better life. 

She wishes to improve her small retail store but she has inadequate capital. She is requesting 12,000.00 PHP to buy soft drinks, noodles, bread, frozen foods, beverages, and seasonings to resell. She believes that she will someday further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy  soft drinks, noodles, bread, frozen foods, beverages and seasonings to resell.

location.town: Brgy. San Antonio South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sabelita

texts.en:
Sabelita is a 53-year-old married woman who is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sabelita has sold firewood for 5 years and requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase firewood to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Sabelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase  firewood to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, three attend school.

Susana has raised pigs for 3 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bread, oil, snacks, juices, water etc to stock his shop. He will also buy discs, belts, grease and a set of keys for his corn mill.
